description: The Chrysler Corporation's dreams of displacing the Ford Motor Company as the nation's No. 2 auto maker are no more than a memory, but last week in a move clearly calculated to demonstrate that Chrysler's new president, Lee A. Iacocca, was in the saddle the No. 3 car manufacturer stole a march on its rival. Mr. Iacocca announced that Chrysler was switching all its automotive advertising, some $120 million a year, to Kenyon 8: Eckhardt.

title: POLITICS
description: HARTFORD

title: Plan to Dredge in Connecticut Roils Long Island Officials
description: STAMFORD

title: High Sounds and Silences
description: THE printed scores of Anton von Webern's compositions could be pictures of the views from the Alpine mountain peaks he loved. Empty spaces of silence are punctuated here and there by isolated notes passed among the staves. Vocal lines are jagged, rocky, encompassing octaves in a single measure. There is little contact with the ground. The scores seem images of the kind of music Webern thought a Beethoven of our day would write, music that a man writes in solitude, far away from all turmoil of the world, in contemplation of the glaciers, of eternal ice and snow, of the sombre mountain giants.

title: A Diaghilev Celebration
description: To commemorate the 50th anniversary of the death of Serge Diaghilev, the formidable Russian impresario and creator of the Ballets Russes, Rudolf Nureyev will join the Joffrey Ballet for a tribute entitled Homage to Diaghilev at the Mark Bellinger Theater from March 7 through April 1. There are four ballets on the program, with Mr. Nureyev in three Nijinsky roles.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: ONE of the most unpleasant sights a homeowner can see is water all over his basement floor  but unfortunately many homeowners have had to deal with this unpleasant experience during

title: Gay Meighan Plans April Bridal
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Hunter Meighan of the engagement of their daughter. Gay Meighan, to John Dawson Corning, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Townsend Corning. Both families are of Mamaroneck. N.Y. An April wedding planned.

title: Rumson Inherits Jersey City Tradition
description: RUMSON

title: One FolkSong Fete May Inspire Another
description: GREAT NECK

title: How to Grow Tomatoes On a Small Balcony
description: Living in an apartment does not restrict salads to plastic grocery tomatoes or necessitate rides out to the country for garden fresh ones. With a couple of four gallon containers and the right approach, you can be grow tomatoes on a balcony  more than you and your friends can eat.

title: Spotting Whales, Eagles and Icebergs on a Ferry to Alaska
description: A Park Service ranger pointed out a whale, three porpoises, two bald eagles in full flight and a third eagle in its nest as the Columbia, a ferryboat run by the Alaska Marine Highway System, sailed through a 20mile stretch of the Inland Passage called the Wrangell Narrows. A short time later, a glacier and an iceberg came into view.

title: Brian O'Keefe Will Wed Cristina Rossi in Spring
description: Dr. and Mrs. Mario B. Rossi of Laurel Hollow, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Cristina Maria Rossi, to Brian M. O'Keefe, son of Mr. and Mrs. Francis O'Keefe of Wilton, Conn. A spring wedding is planned.

title: Ouadriplegic Gets $3.1 Million
description: LOS ANGELES, March 3 (UPI)  A man who became a quadriplegic as a result of a traffic accident has been awarded a $3.1 million judgment by a Superior Court Jury. The judgment Thursday was against the Volkswagen Company and against Jonathan Green, driver of a car that collided with the 1958 Volkswagen driven by Lawrence Taylor, now 26 years old. Mr. Taylor was ejected from his car when the door popped open. The jury held that the Volkswagen had a door defect

title: 8 MORE ARRESTED IN SUBWAY VIOLENCE
description: Four juveniles and four men were arrested in subway incidents in the Bronx, Manhattan and Queens yesterday in new robbery and sexualabuse crimes, the transit police reported.

title: War in Indochina At a Turning Point
description: Whether Vietnam had been taught its lesson was doubtful, but the Chinese last week seemed about ready to say so and suspend instruction. Besides, more paddling could be risky.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Hype Dream
description: AVING SENT up the famous New York restaurant of the title, its literary, journalistic and showbusiness clientele, the Watergate investigation and much else, Murder at Elaine's finally sends itself up, leaving behind impressions as fragmentary as an opium dream, which is perhaps as it should be.

title: THEATER
description: STAMFORD

title: Jane Hewitt Is Wed To Thomas Cotton
description: Jane EIizabeth Hewitt and Thomas Carroll Cotton were married yesterday in the Episcopal Church of the Epiphany in Honolulu. The Rey. Peter Van Horn performed the ceremony.

title: Princeton's Eating Clubs Facing Challenges on Male Membership
description: PRINCETON, N.J.  Three allmale undergraduate eating clubs at Princeton University are facing a pair of challenges j to the way they select their members.

title: More Are Seen Saving Water In Ration Plan
description: LOS ANGELES, March 3  People will conserve a scarce resource more willingly and enthusiastically under a rigorous control program than one of bland exhortation, a study of California's 197778 drought has found.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: Because 800 people die each year in fires involving upholstered furniture 500 caused by careless smokers  the staff of the Federal Consumer Product Safety Commission proposed mandatory flammability standards last November that would raise furniture prices nationwide. Manufacturers said the standards would add $100 to the price of $400 sofa; the Federal staff put the increase closer to $10.

title: NATO's Secretary Acknowledges His Name Was on a Nazi Roster
description: AMSTERDAM, March 3 (Reuters) The Secretary General of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, Joseph M. A. H. Luns, has acknowledged that his name was entered on a membership roll of the Dutch Nazi Party during the 1930's, but he said that he never took part in Nazi activities.

title: Move Pressed to End Labeling of Pupils
description: TRENTON

title: County Executives Defend Their Ground
description: COUNTY government, currently under pressure to reduce taxes while providing services mandated by higher authorities, was defended last week by County Executive Alfred B. DelBello and other regional suburban leaders as still able to do the best job for the most people, if administered properly.

title: Daralyn L.Gordon, A Lawyer, Is Bride Of Dr. Joseph Arata
description: Daralyn Lou Gordon and Dr. Joseph Owen Arata were married yesterday in the Sir Christopher Wren Chapel at the College of William and Mary in Williamsburg, Va. The civil ceremony was performed by Dr. A. Rufus Tonelson, retired assistant to the president of Old Dominion University in Norfolk, Va., and a marriage commissioner in the State of Virginia.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In the engagement announcement of Elizabeth Robin Wofsey and Andrew Young Kleinman in The Times last Sunday, Miss Wofsey's last name was incorrectly given as Allen.

title: Drug Case Continues to Trouble Stabler
description: GULF SHORES, Ala., Feb. 28  As Councilman W.D. (Dubb) Hobbs danced down the sideline in his pink leotards and black cheerleader skirt, Kenny Stabler sank slowly to his knees and raised his arms heavenward in a comic gesture of supplication. The quarterback of the allgirl team coached by Stabler had just thrown an interception in the powderpuff football game that was part of the Mardi Gras celebration here yesterday.

title: BEAUTY: SHIFT TO THE SHEER
description: As fashion changes, so does makeup. This spring, makeup is brighter, clearer, more defined than it has been for several years.

title: Connors And Ashe In Final
description: MEMPHIS, March 3  There was good news and bad news tonight for the Arthur Ashe Marching and Shouter Society. The good news was that the thinkingman's tennis player reached the final of the United States Indoor Championships.

title: Engagements
description: HOYERBROWNSTEIN

title: Flying High
description: THERE are several million stories in World War II, and one would think that by now most of them had been told. But no, the novels continue to pour out, and the wave of true ultrasecret tales, loosed by the declassifying of various national archives, is just beginning to ebb.

title: Robyn Ann Simon Is Betrothed
description: The engagement of Robyn Ann Simon, daughter of Mrs. Herbert Simon of Harbor Isle, L.I., and the late Mr. Simon, to Jeffrey David Marks, son of Mr. and Mrs. Seymour Marks of East Meadow, L.I., has been announced by the prospective bride's mother.

title: Patricia Stephens Sets Spring Bridal
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Thomas J.R. Stephens of Newark, Del., of the engagement of their daughter, Patricia Ann Stephens, to Andrew Edward Thurman, son of Dr. William G. Thurman of Oklahoma City and Peggy B. Thurman of Charlottesville, Va.

title: Suit Filed Over StripSearches
description: CHICAGO, March 3 (AP)  The American Civil Liberties Union has filed a suit charging that the Chicago Police Department conducted at least 10,000 illegal stripsearches of women in the last five years. The classaction suit, filed in Federal District Court, seeks damages of $125,000 for each victim of the improper searches on the ground that the victims suffered degradation, humiliation and pain and were deprived of their constitutional rights.

title: Olympics for the Retarded Open In Catskills With 300 Competing
description: WOODRIDGE, N.Y., March 3 Kevin Peitler sat in an inflated inner tube and whooped in delight as it swept him down a snowy slope  a downhill racer in a very special competition.

title: ABOUT NEW JERSEY
description: BERGEN is probably the most bustling of New Jersey's 21 counties. It is one of the four original counties of the state, and people began settling there even before it was formally created as county in 1683. Today, Bergen has a population of one million people, which exceeds that of many of the 50 states.

title: Republican Hopefuls Tread The Carter Path to Iowa
description: CHICAGO  All that traffic out there in the frozen cornfields of Iowa should not suggest that the state has become a winter wonderland for tourists. Those are Republican candidates, or wouldbe candidates, or mightbe candidates, descending upon Des Moines and Davenport and Sioux City and Waterloo.

title: WESTCHESTER JOURNAL
description: CONNIE KIMBLE is administrative assistant to the Rev. Roger Johnson at the Scarsdale Congregational Church. Last Tuesday she received a telephone call at 3:30 P.M. That prompted her to tell a friend later that night: It's no wonder People don't want to get involved.

title: GARDENING
description: LAST week iceberg lettuce was 89 cents at the supermarket. That price put a salad essential in the luxury class and made the arrival of spring seem even more urgent. At least then the vegetable patch can be planted and a nearlyfree supply of fresh salad greens will be a reality.

title: Cuernavaca Offers Choice of Language Schools
description: Cuernavaca, known as the site of Malcolm Lowry's Under the Volcano, is also becoming recognized among Americans as the place to learn Spanish. There are seven language institutes in this city 90 minutes south of Mexico City, each with its own personality and approach. Most of them offer a selection of outside cultural activities to augment language classes.

title: Deaths
description: ARDSTONMariorie, on Feb 21, 1979. Beloved wife of Herbert, devoted mother of Jane Wind and Roger Ardston, dear grandmother of Stacy, Andrea, David, April and Clay.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: During April and May, woods wanderers throughout much of the Northeast, if diey are out at dawn, will often be fortunate enough to hear the impassioned gobble of a male wild turkey.

title: Nehemiah Disqualified in Trial
description: PRINCETON, N.J., March 3  Renaldo (Sheets) Nehemiah lost a hurdles race today to himself.

title: Rep. Reuss Urges Justice Dept. To Study Farm Protest Finances
description: WASHINGTON. March 3 (UPI)  Rep.. resentative Henry S. Reuss, Democrat of Wisconsin, wants the Justice Department to determine whether banks and tractor manufacturers helped finance the farmers tractor motorcade to Washington and whether they should be held responsible for damage caused by demonstrators.

title: Sam Shepard's Obsession Is America
description: Sam Shepard, two of whose plays are currently showing in New York, writes about American success and American failure This most prolific artist  he may be the author of over 100 plays; his agent has a list of 29 but she gets phone calls about others  writes about success and failure in a very different way and in a very different kind of play.

title: CONNECTICUT GUIDE
description: Duane Hanson's startlingly realistic sculpture of an overweight sunbather is the point of departure in Visions of the Sea, an exhibiton of marine art from 1550 to 1971, opening Wednesday at the Wadsworth Atheneum in Hartford. The Hanson work illustrates the diminishing importance of seascapes in 20thcentury marine painting and the decline of the whole form, said Richard Saunders, curator.

title: Magda Tagliaferro, at 87, Performs Piano Recital
description: PARIS, March 2  A piano recital that was, in its way, living history, wasplayed last in the Salle Gaveau by Magda Tagliaerro. She came on stage looking trim, er ect and chic, with copperred hair and a shimmering multistriped gown, and went through a demanding program of music by Chopin, Faure, Chabrier, Debussy and Schumann, playing everything with spirit and style.

title: The Old College Try Puts Nun to the Test
description: LODI

title: Newsboy Makes Headlines for Last Time
description: JOSEPH (NEWSBOY) MORIARTY made millions of dollars every year, but his idea of a big time was to visit the Times Square amusement arcades. He especially liked the flea circuses.

title: ANTIQUES
description: KILLING WORTH

title: Wine
description: It's part of a national anthem, two popes made jokes about it, Voltaire limned it and Noel Coward celebrated it on the stage.

title: Former Wife of George Wallace And Her Mother Flee House Fire
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., March 3 (AP)  Alabama's former First Lady, ComeHa Wallace, and her mother fled from a fire in Mrs. Wallace's home early today. No one was injured in the fire, which damaged the kitchen and attic.

title: Music: Debuts in Review
description: The installation of a splendid concert organ in AliceTully Hall a few years ago did not result in a rash of debut organ recitals there, but.a few brave souls have taken the risks involved, and the most recent of these is Ford Lallerstedt who appeared Feb. 24.

title: Other World Events
description: It was not the usual campaign kickoff. As the whiterun Parliament was dissolved in Salisbury, Rhodesian bombers attacked guerrilla bases in Angola and Mozambique last week in response to guerrilla threats to disrupt Rhodesia's April 20 elections. Rebel leader Robert Mugabe said the raids would not deter his forces.

title: CRMIE
description: Two procedurals about the New York Police Department are of special interest. One of them. NO BUSINESS BEING A COP by Lillian O'Donnell (Putnam's, $8.95), brings back Norah Mulcahaney, and the good news here is that the author has regained the form that made her lady cop one of the more interesting entrants when she was introduced about seven years ago. The other book, STARETT by Arthur V. Deutcsh (Arbor House, $8.95), is a first novel written by a police captain of the N.Y.P.D., and if nothing else it has the authenticity that only a working cop can bring to his backgrounds.

title: Cox Is Candidate for Judgeship On the Federal Court of Appeals
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (AP)  Archibald Cox, the former Watergate special prosecutor, is one of five candidates for a new judgeship on the United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit in New England.

title: 2 Held in Robbery at Cleaners; Ticket Said to Have Been Clue
description: Two men were arrested yesterday and charged with robbing an Upper West Side drycleaning establishment and shooting a clerk there, according to the police. One of the robbery suspects had earlier dropped off a shirt to be cleaned and pressed and was reported to have given his home address for the claim ticket.

title: Other National Events
description: Representative Charles Diggs will keep his House seat despite his conviction for pocketing staff salaries. The House last week voted overwhelmingly against ousting the Detroit Democrat, who is now free on appeal. Mr. Diggs seat was defended on grounds that it was conferred by the electorate, a position validated by the Supreme Court in 1969 when it ruled that the House had violated the Constitution in excluding Adam Clayton Powell; he also was accused of misusing public funds.

title: Long Beach Organizations Want Gambling as Way to Revive Area
description: FARMINGDALE, L.I., March 2  At the first of five statewide hearings to study the possible effects of casino gambling in New York, representatives of civic organizations in Long Beach, L.i. today told an 12member panel appointed by Governor Carey that the depressed area needed the economic help gambling would bring.

title: THE FEMININE SHAPE OF FASHION
description: After a year of shifts. twists, backward glances and jarring forward thrusts, fashion is settling into a silhouette that celebrates the female figure.

title: Iran Sees Signs Of Bad Old Days
description: Last week, for the first time since the revolution, Teheran's Qasr Prison Was full. Several more military and security officials, including an alleged torture expert of Savak, the Shah's secret police, were executed, without the knowledge of the Government of Prime Minister Mehdi Bazargan. A few petty thieves and imbibers of alcohol were flogged under Islamic codes that have not been written into Iranian law. Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, who returned to his religious base of Qum but obviously was not retiring from political life, demanded the removal of all European criteria built into the judicial system including the right of appeal. A referendum was promised for March 30 that will pose one loaded question: Should Iran return to a monarchy or have an Islamic republic? Last weekend, the Ayatollah met with the Soviet Ambassador to Iran  his first known meeting with a foreign envoy  without informing the Prime Minister or his Foreign Minister.

title: Park Slope and Chelsea, Yes
description: Urbanimprovement strategies come and go, and so do the refrains that express them. A decade ago only a vast infusion of Federal funds would enable cities like New York to rebuild ,its slums and prevent its declining neighborhoods from becoming new slums. Today, as such an infusion becomes less likely, given the inflationfighting spending cuts that are the order of the day in Washington, the theme increasingly heard is that the private sector must assume a major role in financing revival and preservation efforts in troubled urban neighborhoods.

title: Rumania Raises Family Benefits
description: VIENNA, March 3 (Reuters)  Rumania has transferred money from its military budget to pay increased family allowances. A decree published in Bucharest newspapers today said that the transfer of $41.5 million had enabled the state to raise monthly allowances by 8.3 cents a child as of March 1. Rumanian families can now receive from $6.50 to $23.75 in allowances for each child up to 16 years of age.

title: BACKLOGS STILL VEX JUDGES IN NEW YORK
description: On Justice Richard J. Bartlett's last day as statewide administrative judge last Wednesday, some of the New York State Supreme Court justices under his supervision were not doing very much in their courtrooms at 100 Centre Street in Manhattan.

title: Disney Studio Risks $175 Million on Black Hole
description: LOS ANGELES, March 3  The monster ship, every brass rib showing, floats in space. Along its endless corridors humans duel with humanoids, deadly and implacable. A behemoth on the edge of disaster, the ship drifts toward the vortex of THE BLACK HOLE. Beyond hope, beyond fear, beyond science  the most terrifying force in the universe. Nothing can escape it, not even light, proclaims the legend on the twominute commercial.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: ART

title: Neilson Returns,
description: TORONTO, March 3 (AP) The Toronto Maple Leafs owner, Harold Ballard, reinstated Roger Neilson as coach of his National Hockey League team tonight, and the players responded by defeating the Philadelphia Flyers, 43.

title: Ann F. Reiss Sets Wedding
description: Mr. and Mrs. John Lawshe Reiss of Morristown, N.J., and Dublin, N.H., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Ann Farrington Reiss, to Thomas Boylston Pell, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Wines Pell of St. Simons Island, Ga.

title: ABOUT CARS
description: PEOPLE want to know about a diesel's performance, said Paul May. That's the main thing that they ask, and we tell them the truth. A diesel doesn't have the pickup that a gas engine does, but the mileage they'll be getting will more than make up for the disadvantage.

title: DINING OUT
description: TRUTH in advertising is a virtue more restaurateurs might practice, so that catchphrases like fresh, homemade, our famous and cooked to order might be more than meaningless hyperbole. It is, then, always encouraging to find a restaurant like Edmondo's where the owners, Edmond and Tina Ciminatti, take a special pride in calling their place an Italian seafood restaurant, and where words like fresh and homemade mean what they sav.

title: The Region
description: In Summary

title: UConn Five Stymies Rhode Island, 5850
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., March 3 (UPI)  Cornelius Thompson scored 16 points and Jeff Carr added 10 of his 12 points in the second half today to give Connecticut a 5850 victory over Rhode Island in the Eastern College Athletic Conference New England regional basketball championship.

title: Communities Start to Challenge Gawdy Displays By Retailers
description: A large painted metallic sign covers over delicately chiseled limestone co:umns. A plateglass display window encloses a porch. A stucco facade for a restaurant obliterates its neighbors masonry and mansard detailing.

title: Black Leaders Reject Koch Recall
description: Despite differences with Mayor Koch, New York City's major black political leaders say they are not participating in an effort to amend the City Charter to include a mechanism for the recall of the Mayor and other city officials.

title: Play by Pontiff Is Given Debut On Air in Italy
description: ROME, March 3  The Jewelers Shop, a tender moralistic play about love and the meaning of marriage written 19 years ago by Pope John Paul 11, made its world debut on Italian radio Chic week translated from the Polish.

title: Marilyn E. Murphy And H.A. Jerry 3d, Lawyers, Are Wed
description: The Roman Catholic Church of the Gesu in University Heights, Cleveland, was the setting at noon yesterday for the marriage of Marilyn Elaine Murphy, daughter of Mrs. Robert Kline Huston of Cleveland and the late Vincent R. Murphy Jr., to Harold Anderson Jerry 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jerry Jr. of Delmar, N.Y. The Rev. Joseph A. Muenzerpastor of the church, performed the ceremony.

title: First Lady, Despite Advice, Goes To Dinner, and Her Fever Abates
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (AP)  Rosalynn Carter was reported feeling better today after she ignored her doctor's advice and attended a Sabbath dinner with Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel.

title: On Language
description: The F.B.I.'s list of Ten Most Wanted Criminals mug shots on display at your local post office owes its origin to the fashion industry in New York. In 1940. fashion publicist Eleanor Lambert turned a French promotion into an international survey: The Ten Best Dressed Women. In 1950, Miss Lambert's husband, the late Seymour Berkson, then head of the International News Service, sent 1.N.S. rewrite man James Lee to the F.B.I. with the catchy Ten Most Wanted Criminals idea; three decades later, both lists are going strong.

title: Design
description: What makes a product beautiful? Functional, graceful design, quality materials, precise production. Simple as ABC, really, but a rigorous sort of simplicity that is lost on the creators of most products made in the U.S.A.

title: President Seeks Conservation Authority as Gasoline Prices Soar.
description: The disruption of peiroleum production in Iran, a boulder thrown into the international pool of oil supplies, last week was making waves around the world. In the United States, gasoline prices were soaring amid fears of further shortages as the Carter Administration announced proposed conservation measures and the President sought authority from Congress to impose them.

title: New Faces For Grasso's New Term
description: HARTFORD

title: SUNY Considers Compromise on Calendar
description: PURCHASE

title: Diana R. Newman And J.P. Eyster 2d Will Marry June 17
description: Mr. and Mrs. Wilbur R. Newman of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Diana R. Newman, to James Parry Eyster 2d, also of New York. He is the son of Mr. Eyster of Palm Beach, Fla., and the late Elizabeth Nelson Eyster.

title: BRIDGE
description: Every experienced player understands the general principle of suitpreference signaling, devised 90 years ago by the late Hy Lavinthal: yet, applying it in practice is far from easy.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 10:30 A.M. (Channel 2) Lamp Unto My Feet: Victor De Aranjo, Baha'i International Community.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: In Summary

title: Giscard Ends Visit to Mexico With Some Gains on Oil
description: MEXICO CITY, March 3  President Valery Giscard d'Estaing of France left here today after a fourday visit aimed at securing French access to Mexico's growing oil resources.

title: Brokers No Longer Ignore Discounters
description: Wall Street discount brokerages, the feisty offspring of the negotiatedrate era, are on the march. While fullservice brokerage giants such as Merrill Lynch, E.F Hutton and Shearson Hayden Stone have raised their retail commmission charges to levels above the fixed rates that prevailed prior to May I, 1975 Smith Barney, Harris Upham and Bache Halsey Stuart Shields boosted their fees again in December  the discount firms are proliferating. What's more, some prestigious houses, employing sophisticated marketing and costcontrol technigues, have started discounting. with indications that they will offer lowerrate services nationwide.

title: LONG ISLAND JOURNAL
description: THE idea of a bridge across Long Island Sound, which was often described by Robert Moses, the master builder, as inevitable, continues to reappear despite the skepticism of some regional planners in Nassau and Suffolk Counties and in Connecticut and Rhode Island.

title: Marijuana Ships Said to Sail Direct to Northeast From Latin America
description: Small tramp freighters with rusting hulls often fly no flags as they approach the northeast coast of the United States. According to Federal lawenforcement officials, they are mother ships for an organizedcrime group that has recently begun largescale smuggling of marijuana by sea directly from Latin America to the New York area

title: Moscow Denies Talks With U.S. and China on War
description: MOSCOW, March 3The Soviet Union said today that it had not been engaged in secret negotiations with China and the United States to end the fighting in Vietnam.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: Members of the American Numismatic Society of New York city have just received ,their copies of Museum Notes 23, a softcover publication of 220 text pages and 40 topquality plates.

title: Jesse Jackson Builds Up Support In a Drive for Student Discipline
description: ANDERSON, Ind.  With his fists clenched at his sides and his voice rising and falling in the rhythm of finely tuned phrases, the Rev. Jesse L. Jackson stood before 1,500 high school students in the Anderson College gymnasium one recent day and told them, You can't compete today without a good education.

title: HOME CLINIC Pumping Water Out of the Basement
description: ONE of the most unpleasant sights a homeowner can see is water all over his basement floor  but unfortunately many homeowners have had to deal with this unpleasant experience during the heavy rains and widespread local flooding that have occurred in this area during the last few months. More homes will likely suffer from water in the basement as the ground starts to thaw, and as heavy accumulations of snow start to melt and saturate the ground With moisture that will then seep in through porous sections of the basement walls and floor, as well as through any cracks or open joints in the masonry.

title: WESTCHESTER HOUSING HomeSharing for the Elderly
description: SOMEONE to talk to, someone to cook with, not to be alone in the house. That is what a 78yearold widow said she was looking for when she signed up last year for a countysponsored housesharing program designed to match elderly homeowners with elderly persons in need of a place to live.

title: Villeneuve Victor in a Ferrari
description: KYALAMI, South Africa, March 3 The Italian Ferrari team dominated the South African Grand Prix today, with Gilles Villeneuve of Canada winning the raininterrupted race by margin of 4.2 seconds from his teammate, Jody Scheckter of South Africa.

title: The Best of the PresentDay Bluesmen
description: Muddy Waters, Professor Longhair, Otis Rush and Son Seals are four of the Most important living bluesmen. Mr. Waters established himself in the early 1950's when he updated the country blues of the Mississippi Delta with electric instruments, a steady rocking beat, and expressive solo turns by his band members. Professor Longhair's fusion of barrelhouseblues piano and Latin rhythms is also a product of the 1950's, although he is valued more for his stylistic eccentricities and for general instrumental and vocal excel lence than he is for his influence, which has never really penetrated far beyond his native New Orleans. On a good night, Otis Rush is simply the most formidable of all modern blues guitarists. And as a relative youngster in his 30's, Son Seals, who plays supercharged, wildly exciting guitar and has integrated funk and even neardisco elements into his presentation, represents not just the best of presentday blues but something of the music's future as well.

title: Antonia H. Munroe Plans May Bridal
description: Mr. and Mrs. Henry W. Munroe of Green's Farms, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Antonia Hughes Munroe, to Alleyne Carleton Howell 3d of Vershire, Vt., son of Mr. Howell Jr. of Fairfield, Conn., and the late Jane Blair Howell. A May wedding is planned.

title: STRIPMINE RULES ARE DUE THIS WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, March 3  Lurch by bureaucratic lurch, the Interior Department's new Office of Surface Mining is nearing publication of a volume of Federal regulations, the size of a Manhattan telephone book, to control the ravages of strip mining. It has not been easy for the agency, itself a result of a decade of drawnout environmental struggles in Congress.

title: Realty News
description: People who want to rent an apartment in a new luxury highrise tower in Manhattan will have to pay more for it than ever before, but in exchange they will receive apartments that are, on the average, roomier than the new apartments they could have rented in 1977.

title: Taking the Measure of the Stripe
description: BRIDGET RILEY has done more for the stripe in painting than any other artist. It became the central motif of many of her canvases and she endowed it with a special iconic existence of its own, almost enshrining it. in tier wont the stripe is vibrant with an overwhelming energy that can leave viewers shaken and alive with a particular kind of visual dynamism that makes the striped lines do most unusual things. The different formats the artist imposes upon it and the different colors she applies to it provide unprecedented pictorial experiences.

title: For Vietnam, Prosperity Is Around a Distant Corner
description: BANGKOK, Thailand  Peace and the hope of prosperity seemed such a sweet prospect in April 1975 that even many antiCommunist Vietnamese the south were not overly unhappy when the Communists won the war. But peace turned out to be of short duration, prosperity never came, and the present twofront war makes the prospect of itscoming even fainter.

title: Cause of Food Poisoning At College Being Sought
description: The galley of the State University's Maritime College in the Bronx reopened yesterday and 75 cadets and seven faculty members felled Thursday by what was apparently food poisoning were reported to have recovered. But city health officials were still conducting tests to determine the source of the illnesses, and the results were expected today or tomorrow.

title: Letters TO THE EOITOR
description: John McEnroe On the Rise

title: ART VIEW
description: There was a time when stilllife painting was regarded as the most abstract form of representational art  akin to abstract art, if not the actual thing itself. It was all because of Czanne's apples, of course. Czanne's apples were thought to be abstract. Czanne himself was, in this view, virtually a Cubist anyway, and so naturally his apples had to be abstract. To think otherwise was very much de trop.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Editor:

title: GARDENING
description: THE annual New Jersey Flower and Garden Show opened yesterday at the Morristown National Guard Armory. This year, the show is featuring more than 20 beautiful gardens, ranging from a simple summer cutting layout to a formal landscape complete with statuary.

title: Eleanora Werlich Is Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert O'Donnell Werlich of Washington have announced the engagement of their daughter, Eleanora Werlich, to Jonathan Riggs Creighton of Boston.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Having already broken with the tradition of bipartisan foreign policy, the newly vigorous Republican Party now finds an eerie parallel between the Carter Administration's national security performance and that of the Chamberlain Government in Britain before World War II.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: ONE of the most unpleasant sights a homeowner can see is water all over his basement floor  but unfortunately many homeowners have had to deal with this unpleasant experience during the heavy rains and widespread local flooding that have occurred in this area during the last few months. More homes will likely suffer from water in the basement as the ground starts to thaw, and as heavy accumulations of snow start to melt and saturate the ground with moisture that will then seep in through porous sections of the basement walls and floor, as well as through any cracks or open joints in the masonry.

title: LETTERS TO THE WESTCHESTER EDITOR
description: I read Anatole Broyard's At Home column [Is There Life After Moving to the Suburbs? Feb. 11], and it excited me to find someone who expresses so beautifully and honestly the feelings that I have been living with for the two years since we left New York City. Mr. Broyard has confronted an issue that so many suburbanites are terrified to raise.

title: Talks Ordered in Strike Against a Michigan City
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Feb. 3 (AP)  The city and 435 striking public works employees were ordered to resume negotiations today after a judge limited picketing at the Pontiac Silverdome.

title: DAVID COHN
description: David Cohn, a specialist in trial and appellate litigation and a founding member af the law firm of Cohn & Lifland, of Saddle Brook, N.J., died on Feb. 27, at the Boca Raton (Fla.) Community Hospital. He was 76 years old.

title: NONFICTION IN BRIEF
description: THEORETICAL physics and mountain climbing are, respectively, the most demanding mental and physical activities in the world. Jeremy Bernstein is a professional at particle physics and an amateur at mountaineering, but he writes about both fields for the layman better than anyone else writes about either. This is, nevertheless, an uneven collection of former magazine pieces. Almost half of the book is given over to a pleasant but tensionless travel diary of an overland expedition from Europe to a remote high part of Pakistan. There is also a forgettable essay on skiing.

title: 2 Indicted in Taiwan Espionage
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 3 (Reuters)Two opposition leaders have been indicted on charges of harboring a Communist spy from China, the Taiwan garrison command said today. Yu Tengfa, a former county magistrate in Kaohiung, southern Taiwan, and his son, Yu Juiyen, were arrested in January for alleged subversive activities.

title: Technology
description: Hearings held before the Senate Science, Technology and Space Committee last week have brought a glimmer of hope into the lives of the helium heads  airship enthusiasts  who will carry to their graves the memory of the great Zeppelins of the 1930's.

title: CARTOON TIME ON THE CONTINENT
description: European fashion always has its quirks which usually undergo some modification in crossing the Atlantic. France tends to lead the way with these fads and fancies and, this year, Paris belongs to the lady who is a tramp  with class.

title: In the Beginning Was the Indian
description: THIS is an odd book. The dust jacket informs us that The story of America's origins, which is told in these pages, is an unfamiliar one. Its wars are uncelebrated, its heroes unsung, its causes unremembered. Maybe so. Maybe the labors of American historians for the last few centuries are a secret to their countrymen. Maybe Miles Standish and Patrick Henry and George Washington are unsung. Maybe Francis Parkman's HalfCentury of Conflict Is unknown. Maybe the American Revolution is unremembered. If so, then this small volume will acquaint Americans with some of the wars and alarms that marked the first half of their history, the years from the first English colonization to the Declaration of Independence.

title: For 45,000 County Adults, the Meaning Of the Written Word Is a Life of Anxiety
description: DO you know any functionally illiterate adults? You probably do, but haven't guessed their secret. Many have become skilled in covering up their problems. There are nonreaders who often buy the morning paper and pretend to read so that their neighbors and friends will not know they cannot read. It is embarrassing for an intelligent person to admit the lack of this basic skill, so guessing and finding many excuses cover up the problems.

title: NEW JERSEY GUIDE
description: Today

title: April 16 Urged As a Trial Date In Scotto Case
description: A prosecutor has proposed April 16 as the starting date for the trial of Anthony M. Scotto, a top leader of the International Longshoremen's Association, who is charged with receiving payoffs from company officials.

title: Rev. James Munroe Fianc of Deirdre Mole
description: The engagement of Deirdre Adams Mole to the Rev. James Granger Munroe has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Robert Adams Mole of East Brunswick, N.J., parents of the future bride. Mr. Munroe, assistant minister of Grace Episcopal Church in New York and chaplain of the Grace Church School, is the son of Mr. and Mrs. William Abbot Munroe of Andover, Mass.

title: The Traffic jam at the Doorstep
description: Suppose you want to buy a house in a peaceful suburban village. You drive out to Westchester County on a Friday afternoon and head for a community that has always appeared to be quaint and appealing.

title: TV VIEW
description: We can blame the Chinese for the single bit of wisdom that has probably hampered television the most  the adage that one picture is worth a thousand words. Actually, a few well chosen words can be worth a thousand pictures, even on television.

title: Deduction For Papers Rejected
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (AP)  Former Representative James H. Morrison of Louisiana has been turned down by a court in an attempt to take a tax deduction for donating his official papers. Mr. Morrison, a Democrat who served in the House from 1943 to 1967, sought a deduction of $61,100 for donating his papers to Southeastern Louisiana University.

title: CARTER AND BEGIN APPARENTLY UNABLE TO AGREE ON TREATY
description: WASHINGTON, Sunday, March 4President Carter and Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel met for three hours last night and apparently failed to resolve the issues holding up completion of the EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty.

title: Employees Don't Take AntiTheft Moves Lightly
description: Industry has long been bedeviled by stickyfingered employees, of both whiteand bluecollar varieties, and management has long sought ways to discourage worker theft. But new strategies have done little to stem the tide (the price tag in 1979 is expected to reach $6 billion in merchandise and materials, up 20 percent over the 1978 figure), and employees have a heightened sense of their rights, as evidenced by an evergrowing number of cases that have found their way to the courts, to arbitrators and to government agencies.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: Article on TV Coverage Is Termed Inaccurate

title: STATE POLICE READY FOR MILK STRIKE JOB
description: Governor Carey has ordered New York State police to be available for protecting milk trucks during the current milk deliverers'strike.

title: A New State Budget Last Week Was the First Challenge to the Massachusetts System
description: BOSTON  Can one man with the zeal of a missionary and the finesse of a bulldozer do something about this state's ruinous property taxes, which have driven out jobs and capital and earned the state the nickname taxachusetts?

title: 5 Arrested in Aqueduct Dispute
description: Racing continued yesterday at Aqueduct as the labor dispute between the New York Racing Association and the union that represents parimutuel clerks reached its 17th day without any sign of a settlement. But a rash of violent incidents resulted in the arrest of five men, and an explosive device caused minor damage to two cars in the track's parking lot.

title: World News Briefs
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 3 (Reuters)  Exile sources said today that troops loyal to President Idi Amin had retaken the eastern Uganda town of Tororo from exiled guerrillas, but the sources denied earlier reports of rebellion among President Amin's troops.

title: HotelShy? Try European Flats.
description: Hotels are fine, within limits. But what do you do when you have an attack of the munchies at 3 A.M., and there's only a cough drop in your purse? Or on a Sunday morning, when you want to catch a few more winks, but it's 9:15 and the dining room stops serving breakfast at 9:30? One solution: rent an apartment, where you can do what you want to do, when you want to do iv.

title: Iran's Kurds, All of Sunni Sect, Worry About Shiite Rule
description: NASSAYEH OWLA, Iran, March 1 Amid the rugged mountains of Kurdistan, the northwest section of Iran inhabited by two million Kurds, this village commands an idyllic setting, huddled at the foot of a mountain above a rushing river.

title: Miss Taylor Will Be Bride
description: Kathleen Bryan Edwards of Greensboro. N.C., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Melanie Anne Taylor, to Christopher Simpson Farland, son of Joseph Simpson Farland of Winchester, Va., and the late Mrs. Farland. His father is former Ambassador to the Dominican Republic, Panama, Pakistan and Iran.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: ONE of the most unpleasant sights a homeowner can see is water all over his basement floor  but unfortunately many homeowners have had to deal with this unpleasant experience during the heavy rains and widespread local flooding that have occurred in this area during the last few months. More homes will likely suffer from water in the basement as the ground starts to thaw, and as heavy accumulations of snow start to melt and saturate the ground with moisture that will then seep in through porous sections of the basement walls and floor, as well as through any cracks or open joints in the masonry. One of the most common methods for

title: Hasidic Group in Illinois in Zoning Battle on Center
description: EVANSTON, Ill., March 3  Rows of seats in the makeshift sanctuary stand empty. The Torah in its sacred ark goes unread. And the rabbi, with his long beard and top hat, sits in his study. There is no one there to counsel.

title: At Home: Happiness as an Art Form
description: WHILE I know a few people who are content and a greater number who are holding their own against depression, I can think of only one person in my acquaintance who is actively happy. You might even say that he is absurdly happy, a phrase invented especially for our time.

title: Utility Tax Proposal: More Pandemonium Than Panacea
description: JOHN MARSHALL, our greatest Chief Justice, warned nearly two centuries ago that the power to tax involves the power to destroy.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: One of the nicest things about the exhibition of photographs from The New York Daily News now at the New York Public Library. Fifth Avenue and 42d Street, through March 31, is that it has no pretentions whatever to being about art. Selected by Worth Gatewood, retired Sunday editor of The News, and modestly installed on temporary screens amid the classical splendors of the library's 42d Street lobby, it is billed as a picture history of the past 50 years in New York. It is organized by decades, not by themes or styles, and there is a tree 16page catalogue that not only gives each picture an extended caption, but also prefaces each decade with a capsule history for the benefit of those who do not know the difference between the 20's (bootleggers and flappers) and the 30's (unemployment and despair).

title: Sweet Houston Sound: Vietnamese Language
description: HOUSTON, March 3 (AP)  The Houston Independent School District, facing the possible loss of $2 million in Federal funds, is searching for 15 teachers who speak Vietnamese.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: WASHINGTON  Developing countries, practicing their own form of global reach, are becoming adept at establishing multinational corporations their own and at using them with increasing effectiveness to enlarge their share of world markets.

title: Vault Mark Set By Ripley
description: FORT WORTH, March 3  Dan Ripley finally got his polevault record tonight. Competing for the United States in the seventh dual meet against the Soviet Union, the 25year old Californian vaulted 18 feet 5 inches and broke the indoor record that had eluded him this season.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: This Week:

title: Stone Age Site Found in Tibet
description: HONG KONG, March 3 (Reuters)Chinese archeologists in Tibet have found a Stone Age site estimated to be 9,600 years old, according to Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency. It said foundations of five houses, nearly 300 stone and bone artifacts and pottery and skeletons of birds and animals were discovered in the Chamdo area in August.

title: SAN DIEGO ATTEMPTS TO MANAGE GROWTH
description: SAN DIEGO, March 1  San Diego, one of the few large American cities still gaining population, has approved a plan designed to manage its growth so as to avoid the kind of urban sprawl that has developed in Los Angeles and other modem cities that are tailored to the mobility of the automobile.

title: The Political Novelist
description: IVAN TURGENEV was the first of the great Russian novelists to become known in the West, and the one most readily accepted. Dostoyevsky and even Tolstoy, however impressive, seemed alien, too Russian; one had to get used to them. But Turgenev himself was almost as European as he was Russian. His real home was not the family estate he inherited after his mother's death, Spasskoye, which was filled with fearful childhood memories, but Paris, Baden Baden, Bougival or wherever the Viardots might be living. They were his family: the famous singer Pauline Garcia Viardot, whom he loved from the day he met her when he was 25 to the day he died 40 years later; and Pauline's mother, husband and children. My dear, good friends, he called them, my only family, whom I love above everything in the world.

title: Marlboro Music 2 Ways
description: Two kinds of chamber music held sway at the Music From Marlboro concert Thursday night at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. One was the truly intimate, athomebythefireside sort as exemplified by Schubert's teenage String Quartet in Bflat (D. 112) and Boccherini's effervescent Guitar Quintet in D. After intermission came the Brahms Piano Quintet in F minor (Op. 3.4), a bigboned piece of symphonic proportions; amateur musicians may well play it in cozy parlor surroundings, but this music thrives best at the hands of five seasoned professionals and in a concerthall ambience.

title: Chinese Invasion Overshadows Cambodia's Plight
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 3  The war between Vietnam and China has crowded the war between Vietnam and Cambodia off of the front pages, and Cambodia is once again what it was during the previous war of Indochina, a sideshow to the main event.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: The Charges Against Resorts
description: ATLANTIC CITY

title: Iona, Georgetown Capture Playoffs And Gain N.C.A.A. Tourney Berths
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., March 3  As more and more games produce more tepping stones on the way to the Final Four, the coaches and participants competing for the National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball championship reach for words to describe the importance of these games.

title: P.S.A.L. Girls Take State Title
description: ITHACA, N.Y., March 3  Betty Cantine took her time as she placed herself at the starting line for the 300.. yard dash at the New York State girls indoor track championships at Comell University today.

title: Three Do Solo Dancing
description: Ann Darby, Mary Lee Karlins and Elizabeth Streb got together for an hour or so of solo dancing on Friday at a Canal Street loft. The three choreographers share an interest in abstract movement Each is a good and personable dancer. And the four solos pointed up some truths about choreography and performance.

title: Easter Bowl Needs a Nest Egg
description: The Easter Bowl, one of the top junior tennis tournaments in the country, may be canceled next month because of financial problems, according to Seena Hamilton, the tournament chairman and director.

title: DINING OUT
description: WHEN is a restaurant not a restaurant? When it's an institution such as the Clam Broth House, that's when. Hoboken without the Clam Broth House is as unthinkable as Coney Island without Nathan's.

title: CONNECTICUT JOURNAL
description: GREENWICH has achieved a certain distinction in this century as the land of the rich and the home of Colonial charm, but it appears to have been povertystricken for. genuine Colonial heroes during Connecticut's starsprinkled participation in the Revolutionary War.

title: Karen Liebmann Fiance Of Dr. Steven F. Schutzer
description: Karen Liebmann, a pediatric nurse at Strong Memorial Hospital of the University of Rochester, plans to be married in June to Dr. Steven F. Schutzer, a surgical resident at Strong Memorial.

title: Oregon Bans FlipTops
description: PORTLAND, Ore., March 3 (AP) Those disposable metal tabs that have become common on many beverage containers have been disposed of in Oregon by a state law. The law, which went into effect Thursday. is an outgrowth of a 1971 state act requiring deposits on all beer and soft drink cans and bottles. That law Also banned detachable metal tab openers, or fliptops, as a cause of litter on beaches and roads.

title: Southern Africa's One Hopeful Prospect
description: A decisive moment is also at hand for another diplomatic effort that has consumed great energy and aroused great hopes: the United Nations plan for Namibia. After two years of negotiations, Secretary General Waldheim has proposed to begin the agreed process on March 15: a ceasefire in the guerrilla war, the entry of a U.N. force and the holding of elections leading to independence for the territory. But lastminute objections threaten to sink the whole plan.

title: ExSenator Harry Cain Dies at 73; A Critic of McCarthyEra Excesses
description: Harry P. Cain, a conservative Republican from Washington who served in the Senate from 1946 to 1952 and later, as head of the Subversive Activities Control Board, attacked the civilliberties abuses of the McCarthy period, died in his sleep yesterday at his home in Miami Lakes, Fla. He was 73 years old.

title: Alexis L. Mitman Engaged to David Colker
description: Mr. and Mrs. Henry D. Mitman of Claremont, Calif., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Alexis Leigh Mitman, to David Colker, son of Mr. and Mr. James Colker of Pittsburgh. The couple plan to be married June 24 at the Colker home.

title: Photographer Plans to Wed Pamela Leib
description: Mrs. H. Clifton Whiteman and Gordon B. Leib of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Pamela Whitley Leib, to Decatur Sawyer Higgins Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Higgins of Locust Valley, L.I.

title: I.L.O. Sees Rapid Aging Of World's Labor Force
description: GENEVA, March 3 (Reuters)  The world's labor force is aging rapidly, which by the turn of the century will mean a heavy burden on society for pensions, according to the International Labor Organization.

title: Invasion of the Ear Snatchers
description: YOU may chose to beware the Ides of March, but fore and aft of that historic day, you'll find an extraordinary array of musical activity in Westchester from Winchester caroling to West Point jazz, from the Tokyo Quartet to the Ireland of Yeats and O'Casey.

title: Days of Diverse Music, With a Brass Intro
description: A Nextraordinary array of musical activity is coming up in the state, from a little Liszt to some big Brahms to English brass. The brass starts at 3 this afternoon at the Yale Center for British Art, where the twicemonthly concerts are free and onen to the public.

title: New Beginnings
description: Helen Yglesias started to write novels when she was 54. Married to a writer, mother of a young son who was soon to make his debut as a novelist at 15. her unusally late start apparently started her thinking about the whole subject of starting.

title: The Elements of Style Out in a Revised Edition
description: That wise little guide to English, The Elements of Style by E. B. White and the late William Strunk Jr., has just come out in a revised third edition. Fancy Dans, syntax Scoundrels and longwinded writers will read it at their own risk.

title: Associated Press
description: NAVY COMMISSIONS NEW YORK CITY: At Groton, Conn., a highspeed nuclear powered submarine, the city's namesake, was turned over to the Navy. She is the ninth ship produced in series of Los Angelesclass attack submarines.

title: STAMPS
description: The premiere winter stamp show of the East, INTERPEX, is opening its annual fourday exhibition this Thursday. The theme of the show is to honor the United Nations, and on Friday the U.N. itself is putting out its first commemoratives of the year, with the firstdayofissue taking place at the show. INTERPEX will be held at the New York Coliseum on Columbus Circle, in a new location with larger facilities on the second floor of the Coliseum.

title: Pressure Grows, And Israel Feels It, For a Treaty
description: In diplomatic jargon, frank discussions is code for a fight. That was what President Carter invited Menachem Begin to engage in this weekend and photos of the two embracing at the White House did little to improve the prognosis for EgyptianIsraeli peace.

title: 2 ExCommunist Party Members Win Struggle for U.S. Citizenship
description: SAN FRANCISCO. March 3 (UPI)With tears in their eyes. Jack Warnick and Jean Kramer, former Communist Party members who escaped deportation in the 1950's, won a long battle for United States citizenship yesterday.

title: Calabria University Studying Mafia Businessmen
description: COSENZA, Italy, March 3  The University of Calabria, Italy's youngest state .center of higher learning, has started a ;research project aimed at demolishing the Godfather image of the Mafia.

title: Franklin Township: A Manager's Menage
description: FRANKLIN TOWNSHIP MEANS BUSINESS. So says a sign along the Lincoln Highway, the old Indian road now called Route 27 and dotted with minishopping centers.

title: WASHINGTON
description: You can' t discuss politics privately with Governor Brown of California today without concluding that this rumpled, talkative, serious young man, now approaching his 41st birthday, is not only challenging Jimmy Carter for the Presidency, but also calling for a political, technological and moral reappraisal of American Iife.

title: Headliners
description: The chef was deeply wounded. In a New Yorker article by John McPhee, the pseudonymous master chef Otto expressed the view that the sole and turbot at Lutece in New York were likely to have been frozen. Could it be true? Quite possibly not. Respecting Mr. McPhee's reputation and Otto's privacy, William Shawn, editor of The New Yorker, had spared the article from the magazine's fact checkers. Unheard of! Finally a checker visited Lutece, checking invoices, and last week, Mr. Shawn acknowledged that Yes, The New Yorker might have to print a correction.

title: Police Seek Public's Aid On Better Heroin Case
description: The police continued to urge residents of Harlem yesterday to report cases of persons showing symptoms of having taken scopolamine, a potent narcotic relaxant that was distributed in the community last week by a drug pusher who billed it as a better kind of heroin.

title: Down in the Dumps, Up at the Pumps
description: Last week's economic signals gave analysts the option of predicting an imminent recession or not, but perhaps where there's doubt there's hope. There was little of either for American motorists. Gasoline will soon. cost 14 cents more a gallon because of current and prospective oilPrice increases; proposed conservation measures are imposed, there will be fewer chances to buy it at any price.

title: Deaths
description: TANDEMax. On February 24,1979. Beloved husband of Molly Levy. Devoted and loving father of Morty of Montreal, Janet Rubin of New York and Esther Geifman of Florida. Fatherinlaw of Ruth. Brother of the late Hymie, and the late Claire of Russia. Cherished grandfather to Marla, Wende, Rhonda and Sheila. Funeral services were held in Montreal on February 26.

title: A Book of Last Things
description: WE have to start with various subtractions from 164, which is the number of Fitzgerald stories originally printed in magazines, including school papers. Subtract 46 for the stories he reprinted in one or another of the four collections published during his lifetime. Subtract 61 more for the stories collected after his death, in six volumes edited by others. That would leave 57 uncollected stories, but Frances Scott Fitzgerald Smith, who owns the copyrights, believes that eight of these are so far beneath her father's standard that they should be forgotten. (I have read the eight stories in old magazines and feel that she is right.) Now we are down to 49, but to give his readers good measure, Fitzgerald's new editor, Matthew J. Broccoli, has resurrected On Your Own, an awkwardly puttogether but appealing story rejected by seven magazines. Mr. Broccoli tells us that there are other stories in manuscript, but that On Your Own is the only one bearing, in Fitzgerald's words, one little drop of something ... the extra I had.

title: Susan A. Fritsch Married to Bruce N. Faber
description: Susan Anderson Fritsch, daughter of the Rev. and Mrs. Charles T. Fritsch of Princeton, N.J., was married there yesterday to Bruce Neuman Faber, son of Mr. and Mrs. Neuman M. Faber of Middlebury, Conn. The bride's father, William Henry Green Professc of Old Testament Literature at the Princeton Theological Seminary, performed the ceremony in the Miller Chapel of the seminary.

title: Rules Set on Kent State Files
description: CLEVELAND, March 3 (AP) A Federal judge has set out rules that will allow the release of some material gathered in investigations of the 1970 Kent State University shootings. The ruling involves 30,000 pages of reports on the incident, which left four students dead and nine wounded when National Guardsmen opened fire at an antiwar protest.

title: Fighting Between the Yemens Last Week Was a Symptom of Uneasiness in the Whole Region
description: CAIRO  Saudi Arabia has cultivated an aloofness from the kind of pressures that afflict less favored nations, Insulated as it is by desert, a tight visa policy and oil reserves that translate into formidable wealth. For years has behaved like a severe but magnanimous godfather, putting things right with a few diplomatic nudges here or a few million dollars there.

title: For a Revitalized Downtown in Glen Cove
description: The following letter to the editor is  from the Mayor of Glen Cove:

title: GROOVING WITH GROOMS IN YONKERS
description: I like to be extravagant, Red Grooms says with a sleepy drawl. 'I should have had someone like King Ludwig supporting me.

title: Miss Baldwin Is Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert H.B. Baldwin of New Vernon, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Deborah Gay Baldwin, to Jerry Fall, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jerry John Fall of Riverdale. the Bronx.

title: Navratilova, Evert Gain Final
description: DALLAS, March 3  Topseeded Martina Navratilova shook free from a long deuce game at 33 in the first set and went on to a 63, 61 triumph over 16yearold Tracy Austin tonight in the semifinals of a $125,000 women's pro tournament.

title: Exorcising the Demon Rum Proves Difficult in Washington
description: WASHINGTON  Former Representative Wilbur Mills, reminiscing the other day about drinking and drinkers in Congress, recalled that John Nance Garner, the earthy Texan who served as present under Franklin D. Roosevelt, would never let the hour of 5 P.M. slip by without having a tumbler of whisky.It didn't matter who he was with, said Mr. Mills. He would stop whatever he was Mills, reminiscing the other day about drinking and drinkers in Congress, recalled that John Nance Garner, the earthy Texan who served as Vice President under Franklin D. Roosevelt, would never let the hour of 5 P.M. slip by without having a tumbler of whisky.It didn't matter who he was with, said Mr. Mills. He would stop whatever he was doing sharply at 5 and pour his glass of whisky.

title: ART
description: GARDEN CITY

title: Thomas Edison at the Races
description: After threequarters of a mile, Art Gimbrone was sitting fourth with a pacer named Visite, one of three in the field that he considered most likely to win. One of the other contenders was just ahead of him in third place and the other was sitting fifth. In his rearview mirror, Gimbrone saw the horse that was eighth and last swing outside to start a move. Experience had taught him that the contender in fifth place would move with the trailer. I gave my horse a little warning, Art said. He isn't especially quick. If you try something sudden with him, he gets upset and will crossfire or something, so I gave him a moment and then took out and went for the lead. I passed the contender that was third and got to the lead and held off the one that had been fifth. We won, and I think the mirror was a help.

title: He's Resculpturing the Island's Skyline
description: GREAT NECK

title: Removing Incompetent Teachers Is Growing Problem for Schools
description: Barbara Hart, a firstyear mathematics teacher, was dismissed from her job at Norwalk High School in Ohio about this time last year because she allegedly could not maintain discipline in her classroom.

title: NEW JERSEY JOURNAL
description: FOR the last few years, Diana Henriques, a reporter for The Trenton Times, has taken look periodically at the operations of the state's Housing Finance Agency, which borrows money and then lends it to developers for the construction of apartment houses for the elderly and poor.

title: The World
description: It rained in Spain on election day last week, but the results were bright for Prime Minister Adolfo Suarez's Union of the Democratic Center. The party picked up a seat to give it 167 members in the 350seat lower house of Parliament and was wellplaced to continue its minority ruling role. A spokesman for Mr. Suarez said the party would continue to rule alone.

title: Knicks Sever Streak of Clippers, 111108
description: The Knicks turned in one of their few positive performances of their disappointing National Basketball Association season last night by ending the San Diego Clippers eightgame winning streak, 111108, at Madison Square Garden. Only the Los Angeles Lakers (14) and the Washington Bullets (9) had won more consecutive games than the Clippers this season.

title: DINING OUT
description: GREENWICH

title: Italian Skier Is Seriously Injured
description: WILMINGTON, N.Y., March 3 Leonardo David, a promising 18yearold Alpine ski racer from Italy, suffered a severe head injury today during the World Cup downhill competition on Whiteface Mountain.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Business Editor:

title: Fuel Savings Are Growing But Not Very Energetically
description: Five years ago, a band of Arab nations exposed the Achilles heel of the American economy. By cutting off a rather modest amount of oil, they triggered an energy price runup that nudged the United States into the worst recession it had seen in 40 years.

title: Editors Choice
description: THE CULTURE OF NARCISSISM, by Christopher Lasch. (Norton, $11.95.) Civilized hellfire sermon on the decay permeating modern American life.

title: Lise Arm Rosen Plans Nuptials
description: Mr. and Mrs. Bernard H. Rosen of  Warwick, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Lise Ann Rosen, to William Spencer Howard 3d, son of Elizabeth Chamberlin Howard of Little Silver, N.J., and Mr. Howard 2d of Chatham, Mass.

title: A Caddie Lives for Mondays
description: Amidst the challenge of golf, between the birdies and the bogeys, betwixt the rough and the bunkers, lies the art of countryclub caddying. Last summer, at the age of 15, I was introduced to this art in Connecticut at a club where experienced caddies treated it as a science.

title: Bhutto Lawyer, Asking Review, Charges Errors in Court's Ruling
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, March 3 Zulfikar All Bhutto's defense attorney is alleging many irregularities and the misreading of evidence in the Supreme Court's decision that rejected the former Prime Minister's appeal of a conviction and death sentence on charges of conspiring to murder a political opponent in 1979.

title: U.S. Says New Ruling Will Boost Gas Prices 5c Over Next 2 Years
description: WASHINGTON, March 3  The Department of Energy cleared up confusion today over its ruling yesterday allowing gasoline prices to rise, saying that the price at the service station pump may be a nickle less at the end of 1980 than it originally projected.

title: Paperback Best Sellers
description: 1 BLOODLINE, by Sidney Sheldon. (Warner, $2.75.) Love and high financial intrigue on three continents: fiction.

title: Victoria Lang Plans to Be Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Jack Lang of Fort Salonga, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Victoria Winifred Sabine Lang, to Joseph McAuliffe Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. McAuliffe of New York. Miss Lang, an alumna of C.W. Post College and assistant to the vice president of the National Screen Service Corporation, and her fiance plan to be married April 21 in St. Patrick's Cathedral. Her father is a sportswriter for The Daily News.

title: BEHIND THE BEST SELLERS
description: Lauren Bacall

title: The Failed Hero
description: The test of a firstrate intelligence, F. Scott Fitzgerald once observed, is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in the mind at the same time, and still retain the ability to function. Phil Ochs flunked this test long before he hanged himself three years ago. One of the foremost protest singers of the folkmusic era of the mid1960's, when his broadsides deplored everything from the chicanery of Billy Sol Estes to Lyndon Johnson's invasion of the Dominican Republic, Ochs also wanted desperately to become a popmusic star. He even went so far as to get his nose fixed while he was still in his teens. At one of his last public performances in New York City he donned a gold lame suit in a futile attempt to reconcile his two greatest heroes  Che Guevara and Elvis Presley and was roundly booed. His inability ever to pull off so quixotic a combination was Ochs's undoing.

title: Pursuing Reorganization
description: LOS ANGELES  At many points around the country where national parks adjoin national forests there are identical trees only a few feet apart which are under the jurisdiction of two different Federal agencies  respectively the Department of the Interior and the Department of Agriculture. Under the reorganization plan President Carter announced last week, a new Department of Natural Resources would administer most of the Federal Government's trees, but, for now, they are under widely contrasting regulations.

title: $3 Million Settlement Approved In Beverly Hills Supper Club Fire
description: COVINGTON, Ky., March 3 (AP)  A Federal judge has approved a $3 million settlement in the Beverly Hills Supper Club fire. Circuit Court Judge John Diskins is also expected to approve the outofcourt settlement.

title: Little ChaAce Seen for Saving Scottish Home Rule
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland, Makh 3Prime Minister James Callaghan retreated to his farm outside London today to search for some means to salvage home rule for Scotland, but his Cabinet colleagues expressed fears that he would find it impossible.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: By now the press conference, in which Beverly Sills presented some of her ideas about the future of the New York City Opera, is history. When she takes control on July 1 she will have worked out in her own mind the broad outlines of the fiveyear plan she is developing. That does not mean immediate results. The fall season of the New York City Opera was worked out some two years ago, and so was much of spring 1980. The repertory and castings of those two seasons were not Miss Sills's doing, and it is reported that she is not very happy with some of the choices. It is clear, however, that Miss Sills is accepting the situation philosophically, making do with what she has and concentrating on those seasons that really will be hers.

title: Avoiding Pitfalls In Picking a Cruise
description: A Chicago businessman in his mid50's, tired of digging his family out of the New Year blizzard, decided to take his wife on a cruise. He could spare only a week away from his office, so he and his wife decided to fly to Florida for a brief visit with relatives and friends before sailing on a fournight cruise out of Miami to the Bahamas.

title: Police in New Orleans Reject Pact, Calling Amnesty Offer Inadequate
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 3  New Orleans policemen voted tonight to continue their twoweek old strike, rejecting by a vote of 447 to 173 what the city had termed its final contract offer.

title: CHESS
description: Sao PAULO, Brazil

title: Leslie Ellen Lewart Wed To Dr. Henry Meilman
description: Leslie Ellen Lewart, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Mortimer A. Lewart of Huntington, L.I., was married last night to Dr. Henry Meilman, son of Dr. and Mrs. Edward Meilman of Great Neck, L.I. Rabbi Morris Shapiro performed the ceremony at the South Huntington Jewish Center in Huntington.

title: Births
description: SCHWARTZ

title: U.S. Is Seeing the Light on Olympic Soccer Amateurism
description: It is Mexico City, 1968, and the Olympics are in full swing. At the vast Aztec Stadium the press interview room is hot, noisy and crowded. Most of the newsmen are Mexican and they are in an indignant mood. Their soccer team has just been beaten by the French. When the French coach says it feels good to beat the host and their professionals, there are shouts of protest.

title: Sunday Observer
description: It is always dispiriting to see Kunkel walk in. Sooner rather than later, you know, he is going to say, Let's look at the facts. Kunkel believes in the facts, which is all right, but he cannot understand that the facts are not everybody's cup of tea. He believes that everybody ought to look at them, no matter how dull or depressing they may be.

title: Outlook for County Government
description: THE top officials of New Jersey's two biggest counties, Essex and Bergen, agree that public demand for less government spending is creating problems, but that this should result in better government in the long run.

title: Taylor, ExMet, M.D. in (Spring) Training
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 3  Down here in the spring training belt, where 1,000 young men are looking for jobs in baseball these days, not many athletes have second careers  like Bobby Brown, the heart specialist, or Ken Dryden, the lawyer, or Vinegar Bend Mizell, who went to Congress.

title: Guide for the Coop Shopper
description: You may know the Manhattan coop pot is bubbling. But you don't realize just how hot the market in sharedownership apartment buildings has become until you swallow hard and agree to consider investing $100,000 for a twobedroom unit  only to find brokers aren't interested in dealing with a piker like you.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: MADISON, Wis.  I had thought that once United StatesChina relations were normalized, complex truths about Chinese society would become apparent to everyone. But no, the simple, dominant image projected about China is as erroneous as ever.

title: A Late Starter First to Finish
description: Alan Kirick of Flushing Meadow, Queens, finished first yesterday in the second annual Knickerbocker 60kilometer race around Central Park.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: One of the things said about the Dance Theater of Harlem in recent years was that it had a repertory problem. In many ways, this was ironic since Arthur Mitchell, the troupe's founder, started it with an instant legacy of ballets by George Balanchine. Mitchell had been one of Balanchine's leading dancers in the New York City Ballet and the creator  with Diana Adams  of the astounding pas de deux in the 1957 landmark StravinskyBalanchin ballet, Agon. To remind us of that legacy, Agon, Bugaku, Allegro Brillante and The Four Temperaments were on the allBalanchine program that opened the Dance Theater of Harlem's 10th anniversary season, which closes at the City Center tonight.

title: His Old Home In China Seen By Blumenthal
description: SHANGHAI, March 3  Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal took a sentimental stroll today through the Shanghai neighborhoods where he and his family lived as destitute refugees from Nazi Germany.

title: Ron Guidry: Breezing Along At the Top
description: FORT LAUDERDALE. Fla., March 3  At a Junior Chamber of Commerce meeting in Lafayette, La., this winter, a man in the audience rose and asked Ron Guidry a long question about the new wave of astronomical baseball salaries.

title: Record of Appeals Over the Years
Rutgers Defeats Pitt For Eastern 8 Title
description: PITTSBURGH, March 3 (AP)  Kelvin Troy, a 6foot5inch junior, hit two free throws with eight seconds left to secure a 6157 victory for Rutgers tonight over the University of Pittsburgh in the Eastern Eight tournament final and send the Scarlet Knights into the National Collegiate basketball tournament.

title: Alaska Pilot Strike Ends
description: ANCHORAGE, March 3 (UPI)  A 22month strike by Wien Air Alaska pilots has ended with the signing of a fouryear contract, it was announced yesterday. The settlement followed the guidelines of a threeman, factfinding commission appointed in December by President Carter. About 125 pilots walked off the iob May 7, 1977. Aside from wages and benefits, the central issue was the airline's desire to operate Boeing 737's with twoman crews. The Air Line Pilots Association wanted to retain threeman crews. Under the settlement, the jets will be operated with twoman crews.

title: At Long Last, Educators Themselves Have Tipped In Favor of Instructional Television
description: Educational television has had two crosses to bear, its dedicated supporters and its dedicated foes. Frantic overselling of television as a pedagogical panacea merely stiffened the backs of those who view any outside source of instruction as a threat to education's workhorse, the teacher. But for several reasons, not the least of them the modern child's early conditioning, educational television today is closer than ever to defeating its opposition. Changes in technology almost assure its victory.

title: A Step From Politics Into Ecosystems
description: IN the 52 years since his birth in Lawrence, Kan., George L. Brown has held many posts. He has been a prizewinning journalist in Denver. He has been an executive of the Denver Housing Authority and the Metro Denver Urban Coalition; a member of the Colorado House of Representatives and Colorado Senate. And until Jan. 9, 1979, he was Lieutenant Governor of the State of Colorado.

title: FOCUS ON FRAGRANCE
description: It's the invisible part of every woman's wardrobe and yet it can make as definite a statement about who she is and how she feels as any dress. Today fragrance is an important dimension of fashion.

title: Mitchell J. Kassoff, Lawyer, Marries Gwendolyn A. Jones
description: Gwendolyn Ann Jones, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Melvin Jones of Danville, Va., was married yesterday to Mitchell Jay Kassoff, son of New York State Supreme Court Justice and Mrs. Edwin Kassoff of Little Neck, Queens. Rabbis Meir Fund and Moshe Shur officated at the Midway Jewish C:inter in Syosset, L.I.

title: Phyllis C. Hindle And Reinier Lock, Lawyer, Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs. James S. Hindle of Brooklyn Heights have announced the engagement of their daughter, Phyllis Constance Hindle, to Reinier Huw John Hughes Lock of Washington. He is a son of Hugh Vernon Hughes Lock of Johannesburg and the late Geraldine Lock. A May wedding is planned.

title: At Home: Absurdly Happy
description: ALTHOUGH I know a few people who are content and a greater number who are holding their own against depression, I can think of only one person in my acquaintance who is actively happy. You might even say that he is absurdly happy, a phrase invented especially for our time.

title: Events Today
description: Patterns and Sources of Navajo Weaving: Exhibition of Navajo rugs and techniques, noon to 4 P.M.; also a reading of Navajo poems and stories by poetdancer Laura Simms, 2 P.M., Queens Museum, Flushing MeadowCorona Park, Queens.

title: CAREY SET TO NAME DEVELOPMENT PANEL
