description: Governor Carey is expected to name a highlevel advisory council this week under the chairmanship of Felix G. Rohatyn to press longdormant construction projects and coordinate economic development activities by state agencies.

title: Whippet Is Best In Show
description: Under the shiny barrels of a dozen 155millimeter howitzers, a whippet was marched to the bestinshow honors at the Bronx County Kennel Club Show in the massive drillshed of the Eighth Regiment Armory yesterday. The whippet was Ch. Sporting Fields Clansman, the No. 1 representative of his breed in United States, and the top honor was his 19th at an all. breed fixture.

title: Boys, Clinton Fives Gain P.S.A.L. Final
description: Boys and Girls High and De Witt Clinton, ranked No. 1 and 2 in Public Schools Athletic League basketball tournament, advanced to next week's title game with lopsided semifinal triumphs yesterday.

title: CONSERVATION PLEA ON ALASKA IS DENIED
description: WASHINGTON, March 3  Advocates of Congressional action to protect about 104 million acres of Federal land in Alaska have suffered a temporary setback, with the House Interior Committee twice voting down a new bill that would have insured the plan.

title: State of the County Speech: Mild, Moderate and Measured
description: WHITE PLAINS

title: Barbara Quinn Is Married To Christopher Seymour
description: In the chapel of St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church in Manhattan at noon yesterday, Barbara Quinn, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Quinn of Beechhurst, Queens, and Hampton Bays, L.I., became the bride of Christopher Henry Seymour, son of Mrs. Francis G. Coleman of Washington, and Northeast Harbor, Me., and the late Jams A. Seymour. The ceremony was Performed by the Rev. Frederick B. Northup.

title: Opening of Bus Bids Is Expected to Foster Resumption of Talks
description: Steven Aiello, president of the New York City Board of Education, said yesterday that he was optimistic that talks between striking bus drivers and the board might resume after bids for contracts for the transportation of 32,000 handicapped pupils were opened tomorrow.

title: Westchester/This Week
description: THEATER

title: The Age of Railroad Stations Shown At Centre Georges Pompidou in Paris
description: PARIS  One of the many paradoxes of the Centre Georges Pompidou is that the department best attuned to the look and outlook of Beaubourg, as the center is familiarly known, has had more trouble than any other in hitting its stride  the Centre de Creation Industrielle (C.C.I.).

title: Museum Selling Land For Dix Hills Homes
description: Dix HILLS

title: Byman, Rookie, Leads in WindTorn Golf
description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 3 Arnold Palmer need not have worried about low scores blemishing the dignity of his 7,102yard championship golf course at the Bay Hill Club. For the first time since Thursday, a stiff wind came out of the east to disrupt scoring in the third round of the Citrus Classic.

title: Another Bateman Makes a Run for It
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y.

title: Mr. Carter, Don't Run
description: OXFORD, Ohio  President Carter should announce forthwith that he will not run for reelection. He faces such a forbidding array of obstacles that it is foolish to suppose that he can surmount them. It's all a shame.

title: INVESTING
description: The most beautiful money money can buy.

title: A Clerical Error Leads To Freedom for Inmate
description: McALESTER, Okla., March 3 (AP)  Donald Ray Stanley had just finished :erring a 10year sentence for burglary, so there did not seem to be anything amiss when he left the Oklahoma State Penitentiary. The only problem was that he had another sentence to serve.

title: ART
description: FAIR LAWN

title: Travel Unit May Get Reprieve
description: WASHINGTON. March 3 (AP)  A Senate panel has acted to reverse a Carter Administration decision to phase out the United States Travel Service. The Senate Commerce Committee approved a bill Wednesday authorizing $8 million to keep the agency in business through the 1980 fisca year

title: The Dangerous Poet
description: OSIP MANDELSTAM, probably the greatest Russian poet of this century, died just before World War II in a labor camp somewhere near Vladivostok. The whole terrible story, told eloquently by his widow, Nadezhda Mandelstam in Hope Against Hope and Hope Abandoned, is now widely known. In her excellent introduction to this edition of his critical prose and letters, Jane Gary Harris rightly confines herself to his intellectual development and to the ways he thought and wrote about art.

title: Lisbeth M. Byrne Plans May Bridal
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joseph M. Byrne 3d of Short Hills, N.J., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Lisbeth Mary Byrne, to Robert Lee Gett, son of Mr. and Mrs. Peter D. Gett of Indiana, Pa A May weddine Is planned.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR; A Reply to the Replies On Who Said Suffolk?
description: I was bemused by the series of letters to the editor [Feb. II] written in response to my article, Who Said Suffolk? I'm From Peconic.

description: WASHINGTON

description: YONKERS

title: Herbs for the Kitchen
description: Herbs are delightful plants for any garden. Some are aromatic, others are valued for their scent. A few have medicinal uses. Yet the delicious culinary herbs are the ones gardeners like to grow.

title: Deatha
description: HALPERIN Samuel M. The officers and directors of A.I.C.F. extend their deep sympathy to his wile, Jeanette; children, Joanne and Michael; their spouses, Fred Siegmund, our secretary, and Eftie; and the grandchildren.

title: Around the Nation
description: Florida Governor Activates Guard in Pensacola Flood

title: Picketing Ends in Pontiac, Mich., As City Workers Prepare for Vote
description: PONTIAC, Mich., March 3 (AP) Picket lines came down today as more than 400 public works employees prepared to vote on a tentative contract to end their threeday strike.

title: Amin's Rule in Uganda Imperiled As Tanzanian Force Nears Capital
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 4  President Idi Amin of Uganda is facing the gravest armed threat to his autocratic regime since he seized power eight years ago.

title: 4 Are Killed in Heavy Flooding In Southeastern and Gulf States
description: Flooding that mounted after heavy rains buckled pavement and uprooted trees in the Gulf and Atlantic states yesterday. Four persons were killed and hundreds were forced to evacuate their homes.

title: Life is Ups and Downs for Troupe of Traveling Clowns
description: Seeking fun, and a bit of notoriety, the Cumeezi Bow Ensemble set up shop in Port Authority Bus Terminal yesterday. William McKinney soared like a bird  with the help of 9yearold Monica Gonzalez. But as travelers gathered, a police officer led group outside for creating an illegal crowd.

title: Guitar: Stezzicadi 's Bach
description: WILLIAM STEZZICADI gave a program of guitar music late Saturday afternoon in Carnegie Recital Hall entitled Bach and the Moderns. This proved to be somewhat misleading, since the modern works turned out to be warhorses of the guitar repertory by Villa Lobos (No. 7 of the 12 etudes) and Sir William Walton (two bagatelles)  a rather skimpy and not espedaily representative sampling of contemporary music for the instrument.

title: Rainy Day Reflections
description: Joggers in Central Park seemed not to mind yesterday's drizzle. No doubt they were glad it wasn't snow. More rain is expected today.

title: Prison Guard Wounded in Rome
description: ROME, March 4 (AP) A gunman firing from a passing car seriously wounded a prison guard here last night as he was leaving the home of his fiance, the police reported today. The guard, Miro Renzaglia, 21 years old, was shot in the chest and right arm.

title: Paige Spurs Villanova Victory
description: PRINCETON, N.J.. March 4 There seemed to be no way Don Paige of Villanova could make up the difference. Not 2.8 seconds in a twomile relay leg. Not 25 yards that looked more like 90. Not after he had just won the open halfmile run 35 minutes earlier. Not against John Murphy, a 4:02 miler from Harvard.

title: RecordKeeping Ended For Vietnam Deserters
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP)  The amnesty that President Carter granted to draft evaders and some deserters from the Vietnam War era when he took office has quietly faded into history with officials not even bothering anymore to keep track of those who returned.

title: Liberal Senators Say Arms Pact Would Not Curb Weapons Race
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  Three liberal senators criticized the projected new SovietAmerican treaty on strategic arms today, saying that the accord did not go far enough to limit nuclear ar senals.

title: A Farewell Appearance By Thomas
description: THERE were no surprises on Michael Tilson Thomas's concert with the Buffalo Philharmonic yesterday afternoon in Carnegie Hall  except, perhaps, for the fact that there were no surprises.

title: Refiner Cuts Allocations
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, March 4, (UPI)  The KerrMcGee Refining Corporation, in a step similar to one taken by other refiners recently, over the weekend announced an immediate 15 percent reduction in gasoline allocations to all its customers. The company said the new allocation figures of 85 percent of deliveries in March 1978 would be subject to review throughout the month and could go up or down depending upon gasoline availability. The company markets refined products through approximately 1,600 retail service stations in the Middle West and Southwest.

title: Relief Asked in African Drought
description: OUAGADOUGOU. Upper Volta (AP)  The countries of Africa's Sahel region, which is periodically devastated by drought, appealed today international aid.

title: China Reports British Pact
description: TOKYO, March 4 (AP)  Britain and China signed an economic pact in Peking today, and a British official said the two nations had set a goal of $14 billion worth of economic activities between now and 1985, China's press agency, Xinhua, said. It added that China's Foreign Trade Minister, Li Qiang, and Britain's Secretary for Industry, Eric Varley, had signed the agreement.

title: Music of U.S. and Cuba Mixes at Havana Festival
description: HAVANA, March 4  The Americans call it the Havana Jam"; for the Cubans, more formally, it 's Musica CubaU.S.A. For both countries, the three concerts this weekend at the Karl Marx Theater, a 4,800seat facility on the oceanfront just west of downtown Havana, constitute an unprecedented festival of jazz, rock and pop musicians from Cuba and the United States  and the first formal concerts here by United States musicians in 20 years.

title: Sports Briefs
description: Special to The New York Times

title: For Sale: Isle of Saints and Kings
description: GLASGOW, March 4  The tiny island of Iona, noted as an early center of Celtic Christianity, is for sale.

title: Operation Illiteracy
description: BOSTONTwenty percent of adult men and women in this nation cannot read enough to understand a wantad or write enough to fill in a job application. The term for this condition, which is crippling to any dream of leading a productive or rewarding life, is functional illiteracy.

title: Study Drive at Chicago School Has a Hazy Identity
description: CHICAGO  Although he was a part of it, Gregory Lewis was not exactly sure what the Push for Excellence program was. Its name was too similar to Access to Excellence, the Board of Education's desegregation plan.

title: City Officials Link Mobsters To 7 SchoolBus Companies
description: Officials of two city agencies say that they have uncovered evidence that organized crime controls several of the smaller private bus companies in the city.

title: White's Future in Doubt
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fln., March 4  Roy White, whose carter with the Yankees bridges the gap between the team's championship eras, could be beginning his last year in pinstripes, White is entering the final year of his threeyear contract and the Yankees don't seem cautious to extend his tenure.

title: Bullets Edge Spurs
description: LANDOVER, Md.. March 4 (UPI) Tom Henderson scored 6 points in the final 20 seconds tonight to give the Washington Bullets a 129128 victory over the San Antonio Spurs in a meet??

title: Toss Notes Saudi Interview
description: MOSCOW, March 4  The Soviet press agency Tass carried a threeparagraph article today on the Saudi Foreign Minister's interview in Al Hawadess. The Tass dispatch contained no comment or evaluation of the remarks.

title: U. S. Identifies 2 Crash Victims
description: HAHN AIR BASE, West Germany. March 4 (AP)  The Air Force identified two officers today who were killed in Friday's crash of an F4 Phantom jet as Capt. Kurt M. Browne, 29 years old, of Indianapolis. and First Lieut. Raymond Reed Jr., 24, of Petaluma, Calif.

title: 2 Badboys In 2d Crash
description: ROCKINGHAM, N.C., March 4 (AP)  Ten miles into the Carolina 500 Grand National stock car race today, Cale Yarborough and Donnie Allison crashed while battling side by side for the lead, triggering another controversy and an eightcar, chainreaction accident that sent two drivers to the hospital.

title: Commodities
description: IT has been six years since the grain trade saw visions of an Apocalyptic horseman  global famine  when the poor worldwide crops in 1972 wiped out virtually all surpluses of basic grains in this nation and elsewhere.

title: 4 MOONS OF JUPITER ARE PHOTOGRAPHED
description: PASADENA, Calif., March 4  The Voyager 1 spacecraft, on the eve of its rendezvous with the giant planet Jupiter, returned color photographs today of the planet's four largest moons, which until this weekend had been only faint points of light as seen through the Earth's best telescopes.

title: N.I.T. Field
description: March 7

title: Nicaraguans Kill U. S. Teacher
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, March 4 (UPI)  An American teacher, John McCarthy, 29 years old of Cedar Rapids, Iowa, was killed early yesterday when Nicaraguan national guardsmen fired submachine guns at a car after they said the driver ignored an order to halt, American Embassy officials said.

title: TV: Drama Of Unhappy Woman
description: IMMERSE Jennifer in warm water and watch itdevelop a fragrant, creamy lather. The show, which will be seen from 9 to 11 tonight on NBC, is subtitled A Woman's Story. It certainly is that.

title: TV, Nielsen And the N.B.A.
description: WITH its Nielsen pluging dangerously, professional basketbal is being scrutinized like NBC's Supertrain, the Long Island Rail Road of television. Will the N.B.A. crash? Will Robin Williams and Gary Coleman be the first two choices in the nextdraft? Will theKnicks spend millions to get Ken Howard, the White Shadow, to come out of retirement and save the game from its alleged black peril?

title: Saudi Hints at Efforts For Better Soviet Ties But Not Formal Links
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 4  Saudi Arabia's Foreign Minister has hinted in an interview with a Lebanese magazine that Saudi relations with the Soviet Union may improve, but Saudi diplomatic sources here said there had been no change in the nation's policy toward Moscow or the rest of the Communist world.

title: Market Place
description: THE McDonald's Corporation, while it has fared better than any but a handful of corporations, has been a mediocre stock for some years now.

title: Washington Watch
description: WASHINGTON THE Energy Department is trying to turn a sow's ear into a silk purse. The Iranian oil crisis has strained the department's credibility and torpedoed many of its plans, but ultimately it may prove useful to the department. Officials hope to use the oil shortage to help encourage industry to shift away from oil, to moderate the effect of environmental regulations on energy production and to decontrol domestic oil prices.

title: The U.N. Today
description: March 5, 1979

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, MARCH 5, 1979

title: Sports World Specials
description: Do you believe in love at first sight? I do. Call me. Pat Callahan, a young catcher who was working out with the New York Yankees at their spring training camp in pnrt Lauderdale. Fla., read that note from Melissa Norman a year ago. Hi was not particularly interested. Base ball players get notes and invitation: all the time.

title: Music: Sine Nomine in Praise of Song
description: IT'S quite amazing, when one thinks of it, how much music has been written over the centuries in praise of music. This was the theme of the Sine Nomine Singers concert Saturday night in Alice Tully Hall, and the group's conductor. Harry Saltzman, chose a generous selection from the Renaissance and early Baroque repertories, all of it extolling the charms, expressive potency and. at times, the vital necessity of mils, : man's daytoday life.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: We were talking about oysters the other evening and someone recalled that fine passage from M.F.K. Fisher's translation of BrillatSavarin's discourse on oysters contained in his Physiology of Taste.

title: Bucks Beat Celtics
description: BOSTON, March 4 (AP)  Marques Johnson pumped in 36 Points and Brian Winters. added 27 in leading the Milwaukee Bucks to a 135122 triumph over the Boston Celtics today.

title: Argentine Is Sentenced to Death
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 4 (Reuters) A court handed down today the first Argentine death sentence since the 1930's. A coast guardsman was sentenced after being convicted of kidnapping a prostitute and her lover, and then killing them after raping the woman. Capital punishment was reintroduced here in 1970.

title: Vienna Policemen to Guard Borg
description: VIENNA, March 4 (Reuters)  Plainclothes policemen will mingle with spectators at an exhibition tennis match tomorrow to guard against any possible attempt on the life of Bjorn Borg, the Swedish tennis star. A letter distributedin Sweden last week said that Italy's Red Brigades guerrilla group planned to kill Mr. Borg, a threetime Wimbledon champion. Attached to the death threat was a picture, taken in Israel last autumn, showing Mr. Borg wearing an Israeli Army shirt and carrying a machine gun.

title: Pauline Swayze Bride of Edward Finch Jr.
description: Pauline Hoefer Swayze, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Chester A. Hoefer of Brookline, Mass., was married on Saturday to Edward Ridley Finch Jr., son of the late Judge Edward R. Finch of the State Court of Appeals and the late Mrs. Finch, the former Mary Livingston Delafield.

title: Postal Service Honors Einstein on His Centennial
description: Margot Einstein, daughter of the renowned physicist, viewing an enlarged reproduction of stamp commemorating her father's 100th birthday during ceremonies yesterday at the Institute for Advanced Studies in Princeton, N.J. Albert Einstein fled Germany during the Nazi takeover.

title: NonCuban Latins in Miami Growing in Economic Impact
description: MIAMI, March 4  A week ago, two carnival balls here drew an enthusiastic crowd of over 2,000 Brazilians and other South Americans who tried to emulate the frenzy of the Rio de Janeiro carnival. At a nearby hotel at the same time, an elaborate wedding reception was attended by hundreds of prosperous Argentines, compatriots of the bridegroom, a wealthy local garment manufacturer.

title: Wagner, Kentucky Gain N.I.T.
description: Wagner, on a quest for glory, and Kentucky, which has known years of basketball glory, were among the teams selected yesterday for the 24team National Invitation Tournament.

title: Dressing for Job Interviews: Two Opinions
description: Between five and 45 seconds after you meet someone they've decided if they like you or don't like you.

title: Aides Try to Subtract Politics From Carey Air Costs
description: ALBANY, March 2  The philosophical question of what is government and what is politics is taking on a new fiscal dimension in Governor Carey's office, as aides try to determine how much of Mr. Carry's flying time in the state's executive plane last year was for the husinef s of government and how much was for the business of getting reelected.

title: Role of Pension in Divorce Cases Becomes Focus of Legal Debate
description: Pensions have become the focus of a legal battle involving warring spouses and their lawyers, as well as Government, industry and feminists.

title: Affirmed Sets Anita Record
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 4  Affirmed broke the record for a mileandaquarter track while scoring an impressive victory in the $312,800 Santa Anita Handicap today at Santa Anita. A turnout of 66,477 looked on under cloudless skies.

title: Holdup Stirs SoulSearching at a Church in Queens
description: The holdup took place more than month ago, but the people at the First Methodist Church in Jamaica, Queens, are only now making their peace with it.

title: Why Not Certify School Attendance?
description: The New York State Board of Regents has denied local school districts the right to issue certificates to students who finish their course work but fail to satisfy requirements for a highschool diploma. The board rode roughshod over recommendations by Gordon Ambach, tge Commissioner of Education, and failed unaccountably to consult with local school officials. Why was it so hasty and autocratic?

title: Chess:; OldFashioned Tacticians Can Still (Sometimes) Win Innovation Up Sleeve
description: A rare bird these days is the oldfashioned tournament player who comes to a game with a lot of selfreliance and little theoretical opening preparation.

title: Spain Reinforces Democracy
description: In the three years since Franco's death, Spain has transformed itself. An oppressive, lawandorder dictatorship has become Europe's newest democracy and last week the country held its second parliamentary election in two years. This remarkable evolution, accomplished without violent upheaval, owes much to Spain's political leaders, who have put consolidation of democracy ahead of partisan interests.

title: N.C.A.A. Field Includes St. John's
description: Despite losing their last games, Notre Dame and St. John's were pleasantly surprised yesterday when the Irish became one of the four topseeded teams in the 41st annual National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament and the Redmen received an unexpected bid to the championship.

title: Sadat Informed of Talks
description: CAIRO, March 9  President Sadat received a report today from President Carter on his talks with Prime Minister Begin, but Mr. Sadat said he had not yet been invited to go to the United States.

title: Francis B. Malloy, Was Manager Of Photo Lab at The Times, at 68
description: Francis B. Malloy, who retired in 1976 as manager of The New York Times photography laboratory, died Saturday in Nassau Hospital in Mineola, L.I. He was 68 years old. Mr. Malloy was stricken while dancing a polka with his granddaughter at a party Saturday night.

title: 15MonthOld Miniature Schnauzer Best in New Jersey Show
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., March 4  Under a daily double and exacta?? sign in the enclosed grandstand of the Meadowlands Race Track, a miniature schnauser?? romped off with the bestinshow award today at the Kennel Club of New Jersey's 36th annual event.

title: Rangers Lose Goal and Game
description: The Rangers timing was off last night. When they thought they had scored a goal, it was nullified by the buzzer. When they took their goalie out, the Maple Leafs scored. When they took a shot, most were stopped by the goalie. And when they finally began to score, the game ended.

title: Jazz: Bob James Group
description: MOST of the program by Bob James 's 14piece orchestra Saturday at Avery Fisher Hall was a dalliance with the threshold of pain. The instruments, primarily the electronic instruments, were so overamplified that virtually nothing could be heard but shattered shards of sound. But toward the end of the program the primary culprit in creating this wreckage was revealed. It was Mr. James himself, playing an electric piano.

title: Let Them Eat TradeOffs
description: Congress has devised two ingenious principles of human kindness:

title: Patricia Weinberg Married To Prof. Christos Ioannides
description: Patricia A. Weinberg, a media planner at Benton & Bowles in New York, was married yesterday to Christos P. Ioannides. a professor at the Center for Mediterranean and Arab Studies in Athens. The ceremony was performed at the home of the bride's parents, Mr, and Mrs. Norman Jay Weinberg of Eastehester, N.Y., by Town Justice Jay Gray. The bridegroom is a son of Mrs. Polykarpos Joannides of Cyprus, and the late Mr.loannides, a journalist.

title: Poverty Is Said to Affect A Fourth of City's Youth
description: Nearly onefourth of New York City's children under the age of 18  23.8 percent  lived in poverty as of 1975, according to an Analysis of Federal samplings made public last week. The figure was far above the national average of 15.3 percent.

title: Lewis, Wagner Fives Gain P.S.A.L. Girls Final
description: Margaret Pape scored with five seconds remaining to give Francis Lewis High a 6664 triumph in overtime yesterday over Julia Richman, the defender, in the Public Schools Athletic League girls basketball semifinals at Brandeis High School.

title: Police in New Orleans Return to Their Posts After Strike Is Broken
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 4  The twoweek strike by New Orleans police officers ended today, and Mayor Ernest N. Morial said that more than 1,000 of the 1,100 striking officers had reported to work.

title: Vietnam Veteran Held in Boston After Firing on Imaginary Enemy
description: BOSTON, March 4 (UPI)  A 27yearold Vietnam veteran was arrested this weekend after exchanging gunfire with an imaginary enemy on the roof of an apartment building, the police said.

title: The City
description: A 20yearold student was stabbed in the heart with an ice pick early yesterday morning in a robbery by three men on Central Park South at Avenue of the Americas, the police said. He was reported in fair condition after surgery last evening at Roosevelt Hospital.

title: Supplementary OTC Listings
description: Week Ended March 2, 1979

title: An Exposition For Outdoorsmen
description: SUFFERN. N.Y. PIERRE CHAMPOUX saved the day for me. Arriving early here at what was billed as the Second Annual World Fishing and Outdoor Exposition, a fiveday event that closed yesterday, I was overwhelmed by the plethora of exhibits and did not know where to start.

title: Brezhnev Joins Russians in Picking Supreme Soviet
description: MOSCOW, March 4  Leonid 1. Brezhnev voted today in the elections for the Supreme Soviet, and, like the rest of the country's 160 million voters, he was offered no choice.

title: Space Shuttle to Arrive at Cape
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., March 4 (UN)  Columbia, the first space shuttle scheduled to be flown into orbit, will arrive at Cape Canaveral next week. It will be placed atop a space agency 747 jet on the flight from Edwards Air Force Base, Calif. The target date for the first shuttle launch from Cape Canaveral is Nov. 9.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE honeymoon is over for Joseph Heller. He will be thumped on for having written this savage novel. In retrospect, it seems that Something Happened was reviewed in a haze of nostalgia for Catch22. Something Happened was blacker than it was humorous, full of strangled anger and stoppered sobs, but we wanted Mr. Heller to be funny. We insisted that he was laughing: instead, he was gagging.

title: Sharpshooting Suns Rout 76ers
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., March 4 (AP) The Phoenix Suns, paced by 26 points from Walter Davis and 23 from Alvan Adams, outscored Pinladelphia. 3415, in the second quarter and 32I8 in the third quarter on the way to beating the 76ers, 11994, in a National Basketball Association game today.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partiallist of scheduled Meetings for week follows:

title: Expect the Unexpected
description: PHIL Bieber was taken aback to read that when Steve Cauthen decided to ride in Europe for a year he didn't consult his agent, Harry Hacek, who heard of the jockey's plans on television and was understandably upset. Most race trackert, Phil wrote, myself included, felt that Steve was a guy with class and perhaps he had good reasons. Anyway, the incident stirred some memories.

title: Arab League Meets on Yemen Fight
description: KUWAIT, March 4  Arab League foreign ministers met here today in an emergency session called to try to end the fighting between proWestern Yemen and the Marxist regime in Southern Yemen.

title: Rio, Opening Subway, Asks  If the Chaos Was Worth It
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 4 The city fathers of Rio de Janeiro will launch an unlikely enterprise in this naturally favored metropolis tomorrow: They are urging its residents to go underground.

title: The Region.
description: A small private plane crashed at Newark International Airport while trying to land in heavy fog yesterday evening, killing at least one person, the Port Authority police said.

title: Music: Can tilena Players
description: THE Cantilena Chamber Players gave the first performance of a work by the Danish composer Niels Viggo Bentzon yesterday afternoon in the subterranean concert hall at the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum. Mr. Bentzon's piece, which he calls Sonata for Violin, Viola, Cello and Piano (1978), carries the opus number 417, which suggests how industrious he has been in a time when many of his composing colleagues find it a struggle to finish one or two scores a year.

title: Sporting Gear
description: Notice the manufacturer's warning on many downfilled clothes and sleeping bags: Do not wash. Dryclean. You can ignore that advice with NuDown. It has no soap or filler (usually soda ash) and therefore leaves no residue, which is what causes down to mat or clump. Further, NuDown contains no phosphate or borate and is biodegradable. An eightounce box of it is priced at about $3 at Paragon and Morsan's. The manufacturer is Royal Down Products of Belding, Mich.

title: Obituary 5  No Title
description: Deatha

title: Bridge:
description: As a result of some upsets in Saturday's Grand National team play, the quarterfinal stage at the Beverly East Club, at Lexington Avenue and 50th Street, included some unfamiliar names yesterday.

title: Spectacular Bid Has Trainer Smelling Roses
description: HALLANDALE. FLA. SPECTACULAR BID'S trainer, talking with the fervor of a Bible salesman, has just begun explaining why Secretariat could not have beaten his tiger when the office telephone in Barn 5 at Gulfstream Park rings again. This time it's Kentucky on the line.

title: Jamil M. Baroody, Saudi Arabia's U.N. Delegate, Dies
description: Jamil Murad Baroody, the dean of United Nations delegates and Saudi Arabia's spokesman since the creation of the world organization, died yesterday at Lenox Hill Hospital after a twoyear fight against cancer.

title: Question Box
description: QUESTION: What is the longest touch. down pass play in the history of the National Football League?

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Dance: Two Pigeons, By Ashton, in Toronto
description: TORONTO SIR FREDERICK ASHTON's poetic and allegorical ballet The Two Pigeons is one of those cult works whose legend grows the less one actually sees the ballet itself.

title: Notes on People; Maurice Bidermann Buys Out House for a ThankYou B.F. Skinner's Daughter Reported Alive and Thriving Synonym for Upset? The Mystery of How Mrs. Warner Broke Her Finger A Kind of Survival
description: A romantic might call it a great tribute to the performing arts, but, in truth, Maurice Bidermann, the French apparel tycoon, was looking for a way to thank business associates who have helped him make $500 million in this country over the last five years. Still, it is no small gesture when one buys out the Minskoff Theater for tomorrow night's opening of the Maurice Bjart dance company, with proceeds going to the Musicians Emergency Fund. That represents 1,571 tickets and means that no one except a few dance critics will be able to see the Bejart troupe tomorrow without a Bidermann invitation.

title: Teamsters Hold A Family Rally At Queens Dairy
description: While both sides in the milk strike prepared for today's new round of negotiations and outofstate milk continued to fill the shelves of local supermarkets, a total of 500 striking teamsters, their wives and children held a rally outside a Queens dairy plant.At the same time, New York city's consumer Aifairs Department said 77 percent of the stores it had surveyed over the weekend had had milk for sale, but said some were charging customers more than a fair markup.

title: Byman, a Rookie, Wins Golf Playoff
description: ORLANDO. Fla., March 4  Bob Byrnan. a 23yearold rookie, posted his first victory on the PGA Tour today, in the Citrus Classic. by beating John Schroeder on the second hole of a suddendeath playoff. He shot a par 4 to Schroeder's bogey on the 442yard 16th hole.

title: San Francisco Mayor Is Planning To Marry an Investment Banker
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 4 (AP)Mayor Dianne Feinstein plans to marry Richard Blum, a 43yearold investment banker, later this year, the Mayor has an nounced.

title: Rock: Dire Straits, New English Group
description: IF you want to catch someone's attention, advises a perfume commercial on television, whisper. This prescription has certainly worked wonders for Dire Straits, a new English rock group whose international hit single, Sultans of Swing, and first album stand out in a noisy crowd by seldom raising the volume above a murmur. Making its first local appearance Friday night at the jampacked Bottom Line, Dire Straits proved to be one of the most distinctive and delightful bands in recent memory.

title: Mahre Fractures Leg
description: WILMINGTON, N.Y., March 4  All hope that an American skier might win a World Cup for the first time in the event's history went crashing down the slopes of Whiteface Mountain today.

title: Grocer, in 15 Battles, Finally Kills a Robber
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 4 (UPI) Jose San Miguel, 78 years old, says he has shot at least 15 armed robbers in the 25 years he has run his small grocery store, but he never killed one until this weekend.

title: Connors Turns Back Ashe
description: MEMPHIS, March 4  Like the muddy Mississippi, which runs through this river town, Jimmy Connors just keeps rolling along. He rolled today to his fifth United States Indoor tennis championship. a feat achieved only once before  when riverboats were commonplace at the turn of the century.

title: Around the Nation
description: CHICAGO, March 4 (UPI)  A man who held police at bay for 16 hours last December in a domestic dispute shot two officers to death yesterday because he believed one had mistreated him, the police said today.

title: Spending Plans at Peak
description: Capital appropriations for the nation's 1,000 largest manufacturers rose to a record $19.2 billion in the fourth quarter of last year and were up 17 percent from the level of the third quarter. the Conference Board reported yesterday.

title: T.P.R.: Canadiens Still at Top, and Rangers Gain
description: This week's teampowerrating evaluation of National Hockey League clubs, based on games through last Monday, shows a change in position by 11 teams. The Montreal Canadiens retain the No. 1 spot, with a lead of 70 T.P.R. points over the perennial runnerups, the New York Islanders.

title: Navratilova Conquers Evert
description: DALLAS, March 4  Martina Naratilova finally won her hometown tournament this afternoon, defeating secondseeded Chris Evert, 64, 64, for the $35,000 first prize in the Championships of Dallas.

title: Violence Arouses Debate on Subway Safety and Policing
description: Considering the series of violent inci dents on the subway system and the flood of news and analysis about it, any one of the last few weeks could have been called The Warriors Week.

title: Falco Dancers to Open At City Center March 27
description: The Louis Falco Dance Company will mark its 12th anniversary with a one, week season at the City Center55th, Street Theater from March 27 through April 1.

title: Critic Urges Isolation Of Children's TV Ads
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (UPI) Robert Choate, head of the Council on Children, Media and Merchandising. suggested today that television commercials aimed at children should be set off the way advertising in newspapers is separated from news.

title: Smaller Bond Schedule
description: The credit markets last week handled a relatively heavy schedule of newissue financing, but they seemed to lack any real sense of direction. This week, the volume of new fixedincome securities for sale is smaller, and the market will have a chance to regain its thrust, one way or the other.

title: TV Hex Haunts Irish Again
description: PONTIAC, Mich., March 4 (AP)Mike McGee and Phil Hubbard combined to score 30 points today as the University of Michigan upset Notre Dame, 6259, in college basketball at the Pontiac Silverdome.

title: Iran to Allow Recovery Of U. S. Military Files
description: TEHERAN, Iran, March 4 (Reuters)  American officials have been given permission to collect files from the ransacked headquarters of the United States military advisory mission here, Deputy Prime Minister Abbas Amir Entezam said today.

title: 2 Hurt in Navy Ship Collision
description: NORFOLK, Va., March 4 (AP)  Two Navy officers were injured seriously today when the amphibious transport Francis Marion collided in heavy fog with the Greek cargo ship Star Light. Lieut. John Alexander. a Navy spokesman. said the ships collided at 8:42 A.M. two miles westnorthwest of Cape Henry light in Chesapeake Bay. Both vessels were damaged. The injured officers were taken to Portsmouth Naval Hospital. Their identities were withheld pending notification of relatives.

title: TV Ads Aimed at Children: Should the F.T.C. Step In?; The Background; For Regulation; Against Regulation; The Outlook
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  Regulation of children's television, a longsimmering issue among broadcasters, advertisers and producers of goods for the young, appears to be approaching the boiling point.

title: Dissent on Saccharin Report
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  When a jury of eminent scientists had cleared the way for Federal approval of saccharin, all but lost in the collective sigh of relief heaved by many Americans was the fact that a dozen committee members had expressed serious doubts about some of the recommendations in the widely publicized report.

title: ESSAY
description: WASHINGTON  This will bring you luck, said Menachem Begin at the Blair House kosher dinner on Friday night, offering President Carter a piece of challak, a traditional egg bread with braided crust, that had just been blessed.

title: Back to America For London's Baring
description: LONDON, March 4  Baring Brothers, the venerable London merchant bank that helped raise the money for the Louisiana Purchase and later owned 1.2 million acres in the state of Maine, is returning to the United States after being absent since the turn of the century.

title: World News Briefs
description: PARIS, March 4 (Reuters)  President Valery Giscard d'Estaing returned today from a visit to Mexico to decide whether to call an emergency session of Parliament to deal with an unemployment crisis.

title: Stefan Frenkel, at 73
description: Stefan Frenkel, former concertmaster of the Metropolitan Opera, died Thursday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home in Forest Hills, Queens. He was 73 years old.

title: Koch Answers Queries in Harlem, Then Is Shouted Down by Hecklers
description: Mayor Koch held a constituent hour', in Harlem yesterday, answering questions from residents about local problems, but the second half of the session became turbulent. An organized group ofhostile demonstrators threatened Mr. Koch face to face, and the Mayor rejected as false and vile their charges that he was a racist.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TODAY. March 5

title: TOM CREAVY, AT 68
description: Tom Creavy, the onetime Tuckahoe caddie who won the 1931 Professional Golfers Association championship at the age of 20, died of  heart attack Saturday night at his winter home in Delray Beach, Fla.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Communications Council Formed
description: As part of its effort toward revitalization, the New York Chamber of Commerce and Industry has formed a Communications Industry Council to bring together leaders of agencies, the media and supplier companies to work to improve the business climate, help the city with its communications needs and do a little publicservice work.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THE CITY SPEAKS Enid Dame and Roberta Gould will read from their verse tonight at 6:30 in the first of three free programs on Mondays presented by the New York Poets Cooperative at the Bloomingdale branch of the New York Public Library, 150 West 100th Street. Barbara Howes and Ann Stanford read at 8 o 'clock at the Poetry Center of the 92d Street Young Men 'sYoung Women 's Hebrew Association near Lexington Avenue; tickets are $3.

title: Obituary 7  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Sally Little, on 278, Victor by 2 Shots
description: SARASOTA, Fla., March 4  Sally Little of South Africa pulled away from the field with four straight birdies on the back nine today to win the $100,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association Bent Tree classic.

title: Professor, Teach
description: At a recent alumni reunion, a 1978 high school graduate told me she was shocked during her first class at a leading university. The young teaching assistant, who had been given complete responsibility for teaching a freshman English class, asserted: I don't Want to be here any more than you want to be here. My first responsibility is to myself and my doctoral work and I will be happier than you when this course is finished.

title: Harold Katz Weds Barbara R. Trager
description: Barbara R. Trager, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Seymour Trager of Little Neck, Queens, was married there yesterday in Temple Torah to Harold R. Katz, son of Mrs. Gilbert Fleischer of the Bronx. Rabbi Morton L. Gordon performed the ceremony.

title: Events
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center. Mozart's Die ??, 8.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Stony Brook Village Is Under Inquiry
description: STONY BROOK, L.I.  There are no fastfood restaurants in the village here, no glass or steel modern structures, and the colonialstyle gasoline station announces its presence with a demure sign.

title: CORE's Founder and ExMembers Planning a New Civil Rights Group
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  Scores of former members of the Congress of Racial Equality, joining CORE's founder, James L. Farmer, agreed informally here today to create a new, racially mixed national civil rights organization.

title: Opec Links Sales To Mideast Pact
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates, March 4 (AP)  The president of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries said today that future oil sales to consumer nations should depend on whether they help bring about a Middle East settlement favorable to the Palestinians.

title: DITMCO On Its Own Again
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Have you ever wondered what happened to all those small technology companies that disappeared during the mergers and acquisitions of the late 1960's?

title: Stage: Strangers Limns LewisThompson Union
description: SHORT of moving the words The End up about two and a halfhours, there is not much that could have saved Strangers. It is easily the least play to collapse onto Broadway in a thin season.

title: OffDuty Officer Kills One of 3 Men in Clash On Long Island Street
description: An offduty Kings Point, L.I., police officer shot and killed one volunteer fireman and seriously wounded two others during a street altercation in Kings Point late Saturday, the police said.

title: Racing Talks Resume Today
description: The continuing labor dispute between the New York Racing Association and the union of parimutuel clerks simmered through its lfith day yesterday at Aqueduct while the track completed a ninerace card under cloudy skies.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: The fixedincome securities market does not seem to know which way to turn.

title: Princes Said to Prepare For a New Saudi King
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (Reuters)  Senior princes in Saudi Arabia's royal family are preparing for the possibility that King Khalid may die or leave the throne in the next few months, sources in the United States Government said today.

title: Debate Rages Over Policies of City Correction Chief
description: He is a dictator. He is a reformer. He is a strutting martinet. He is an efficient administrator. He is destroying morale in the Correction Department. He is ending coverups and brutality.

title: Zachry Learning to Cope
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 4 Morale on this team is mixed, Pat Zachry of the New York Mets was say ing today. Some people would give their eyeteeth just to get out.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Ballet Theater  at Met April 16
description: New works by Glen Tetley and An terry Tudor will highlight the American Ballet Theater's eightweek spring sea. son at the Metropolitan Opera House from April 16 through June 9. Mr. Tetjey's Contredances, set to music by Anton Webern and starring Natalia Makarova and Anthony Dowell, will first be seen on opening night.

title: Strict Audit Will Regulate Research Expenses of Universities That Get Federal Grants
description: The Federal Office of Management and Budget has announced that a strict new auditing system will go into effect in October to oversee and regulate all research expenses incurred by universities receiving Federal grants for scientific research.

title: PEKING WARNS HANOI AGAINST ANY ATTACK DURING WITHDRAWAL
description: China was reported to have warned Vietnam yesterday that China would open a new offensive if withdrawing units of its army were attacked by Vietnamese troops.

title: Obituary 3  No Title
description: Death

title: Invasion Debate: U.N. Weakness Displayed
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 4 The Security Council's rancorous Indochina debate has been another reminder of the practical limitations of the United Nations in dealing with conflicts when the parties involved do not wish it to act.

title: Brown Touching Bases in Undeclared Bid
description: Munching popcorn and sipping beer, the Governor was saying his trip to Washington had been a success when a reporter asked when all the business about his not having decided whether to run for President would stop.

title: F15 TlyIn to Saudi Arabia Met Host of Problems
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  The January excursion of a dozen F15 fighter planes to Saudi Arabia to show the American flag in the troubled Middle East seems to demonstrate the problems of attempting jetage innovations in oldfashioned gunboat diplomacy.

title: 3 Newspaper Reporters to Comply With Subpoenas to Testify on L.I.
description: Three newspaper reporters have agreed to comply with subpoenas to testify in Long Island about marijuana arrests they had written about.

title: TV SPORTS
description: TONIGHT

title: Ford Heir's Business Wrangles
description: LOS ANGELES  Benson Ford Jr., the 29yearold Ford heir who seeks to become a director of the Ford Motor Company, the nation's fourthranking industrial concern, has already begun a business career that has attracted more than its share of controversy.

title: Hope Takes Title In Junior Boxing
description: SAN REMO, Italy, March 4 (AP) Maurice Hope of Britain became the new World Boxing Council junior middleweight champion tonight after the referee declared Rocky Mattioli of Italy unfit to continue after the eighth round because of a sprained wrist.

title: Advertising
description: THE advertising business was still dazed on Friday from the Chrysler Corporation's bombshell Thursday that it would be putting all $120 million or more of its advertising budget in Kenyon & Eckhardt, which gave up about $75 million in Ford Motor business in order to accept the Chrysler account.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Aria con Variazioni. Handel; Moto Perpetuo, Paganini; Gaillard in D minor, Gibbons; American Suite. When Jotumy Comes Marching Home, Gould; Faust Waltz, Gounod; Pavan in A minor, Purcell.

title: Saudi Oil Capacity Questioned
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  Two major United States oil companies, under subpoena, have submitted documents to a Congressional committee that raise serious questions about the longterm productivity of Saudi Arabia's oilfields, according to Administration officials familiar with the documents.

title: Letter: On Assisting Retirees
description: To the Editor:

title: Society Seeks, Y'Know, Ban On Prolixity
description: It has been two months since a group of college professors, linguists and others proposed banishing a dozen overused, misused or pompous words in, you know, a really unique attempt to provide a viable alternative to the cluttered phrases of everyday conversation.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Albright & Wilson Ltd., the Londonbased international subsidiary of Tenneco Inc., has named C. Eugene Anderson to the post of deputy managing director of operations.

title: Jumel Mansion Artifacts On View in 42d St. Lobby
description: Over 70 photographs, sketches and artifacts from the historical MorrisJumel Mansion at Edgecombe Avenue and 160th Street will be on display through March 15 in the lobby of the. New York Telephone Building, 1095 Avenue of the Americas, at 42d Street.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Eugene A. Cafiero, who describes himself as a young 52, was clearly unhappy when Lee A. Iacocca came to the Chrysler Corporation last November to succeed him as president and chief operating officer.

title: N.H.L. Begins SkinRash Study
description: UNDER Tom Reid's name in The Hockey Register, in the space for honors, injuries or other sidelights to a player's career, there is this information: Missed ... part of 197778 season with skin rash.

title: PHILIPPINE REFUGEES FLEEING TO MALAYSIA
description: KOTA KINABALU, Sabah  Hardly noticed by the outside world, more than 100,000 refugees from the civil war in the Philippines have been squatting in this Malaysian state in northeast Borneo.

title: CARTER GIVES BEGIN TREATY SUGGESTIONS TO BUOY THE TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  President Carter offered new suggestions to Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel today in a lastminute effort to avert the collapse of the EgyptianIsraeli peacetreaty negotiations. Mr. Begin said he would promptly seek his Cabinet's advice on them.

title: In Teheran, Very Rich and Very Poor Await the Future
description: TEHERAN, Iran, March 4  Habit wakes the waterman at 4 A.M. His wife lies undisturbed beside him. He stands in the dark, then steps over seven children asleep on the floor.

title: Governors and Congress Battling Over Centralizing Aid Programs
description: WASHINGTON. March 4  The Federal Government and Florida have reached an embittered impasse over the administration of vocational rehabilitation funds. The case has taken on both substantive and symbolic importance in the growing struggle between governors and Congress over whether to consolidate many of the 492 separate categorical aid, programs, which state officials say would make them more efficient and easier to administer.

title: Court Tennis Title To Howe in Upset
description: BOSTON, March 4  Ralph Howe upset Gene Scott by 62, 63, 26, 62 and won the United States amateur court tennis championship today at the Boston Racquet and Tennis Club. In the twohour match between the two members of the New York Racquet and Tennis Club, Howe won the match by running out the fourth set from 22 and ended Scott's fiveyear reign as champion.

title: Cambodian Soldiers Driven Briefly Over Thai Border
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 4, (Reuters)  Fighting broke out today on the border of Thailand between soldiers of the Hanoisupported Government of Cambodia and troops loyal to the routed regime of Prime Minister Pol Pot, a Thai military spokesman said here.

title: Plea on Japan's Surplus
description: TOKYO. March 4  The United States pressed Japan tonight to let American and other foreign companies compete on an equal footing with Japanese companies for contracts with Governmentowned corporations.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Serious questions about the longterm productivity of Saudi Arabia's oilfields have been raised during Congressional investigations. Subpoenaed documents from Exxon and Socal, two major producers in that country, appear to reinforce earlier intelligence reports that problems have been encountered in the fields. [Page D1.]

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: BOSTON, March 4  Our old friend pack journalism is with us again. Returning from some weeks abroad, I find the pack in full bay at President Carter's conduct of foreign policy. American policy is in disarray, says one commentator. It lacks a master plan, says another. It is weak. It is unclear. And so on.

title: Lucia di Lammermoor Returns to City Opera
description: FRIDAY night's performance of Lucia di Lammermoor at the New York City Opera, the company's first Lucia in several seasons, was richer in potential than accomplishment.

title: Iran Regime Executes Seven More Officials
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Monday, March 5  Iran's revolutionary regime executed seven more of Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi's former officials early today, according to a communiqu.

title: U.S.Canada Agreement To Cut Tariffs Reported
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  The United States and its biggest trading partner, Canada, have taken a significant step toward establishing a North American freetrade zone as part of a new international trade liberalization pact, officials of both Governments report.

title: TV: The People of Nes Ammin
description: THE PEOPLE OF NES AMMIN number about 120 Christians, mostly of Protestant background. Drawn from several nations  the Netherlands, Germany, Sweden, Switzerland, Britain, the United States  they live in an ecumenical community founded in 1961 by the late Johan Pilon in northern Israel.

title: John Davidson, Headed Premium Ad Group, 92
description: John Davidson, a former president of the Premium Advertising Association of America and a leader in the field of corporate coupon redemption, died Saturday in a nursing home in Montclair, N.J. He was 92 years old and lived in Upper Montclair.

title: Weekly Lotto Numbers Drawn
description: The numbers picked Saturday night in New York State's weekly Lotto drawing were 11, 23, 28, 1, 40 and 24. The supplementary number was 16.

title: ETHICS UNIT WEIGHS SHIFT ON APPROACH
description: WASHINGTON  Frustrated by the abuse its members feel they have taken as prosecutors, judges and jurors, the House ethics committee is weighing a plan that would force more House members to share the pain of passing judgment on colleagues.

title: Big Board in the Black
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday that it returned to the black in last year's fourth quarter after a loss in the yearearlier period, while net operating revenues for the year climbed 37.8 percent.

title: Foreign Issues Are Harming Carter Among Swing Voters, Poll Shows
description: The foreign policy issues that Republicans are hammering at, especially overall United States strength, relations with China and Taiwan and the world energy situation, appear to be working against President Carter among some swing voting groups, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News Poll.

title: Many Iran Factions Hold Unity Rally
description: AHMADABAD, Iran, March 5  Cars, buses, trucks and people  tens of thousands of them  crowded, sprawled and pushed today around the mudwalled country house where Mohammed Mossadegh was isolated after being toppled by a Central Intelligence Agency coup in 1953, as the major revolutionary groups held a rally to repair their relations.

title: 10Day Car Sales Rose 3.1%
description: DETROIT, March 5  The nation's three major automobile manufacturers reported today that newcar sales in the final 10 days of February rose 3.1 percent from the level reported for the comparable period a year earlier.

title: Algeria Seeks 24% Jump In Oil Cost to $19 a Barrel
description: Algeria has requested an oilprice increase of more than 24 percent, according to trade sources in New York. That is by far the largest surcharge sought by an oilexporting country since the current escalation in world oil prices began last month.

title: Amin Calls for Counterattack on Tanzanian Invaders
description: NAIROBI, Kenya (AP)  President Idi Amin of Uganda called on his army today to fight to the last man in a counterattack on Tanzanian soldiers who have driven to within 52 miles of the capital, Kampala. Radio Uganda reported.

title: Clippers Losers Turn Into Winners
description: For a coach and players who seemed unwanted elsewhere, San Diego appeared to be the perfect place. The city  had failed to hold on to two pro basketball franchises before the Buffalo Braves relocated there this season with a cast of troublesome reputations.

title: Bank of China In Citibank Tie
description: PEKING, March 5 (Reuters)  The Rank of China has established full commercial banking relations with Citibank, New York's largest bank, completing China's new ties with all the major United States banks.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE Klein, Resigning at NBC, Plans His Own Company
description: Paul L. Klein, one of the bestknown programmers in the television business, returned to the National Broadcasting Company in 1976 for his second tour of duty there and 18 months later became executive vice presidentprograms.

title: General Is Shot to Death in Spain In the 30th Political Killing of 79
description: MADRID, March 5  A semiretired general was assassinated this afternoon as he was being driven to his daughter's house in northern Madrid.

title: Saudis Said to Ask. U.S. For Help in Yemen War
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  Saudi Arabia is seeking Afnerican support for a possible Saudi intervention on the side of Yemen in its border war with Southern Yemen, and officials said here today that the United States Government was consulting on how this might be done.

title: Seamen's Bank Head Is Target of the Union At J.P. Stevens &
description: GREENVILLE, S.C., March 5  The Amalgamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union, locked in a bitter organizing struggle with J.P. Stevens & Company, has zeroed in on E. Virgil Conway, president and chairman of New York's Seamen's Bank for Savings in its campaign to isolate Stevens from the rest of the coroorate and financial community.

title: Stocks Rise On Foreign News
description: Favorable news developments from overseas touched off a strong rally in Walk Street yesterday, sending the Dow Jones industrial average up nearly a dozen points. The biggest gainers included stocks in the casino, glamour, computer, photography and chemical groups.

title: Xonics Selling 3 Nonmedical Units
description: Xonics Inc. announced it was selling at an undisclosed price three nonmedical subsidiaries for cash and notes. The proceeds of the sale will be distributed largely among three major Xonics creditors as part of a new agreement to restructure the company's debt, the company said.

title: Alan Crofoot, Tenor at Met, 49
description: Alan Crofoot, Metropolitan Opera tenor, jumped to his death from the fifth floor of the Dayton Sheraton Downtown Hotel in Dayton, Ohio, early yesterday morning, according to the Montgomery County Coroner's office. Mr. Crofoot was 49 years old and lived in Toronto.

title: Market Place
description: EXXON, Standard Oil of California, Texaco and Mobil Oil are reaping a windfall from the Iranian oil crisis that could add to their appeal as longterm investments.

title: Professor and 6 Students Survive 29 Hours Trapped in Georgia Cavern
Obituary 7  No Title
description: ANNOUMCNEN MENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO 3543900 UNTL 5:30 P.M. FOR WEEKDAY EDITIONS UNTL 2:30 P.M. ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A M TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY; NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33000 WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 96300 NASSAU CO. (516) 7470600 SUFFOLK CO. (516) ?? Co??CTICUT (203) 3437787.

title: Reds Assure Foster 3 Years, $2.2 Million
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 5  George Foster became the newest baseball millionaire today when the Cincinnati Reds signed him to a threeyear contract at $700,000 to $800,000 a year beginning next season.

title: Mahre Out of Hospital
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., March 5 (AP)  Phil Mahre of White Pass, Wash., America's top skier, was discharged from Lake Placid Memorial Hospital with a broken leg, a hospital spokesman said today. Mahre, second in the World Cup last year, was injured yesterday when he fell in the first run of the giant slalom here.

title: Brothers Hearing Opens in 6 Pennsylvania Killings
description: WEST CHESTER, Pa., March 5 tale of Appalachian justice  at the muzzles of 38caliber revolvers  began unfolding today in a heavily guarded county courtroom here.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: GLAUBINGER Aram. Devoted mother of David. Gilbert & Judy. Dear sister of Michael Mlles & George MilevskY. Service today 1:30 P.M. at Westchester RiverSide 21 W. Broad St. Mt. Vernon.

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: There has at last been an interesting intellectual departure in the heated debate over abortion policy. Under current law, the Federal Medicaid pro. gram pays all valid medical expenses for poor women. but does not pay for abortions, except in the cage of rape, incest, or serious health threat to the mother. A case in the Brooklyn court of Federal District Judge John Dooling, McRae v. Califano, attacks the law on various grounds, but it is its claim of First Amendment rights that raises provocative questions about the law's religious neutrality.

title: New Orders Rose 1.9% In January
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (UPI) New orders received by the nation's factories rose 1.9 percent in January, their sixth consecutive monthly gain, the Government reported today.

title: Edward W. Wood Jr., Part Owner and Head Of L.I. Radio System
description: Edward W. Wood Jr., a pioneer in radio broadcasting and chairman of the board of the Island Broadcasting System, died Sunday at Eastern Long Island Hospital in Greenport after a long illness. He was 73 years old and lived on Indian Neck Lane in Peconic,L.I.

title: Dreams of a Settlement Sour for Mennonite Immigrants
description: SEMINOLE, Tex., March 5  A small community of Mennonites that fled here from Mexico two years ago because of land seizures and religious persecution is discovering that what looked like a safe and promised land is actually a harsh landscape dotted with troubles and empty promises.

title: Obituary 5  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Sports Today
description: Knicks vs. Portland Trail Blazers, at Madison Square Garden, Eighth Avenue and 33d Street, 7:30 P. M. (TelevisionChannel, cable, 7:30 P. M. RadioWNEW, 7:20 P.M.)

title: The City
description: Less than two months after they denounced Mayor Koch as an insidious devil, a group of black Baptist ministers yesterday announced the appointment of a Manhattan clergyman to act as an unsalaried liaison man with the Mayor's office.

title: Cash Prices
description: MONDAY, MARCH 5, 1979.

title: Impact of Money Market Funds
description: Last month William E. Donoghue, publisher of Donoghue's Money Fund Report, received calls from economists at five different Federal Reserve banks, all wanting to know more about the $5 billion spurt in the size of money market funds since Jan. 1.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Oil exports from Iran resumed with the loading of a 1.7millionbarrel shipment to Japan. The first oil to be exported after a 69day halt was sold for $20 a barrel, far above the $14 price set by OPEC last December. A second shipment of 2 million barrels was scheduled. The chief executive of the National Iranian Oil Company said he hoped to export 7 million barrels by Friday, for a total of $80 million in badly needed revenues. [Page D1.]

title: Weekly Output Of Steel Up
description: Steel production for the week ended March 3 increased by 3.4 percent, to 2.69 million tons, from the 2.6 million tons produced in the week before, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Harlin's Eating Habits Feed Hopes in ShotPut
description: If Tony Harlin wins an Olympic gold ,medal some day in the shotput, Hollywood will have a field day. The script about an athlete, his family and a  coach who cares already has all the ingredients of a love story.

title: Illinois Woman Has Quadruplets
description: PARK RIDGE, Ill. March 5 (AP) Three boys and a girl were born today to Cherie Tennyson, 25 years old, a spokesman for Lutheran General Hospital said.

title: N.L.R.B. Rebuffed by High Court
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  The Supreme Court ruled today that a union seeking to challenge an employer's use of psychological tests for hiring and promotion is not automatically entitled to see either the test scores or the test itself.

title: CREDIT MARKETS Treasury Prices Gain Strongly
description: Longterm Treasury bond prices climbed substantially yesterday as the credit markets responded to a variety of news that traders interpreted optimistically. Some issues gained half a point or more, their biggest advance since Jan. 25.

title: Recital: Grace Bumbry Sings at Carnegie Hall
description: OPERA singers, if they are wise, take every opportunity that comes their way to give song recitals, just as wise Wagnerians leap at the chance to sing Mozart roles, even it they are not famously good at them. Getting into close contact with serious baler listeners is perhaps no more difficult than stirring a knowing opera audience, but certainly different levels of sensibility are involved, and the levels are highly worth exploring for any singer. Last night at Carnegie Hall, it was Grace Bumbry's turn to go exploring as a song recitalist, an adventure she has regularly embarked upon ever since her debut.

title: OBSERVER And. Proud Of It
description: Americans will admit proudly to certain incompetences and even joke about them. They would rather fight than admit to others.

title: The Region
description: HARTFORD  Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr. of Connecticut will formally announce his candidacy for the 1980 Republican Presidential nomination next Monday at the Old State House here, according to one of his aides.

title: Pakistan Court Appears to Be Reconsidering Bhutto's Death Penalty
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, March 5 The Supreme Court of Pakistan appeared today to be reconsidering the death penalty imposed on Zulfikar All Bhutto for complicity in a 1974 political murder.

title: Worldwide Weather Study May Aid LongTerm Forecasts
description: GENEVA INTENSIVE research in recent weeks involving the collection of data by earth satellites, airplanes and hundreds of balloons and buoys has demonstrated that enough of the atmosphere can be observed to make possible substantial improvements in weather forecasting.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Pop: Billy Joel Brings Cuban Crowd to Its Feet
description: HAVANA, March 5  Billy Joel capped the Havana Jam79 at the Karl Marx Theater here last night with a stirring performance that brought the crowd cheering to its feet. Mr. Joel's presence at this threeday festival of Cuban and American popular and jazz musicians  the only American pop performer here whose career is in full tide  lent the proceedings a legitimacy they might have otherwise lacked. And he drew the most fervent response of the entire festival.

title: New Trial Set In Gelding Sale
description: A man whose dream of breeding a 2yearold thoroughbred disappeared when he found that he had spent almost $40,000 for a gelding achieved a victory yesterday in court in Brooklyn.

title: F.T.C. Opens Hearing on TV Ads Aimed at Children
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  An activist organization opposed to advertising aimed at youngsters called on the Federal Trade Commission today to ban all television commercials focused on children 2 to 12 years old.

title: Taxes
description: THE bite of the socalled marriage penalty, which taxes some married couples more severely than if they had filed as single individuals, was somewhat reduced by the Revenue Act of 1978. The extra tax, which falls hardest on couples who earn about the same income, has been accused of undermining the institution of marriage.

title: After a Wait of 13 Years, Nigerians Are Preparing to Vote
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, March 5  Between now and Oct. 1, Nigeria's nearly 50 million voters are expected to elect the country's first civilian government in 13 years.

title: Poverty Funds Cut Off To Puerto Rican Unit
description: Funds for the Puerto Rican Community Development Project were cut off yesterday because of a continuing series of disruptions among feuding factions of the organization's board of directors, the staff and the community at large, according to Roger Alvarez, Commissioner of the city's Community Development Agency.

title: A Newsletter for Parents Of the LearningDisabled
description: When Peter Spiller was 8 years old and his brother Jamie was 6, Peter blurted out to his mother one day: I wish I was in somebody else's body. His mother asked him to explain. The child replied: I wish I had somebody else's arms and legs and head. I wish I had Jamie's arms and legs and head and he had my arms and legs and head.

title: Carter's Bold Stroke
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  As the White House sees it, President Carter's Middle East peace mission this week is a venture with overriding political significance for the President far beyond the delicate diplomacy of an EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty.

title: How Chinese Performed: Lack of Mobility Evident
description: China's operations in Vietnam have illustrated the truth of a classic military maxim: Mass without mobility cannot easily or swiftly achieve war aims.

title: A Day to Muse on Thoughts of Spring
description: There was a dreaminess in the air in Manhattan yesterday, what with the temperature climbing to 58 degrees and the earth smelling fresh from a bit of rain. It was a time to take a moment to muse in a vest pocket park, or to gaze out at the skyline from the Roosevelt Island tram and collect thoughts in anticipation of the coming of spring. Today is expected to be a bit colder, with rain ending at about noon.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Wife of George Meany Dies

title: CORRECTION
description: A transcription error altered the meaning of a sentence in Albert Wohlstetter 's foreign affairs column, The Uses of Irrelevance, on Feb. 25. The correct language follows: In the Middle East, in the Persian Gulf. strictly internal problems are hard to find. One or another regional power has always had a hand in them and a stake in their outcome; so have outside powers, including the Soviet Union, the United States and its allies.

title: COMMODITIES Silver Retreats on News China Will Withdraw
description: Silver traders rushed to sell futures contracts yesterday, causing a sharp retreat in prices. The heavy selling was attributed by traders to the news that China nlanned to withdraw its troons from Vietnam. War between the two nations had been the cause in recent weeks of surging prices in the precious metals market, especially in silver.

title: George. H. Barlow, U.S. Judge, 58
description: George Herbert Barlow, chief judge of the United States District Court for New Jersey, died apparently of a heart attack early Sunday morning, at. the Mercer Medical Center. in Trenton. He was 58 years old and lived in Ewing Township.

title: Arab League Agrees on Plan
description: KUWAIT, March 5  Foreign ministers of the Arab League agreed here today on a plan to end the fighting.

title: OLIN DEAL REPORTED ON ARMS SHIPMENTS
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  Lawyers for the Winchester arms division of the Olin Corporation went over the head of the United States Attorney in Connecticut to negotiate an advantageous plea to charges stemming from illegal shipments of arms to South Africa, Federal law enforcement officials have disclosed.

title: L.S.U. Suspends Scales
description: Louisiana State University will be playing in the National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament without DeWayne Scales, the team's leading scorer, who was suspended from the squad yesterday by Coach Dale Brown  apparently because the player had had contact with a pro agent.

title: Woman Is Slain in Midtown Motel
description: A 35yearold Chicago woman was stabbed to death in her midtown Manhattan motel room early yesterday morning, apparently by a skimasked robber who had forced his way in behind her, the police said.

title: World News Briefs
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, March ?? (Reuters)  Rhodesia's black coMinister of Foreign Affairs. Elliot Gabellah, today quit his political party, the Zimbabwe African National Union, led by the Rev. Ndabaningi Sithole.

title: Bank Criticizes Takeover Delay
description: The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation deplored yesterday possible further delay on its yearold application to acquire the Marine Midland Banks.

title: Koch's Plan Strengthens Disciplining of. Workers
description: The burly Sanitation Department foreman groped awkwardly for a handkerchief to wipe away his tears. He said that he was embarrassed to be crying, but that he was unhappy to have had to testify in a departmental trial against a man in his command who had struck him on the eye one night.

title: Dance: Marjorie Gamso
description: ON the evidence of three dances presented Sunday at the Washington Square Methodist Church, Marjorie Garnso is interested in the long, lean line of a balletically trained body. She is also a practitioner of the sustained flutter and brush. Her company is aptly called the Energy Crisis. Miss Gamso's dances are really fragments of daydreams that made the most of the eerie cavern of a performing space but lacked dance's essential physical impulse.

title: China Reports It Has Begun Withdrawal From Vietnam
description: HONG KONG, March 5  The Chinese Government announced today that it had begun withdrawing its armed forces from Vietnam after they had attained the goals set for them in the 17day border war. There was no immediate response from Hanoi.

title: Computer Says Monkeys Couldn 't Write Hamlet At Least Not So Far
description: IF enough monkeys pecked away at typewriters long enough, according to a venerable hypothesis that has challenged thinkers for centuries, they could eventually write the complete works of Shakespeare.

title: Randolph Critical of Yankee Doctors
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 5  Willie Randolph has been in the major leagues for three years and already has two perfect records: he has played on three pennant winners in three years and has received two incorrect diagnoses on two knee injuries.

title: Allied Leader And a Scholar
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  At farewell parties in his big secondfloor office at the Pentagon, Gen. Bernard W. Rogers inevitably bursts into song in a lilting tenor that echoes in the corridor. His favorite number is the song that Frank Sinatra made famous, My Way.

title: Newer and Newer and Newer Technology, With Little Unemployment
description: The effect of technological advance on employment has been debated for over 168 years since desperate workers in the textile town of Nottingham, England, led by a certain Ned Ludd wrecked newly invented knitting machines that threatened  so they thought  their livelihood. The mill owners of course disagreed and were supported by economists who proceeded to prove once and for all that unemployment caused by technology can be nothing but an illusion.

title: COMPANY NEWS Coffee Roasters Cut Prices by 5 a Pound
description: Several major coffee companies reduced the price of their ground coffee yesterday by 5 cents a pound, effective immediately. This was the second round of price cuts in the last three weeks, and puts the wholesale price of ground coffee at $2.43 a pound.

title: High Court Orders India to Free Prisoners Denied Due Process
description: NEW DELHI, March 5 (Reuters)The Supreme Court of India ordered the Government today to free prisoners awaiting trial who have already spent more time in jail than the maximum sentence they would have received on conviction.

title: High Court Holds a State Liable in Others' Courts
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  The Supreme Court, considering the issue for what it said was the first time, ruled today, 6 to 3, that a state may be sued in the courts of another state.

title: SchoolBus Peace Might Be Periled By Low Bids of Nonunion Carriers
description: The Varsity Transit Company, which transports twothirds of the city's handicapped children to school, was underbid yesterday on most of the schoolbus transportation contracts for 197982. This could prolong the wildcat strike by schoolbus drivers, which began Feb. 15 and has lasted for 12 school days.

title: Elephant . To the Booth
description: The comedy teamof John Monteith and Suzanne Rand, which opened at the Booth Theater Jan. 2, will close Saturday night after 79 performances and 8 previews.

title: Text of China's Statement on Withdrawal of Troops
description: HONG KONG, March 5 (AP)  Following is the text of the official New China News Agency announcement from Peking that Chinese troops are withdrawing from Vietnam.

title: City Students Write to Learn Expression
description: WRITERS like to call it writer's block, but people other than writers have it, the condition marked by the frustrated cry, I know what I want to say, but I can't say it.

title: Science Library
description: Jonathan Miller: of course He was the rubberlegged coconspirator in Beyond the Fringe in the early 60's. But Dr. Miller (he is a licensed physician) has done and been many thingssince he cavorted on the stages of London and Broadway during the show's comic parody of an endless Shakespearean death scene. As director, author, actor, editor, critic and medical historian, he has clearly shown himself to be a man of parts. Now he will be more so than ever, for the human body and its many appurtenances are the subjects of his new book.

title: Q&A
description: Q. How does the sun burn if a flame needs air to burn and there is no air in space?

title: A Putnam Reprise
description: ASHLEY PUTNAM is a young American singer whose New York City Opera debut last September in La Traviata created quite a stir. Sunday afternoon, Traviata returned to the City Opera repertory, and Miss Putnam returned with it.

title: Coming to the Music Hall's Rescue
description: The most recent word on the Little Nell of architecture, Radio City Music Hall, is that it may be rescued after all. The villain has become the hero. Rockefeller Center, after proposing demolition of the Art Deco theater. is about to try to save it.

title: 4 Red Nations Quit U.N. Meeting As Cambodian Censures Vietnam
