description: MANILA, March 5 (UPI)  Four Cornmunist nations led by the Soviet Union and Vietnam walked out of a United Nations economic conference today to protest a Cambodian speech condemning the Vietnamese invasion of Cambodia.

title: Obituary 6  No Title
description: Deaths

title: College Sixes Start Off On N.C.A.A. Playoff Path
description: Two sets of quarterfinal playoffs, the first postseason steps toward the National Collegiate title in hockey, will begin at eight sites tonight. One set involves the eight top teams in the Eastern Collective Athletic Conference Division I ;the other consists of the top eight in the Western Collegiate Hockey Association.

title: Lifting the Trade Barriers
description: Negotiators from 99 nations will soon finish drafting more liberal rules for world trade, which would open new export markets to efficient producers and let countries specialize in what they do best. President Carter began his campaign for Congressional approval last week with an appeal to the National Governors Conference for help in overcoming selfish protectionist tendencies. He will need all the help be can get.

title: Ludlow Opposes Tyco Tender Offer
description: The Ludlow Corporation said that after consultation with its directors it had decided to oppose the recent tender offer by Tyco Laboratories for the purchase of 9.4 percent of Ludlow's common stock at $19 a share.

title: I.M.F. Fears Slowdown As Oil Use Is Cut Back
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  Fears that cutbacks in oil consumption sternming from the turmoil in Iran will choke off world economic growth while inflation still rides high are dominating discussions here this week among representatives of 139 nonCommunist countries.

title: Electrical Fire Damages Warwick Hotel
description: Smoke pouring out of ninthfloor windows of the Warwick Hotel, on the corner of 56th Street and'Avenue of the Americas, yesterday afternoon. Five rooms and the hall way were heavily damaged after an electric immersion coil, used to heat water in a cup, ignited beige cloth draperies in a corner suite.

title: Services for Jamil M. Baroody, Saudi Diplomat, to Be Restricted
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 5 (AP)  Funeral services for Jamil Murad Baroody, Saudi Arabia's delegate to the United Nations, will be private and restricted to his family and closest associates. the Saudi mission said today.

title: Corporations Report Their Quarterly Sales and Earnings Results
description: For periods as Shown. (N) Indicates stack Is listed on The New York Stock Ex. chance, (A) the American Exchange and (0) overthecounter.

title: Crime Cut by Altering a Neighborhood
description: HARTFORD  It's almost spring in North Asylum Hill, and 82yearold Mimi Marth is digging out her walkietalkie, preparing for another season in her war on crime.

title: Notes on People
description: Jimmy Connors has courted, if you will, his share of attractive women, and as one of America's more eligible 26yearold bachelors he raised questions each time about whether he would marry. Now it turns out that the tennis star has been secretly married since last fall to Patti McGuire, a former politicalscience major at Southern Illinois University, who probably is better known as Playboy magazine's 1977 Playmate of the Year.

title: Paul A. Tierney, Editor On Several Newspapers
description: Paul Ambrose Tierney, a former executive editor of The New York Post and a longtime newspaperman in the metropolitan area, died Saturday in St. Francis Hospital in Port Washington, L.I. He was 84 years old and had lived for many years in Port Washington.

title: IN THE NATION Pretoria's Dark Fears
description: New objections raised by South Africa to the United Nations independence plan for Namibia may or may not delay the timetable now leading to elections on Sept. 30. But they show how deeply South Africa fears any possibility that these. elections might put the SouthWest African People's Organization (SWAPO) in power on its border.

title: Leland Haworth Dies
description: Dr. Leland J. Haworth, a physicist who had a leading role in the development of the Brookhaven National Laboratory in Upton, L.I., and was its director for 13 years, died yesterday at St. Charles Hospital in Port Jefferson, L.I. He was 74 years old. His home was in Belle Terre, Port Jefferson.

title: City Hears How We're Doing on the Budget
description: In an unusual view of the City Council at work, City Councilman Sheldon S. Leffler, center, takes microphone to pose question to James R. Brigham Jr., lower left, as the director of the Office of Management and Budget testified before a joint City Council and Board of Estimate hearing on Mayor Koch's program to eliminate the budget gap in fiscal year 1980. Agency heads were scheduled to appear this week to answer questions about their own cuts under the the Mayor's plan, and to describe how they will implement them. Also appearing were Schools Chancellor Frank J. Macchiarola, Parks Commissioner Gordon J. Davis and representatives from seven other city departments.

title: Can the Russians Cheat on SALT?
description: The loss of American monitoring stations in Iran, an important source of intelligence on Russian missile tests, gives new urgency to an old fear: Can the United States be sure the Soviets, won't cheat on arms limitations? The problem of verification already looms as a controversy within the larger controversy about the still unfinished arms treaty, SALT II.

title: H.F.C. Equity Share
description: The Household Finance Corporation said it had become an equity partner in David Jones Finance of Sydney, Australia. The American consumer finance company said it had acquired 49 percent of David Jones Finance, which was wholly owned by David Jones Ltd., by paying $4.9 million (Australian) for its stake in the company.

title: Rights Amendment Foe Assails Alimony. Ruling
description: Phyllis Schlafly, the militant opponent of the equal rights amendment to the Constitution, criticized yesterday's Supreme Court ruling removing barriers to alimony for men. It's bad for women, she said in a telephone interview. It's the beginning of the end of all alimony.

title: Msgr. George A. Rosso, A Navy Chief Chaplain
description: Msgr. George A. Rosso, a retired chief of chaplains of the Navy and pastor emeritus of St. Thomas of Canterbury Church in CornwallorsHudson, N.Y., died Saturday at Cornwall Hospital after an illness of three weeks. He was 72 years old.

title: Books of The Times
description: SUMMER visitors call the area the Hamptons, but to natives it is the South Fork, that southerly of Long Island's splitfin eastern promontories, as Everett T. Rattrav describes it. an island of an island, separated by the Shinnecock Canal from the rest of Long Island, and extending from Southampton Village to Montauk Point. And though it may surprise some of the summer visitors, the area has a history and natives who trace their roots back to the Massachusetts Bay Colony ... and beyond,. when you count Indian population (not everybody always did) whose ancestors seem to have used the island as a burial ground as long ago as 1290 B.C., give or take 390 years.

title: CancerBlocking Agents Found in Foods
description: CANCER researchers have discovered that a number of common substances, including certain food additives, pesticides, vitamins and constituents of vegetables, can block the action of cancercausing chemicals.

title: Harvard Multiflex Course Is No Snap
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 5 Harvard University, which requires no physical education program for its students, is an unlikely place to find an academic course on the baffling offensive strategy of a college football team. But to Larry Brown, Harvard's quarterback for the last two seasons and the instructor in the university's Fundamentals of Multiflex Offense course, football strategy lends itself to scholarship as easily as Introduction to Philosophy.

title: Grace Extends Offer for Daylin
description: W.R. Grace & Company said it was extending its offer to acquire Daylin Inc. to 5 P.M. on March 19. The offer was to have expired yesterday.

title: Zumwalt Nominated for Term as Public Representative at Amex
description: Adm. Elmo R. Zumwalt Jr., the retired former Chief of Naval Operations and president of American Medical Buildings, has been nominated for a oneyear term as a public representative on the board of governors of the American Stock Exchange Ten incumbent governors, five representing the public and five representing the securities industry, were renominated for twoyear terms.

title: Large Investors Use Money Funds, Too
description: Money market funds have been hailed as a way for the small investor to enter a province formerly open only to big investors. But a lot of sophisticated big investors, including corporations and banks, have started using these funds, too.

title: Basile's Spring Fashions: The Story in Pictures
description: The project: to introduce the Basile spring fashion collection in as imaginative a way as possible.

title: Westinghouse Awards Given 5 New Yorkers For Scientific Projects
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  Five high school seniors from the New York metropolitan area were among the top 10 scholarship recipients named tonight in the 38th annual Westinghouse Science Talent Search. The winners were chosen from among 40 finalists in a field of 1,000 entrants in the nation's largest science scholarship program.

title: Assembly Passes A Carey Budget Of $102 Million
description: ALBANY, Mar. 5  The State Assembly approved a $102.6 million deficiency budget today, including money for the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, public television, mental hygiene programs and the winter Olympic Games.

title: Byrne Seeks to Repeal Horse and Buggy Laws
description: TRENTON, March 5  If Governor Byrne has his way, motorists in New Jersey will no longer be required to stop their cars whenever a horse approaches in the opposite direction. And it will no longer be a violation to ride a horse across a sidewalk at speeds exceeding four miles an hour.

title: Science Watch
description: Specimens of a troublesome Asian clam have been identified for the first time in Eastern United States waters, according to the United States Geological Survey. The clams were found in the lower Potomac River near Washington by Geological Survey scientists.

title: ABOUT EDUCATION Can Morality Be Taught?; Can Schools Teach Morality?
description: THE disgrace of Watergate, revelations of corporate bribery, charges of corruption in Congress, Medicaid profiteering by doctors  the belief in a general decline in public integrity has intensified pressure on the schools to teach ethics and morality. The question is: Can it be done?

title: White House to Propose a Bill to Streamline the Regulatory Process
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  The White House is planning to propose legislation this month to streamline the regulatory process by improving coordination, .reducing procedural delays and requiring more careful consideration of less costly alternatives to proposed new regulations.

title: Blumenthal Sees New Hope on Trade After Talk With Ohira
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal met with Japan's Prime Minister, Masayoshi Ohira, and other ministers in Tokyo today and said later that the Japanese leaders had become more determined to reduce their country's trade surplus.

title: EGYPT IS FIRST STOP
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  President Carter will fly to Egypt and Israel this week in a personal attempt to negotiate the final terms of a peace treaty between the two Middle Eastern nations, the White House announced today.

title: A Hostile Jupiter Yields Surprises
description: PASADENA, Calif., March 5  Voyager 1 navigated the inner reaches of Jupiter's hostile domain today, surviving pervasive radiation and bizarre magnetic forces to conduct the first comprehensive closeup exploration of the gigantic planet and several of its moons, a reconnaissance of five strikingly different worlds in a single day.

title: Oil Flow From Iran Resumes
description: KHARG ISLAND, Iran, March 5 Iran formally resumed sales of its crude oil abroad this morning, thus ending a 69day interruption that has sent shock waves through the world oil market.

title: Germans Sweep Film Festival
description: WEST BERLIN, March 4  The time is World War H in Nazi Germany and the scenes In David, the German film that won the Golden Bear top prize at the International Film Festival here, show a frightened young Jew, son of a rabbi, wandering the dirkened streets of Berlin, seeking refuge from death and destruction in abandoned railway sheds and in the workshop of an old shoemaker.

title: Piano: Vivian Taylor Offers the Liszt Sonata
description: EACH season there is one work that seems to turn up on every other pianist's program, for reasons that may have something to do with the rise and fall of the polar ice cap or some such irresistible force of nature. We have had years when nothing would do but Schumann's Carnaval or Symphonic Variations, and there was the time that all pianists met secretly and declared an international Waldstein year. This season the omnipresent piece is the Liszt Sonata, and Vivian Taylor naturally had it on her program at Alice Tully Hall on Sunday night.

title: KHALIL SEES CHANCE FOR BREAKTHROUGH
description: CAIRO, March 5  Prime Minister Mustafa Khalil said tonight that he believed President Carter's trip to the Middle East this week represented a possible breakthrough to a peace treaty between Egypt and Israel.

title: Theater: A Beckett and a Pirandello
description: ROBERT PINGET'S The Old Tune (La Manivelle) was originally written as a radio play. Translated by Samuel Beckett and acted by Stefan Gierasch and David Margulies at the Ensemble Studio Theater, it achieves a vibrant, poetic stage life. The Old Tune is being performed on a double bill with Luigi Pirandello's classic oneact play The Man With the Flower in His Mouth. The two brief duets for actors are grouped under the accurate title A Special Evening.

title: Fresh Milk? Read the Date; Strike Means No Dating
description: Higher milk prices and occasional scarcity are not the only problems New York City area consumers are facing during the current milk strike. At the dairy case, some shoppers are ?? the freshness of milk.

title: New UV Plan To Bar Posner
description: In a new move to thwart a takeover effort by Victor Posner, chairman of the Sharon Steel Corporation, UV Industries said yesterday that it would offer shareholders an alternative to a plan to liquidate UV and distribute the proceeds to shareholders.

title: Namibia Rejects CeaseFire Plan
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, March 5 The outlook for the United Nations peace plan for SouthWest Africa deteriorated further today when the political party backed by South Africa rejected Secretary General Kurt Waldheim's proposals for a ceasefire in the decadeold bush war.

title: Issue and Debate Incentives to Keep Business in New York
description: There is a highstakes game that governments and companies play in the arena of commercial real estate. It is based on the premise that a municipality, to maintain a healthy economy, must provide investment incentives to attract new businesses and to keep existing businesses happy. If the going ante is not met, there is the risk of relocations to areas offering greater inducements.

title: Stage: Bronx Life in Simpson Street
description: CONFRONTED with the set of Simpson Street  an apartment with plastic furniture covers, tinted religious pictures and every sign of the forlorn effort to assert life and color in the dank streets of the South Bronx  one member of the Spanishspeaking audience murmured to her friend:

title: A Politician in the Family Mold
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  You know, it's you your father wants to run for President, not Jerry, said Frederick Dutton, a Californian who was an aide to President Kennedy and is now a lawyer here. He was talking to a willowy young woman whose dark hair was caught back with a pair of eyeglasses perched high on her head.

title: Eight Approved By Carter Panel For 2 Judgeships
description: A special nominating panei recommended two women and six men yesterday as exceptionally well qualified for appointment to the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: Spectacular Bid Swift in Tuneup
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., March  Spectacular Bid sped three furlongs in 33  seconds today in his final tuneup for the $20,000 Florida Derby tomorrow at Gulfstream Park.

title: Phenom LeftHander of Giants
description: CASA GRANDE, Ariz.  In a corner of the San Francisco Giants training base at this desert oasis, two diamonds were being used for batting practice. But the three wise men of the Giants front office had turned their backs on the hitters. Bob Lurie, Spec Richardson and Bing Devine were watching Bill Bordley warm up. Remember the name. Unless he cracks the Giants starting rotation, Bill Bordley probably will be polished at Phoenix of the Pacific Coast League this season. But in a year or two he might be something special as a pitcher. He's already special in Commissioner Bowie Kuhn's files as the kid who drafted five clubs after having spurned the one club that drafted him. In the confusion the California Angels were fined $15,000 and two draft choices for tampering with this 21yearold lefthander who won 26 games and lost only two at the University of Southern California the last two years. As the winner of a fiveteam lottery, the Giants were permitted to meet Bill Bordley's price, which included a minimum $100,000 bonus.

title: Two Banks Upheld in Tax Case
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP)  The Supreme Court today overturned New York State court decisions that two national banks owe New York City almost $9 million for rent and occupancy ??

title: Women Recommended As Potential Directors
description: The Financial Women's Association. a 23yearold organization concerned with expanding the role of women in business, has drawn up a list of 10 women it considers qualified to serve as corporate directors. The association is to present its candidates this morning before an audience of corporate representatives.

title: Swiss Refuse a Request To Block Shah's Assets
description: GENEVA, March 5The Swiss Government decided today not to grant a request from Iran to freeze the assets held in Switzerland by Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi and his family.

title: Music: Winds From Montclair
description: SUNDAY night's Winds From Montclair program at Carnegie Recital Hall, presented by the Montclair State College music department, served as a showcase both for faculty members and students from the New Jersey school, which has beefed up its music program considerably over the last few years. The evening was a pleasant, unpretentious one with no great surprises. The teachers played like seasoned professionals, and the students played well, but not as well as the teachers.

title: Track Summaries
description: AT PRINCETON, N.J. EASTERN STATES SCHOOLBOY Track Events

title: CURRENCY MARKETS Dollar Trading Mixed
description: The dollar closed mixed in moderate trading on the world's foreignexchange markets yesterday despite news that Iran has resumed exports of crude oil and that President Carter will visit Egypt and Israel this week to try to work out a Middle East peace agreement.

title: End of Strike Puzzles New Orleans, But City Feels Mayor Was Winner
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 5  This city was still trying today to figure out how such a stunning end to its 16day police strike could come about so suddenly, how the apparent destruction of the teamsterrepresented police officers union could be brought about so swiftly, even as the union had seemed on the verge of victory.

title: Yields Dip on Treasury Bills
description: Yields declined on Treasury bills in the weekly auction yesterday in both the 91day and 182day maturities.

title: Capital Teachers Union Prepares For Strike Despite Court Order
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP)Union leaders handed out picket signs to teachers tonight in preparation for a strike they said would begin tomorrow against District of Columbia public schools.

title: Son of ExSecretary Picked
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP)  Luther Hartwell Hodges Jr., son of a former Secretary of Commerce, has been chosen as the department's new Under Secretary, Administration sources said today.

title: Zaire Said to Be Headed for Bankruptcy and Revolt
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  Several specialists on African affairs testified at a Congressional hearing today that the strategically important nation of Zaire was sliding toward bankruptcy and appeared likely to face a crisis similar to the one that has shaken Iran.

title: Norse Exploration Linked to Mirages
description: WINNIPEG, Mani??oba AUNIVERSITY geographer's childhood observations of prairie mirages have led him through more than a decade of research and computer study to a new theory that could change the standard explanation for how North America was discovered.

title: Barzani, a Kurd Leader, Buried in Northwest Iran
description: KARAJ. Iran, March 5 (Reuters) Mustafa Barzani, the Kurdish resistance figure, was buried today in Ushnuiyeh among the mountain strongholds of Kurdistan on Iran's western border. Thousandc of Kurds Attended.

title: 400Inch Telescope Planned in California
description: FOR three decades, the 200inch telescope at Palomar., Calif., has reigned as the largest in the United States. Now, however, the University of California has begun planning a telescope with a lightgathering mirror 400 inches in diameter. The Berkeley campus of the university announced that $270,000 had been appropriated for the design study, but the instrument 's eventual cost cannot be estimated until is decided what form it must take.

title: Investors Drawn to Cable TV
description: The Getty Oil Company's recent agreement to acquire up to 85 percent of Entertainment and Sports Programming Network Inc., a supplier of cable television programs with headquarters in Plainville, Conn., caused hardly a ripple in oil industry circles. An obvious reason: It was said to involve less than $10 million, a relative pittance for Getty, which had revenues last year of $3.76 billion.

title: Obituary 8  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Israeli Jets Buzz Lebanese Capital
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 5  Israeli jet fighters flew over the Lebanese capital today, jolting the city with sonic booms.

title: Effort to Integrate Chicago Schools Has Had Little Effect, Study Finds
description: CHICAGO, March 5  A report to the State Superintendent of Education has concluded that Chicago's $35 million access to excellence school desegregation plan has had almost no discernible impact on desegregation levels in the city's 600 schools.

title: The U.N. Today
description: March 6, 1979

title: LINKAGE IS MODIFIED
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  A United States proposal for a compromise in a peace treaty dispute between Egypt and Israel won Israel's approval today and helped bring about the decision by President Carter to fly to the Middle East.

title: Koch Is Pressed To Revive Work On City U. Unit
description: A recommendation to resume construction of a $95 million campus for Borough of Manhattan Community College on the Lower West Side has been made to Mayor Koch by high city officials. Work on the campus was discontinued three years ago.

title: Obituary 3  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Bridge:
description: The Tornay family gave the topranked teams a hard time in the quarterfinal stage of the Grand National Team Championship at the Beverly East Club in Manhattan Sunday, but the favored groups eventually prevailed.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MIX YOUR OWN T. S. Eliot 's The Cocktail Party is rarely revived in New York City. The play should be interesting to see  and hear  in a new perspective and nuclear era. Theatergoers with long memories will recall the play 's strong, enigmatic impact on Broadway in 1950, with a cast headed by Alec Guinness, Cathleen Nesbit and Irene Worth. Audiences were magnetized during 410 performances at Henry Miller 's Theater. They were also baffled by the elusive, underlying theme of the Nobel Prizewinning author.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: American Standard Inc., an international manufacturer of diversified product lines, has named Kenneth Liatsos vice president, signaling and railway products Europe; Arthur Ticknor vice president, industrial products; Emmanuel Kampouris vice president of a new organization, the International and Export Group, and Richard Mather vice president, United States Plumbing Products.

title: Sun Oil Sued In Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., March 5  A $3.2 million lawsuit was filed today against the Sun Oil Company of Puerto Rico for allegedly reneging on an agreement to contribute 10 cents for every barrel of petroleum products it refines to the Conservation Trust, an organization set up to help safeguard the island's environment.

title: Abuse of HeatingOil Rules Seen
description: ALBANY, March 5  Warning that the political upheaval in Iran could have severe effect on New York State's energy prices and supplies, an official of the Federal Department of Energy said today that some distributors of homeheating oil may be illegally draining off emergency supplies of fuel.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Around the Nation
description: LONGMIRE. Wash., March 5 (AP) Willi Unsoeld, one of the first Americans to scale Mount Everest, has been killed in an avalanche on Mount Rainier.

title: Rival Boy, a 531 Choice Provides Unrivaled Payoff
description: WESTBURY, L.I., March 5  Rival Boy, a 531 shot, provided the highest win payoff of the the winter season at Roosevelt Raceway tonight, when he captured the fourth race and returned $108.20.

title: Advertising
description: ON April 1, the Brown & Williamson Tobacco Company is expected to go national with a new menthol cigarette called Arctic Lights, with name, packaging and advertising by Rosser Reeves Advertising.

title: Sherry Acker Advances
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 5 (UPI)Sherry Acker advanced to the second round of a $125,000 women's tennis tournament today with a 64, 64 victory over Renee Blount of St. Louis.

title: High Court Voids Alimony Laws Requiring Only Husbands to Pay
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  The Supreme Court ruled, 6 to 3, today that state laws providing that husbands but not wives may be required to pay alimony are unconstitutional.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: 4 Schoolboys Set Marks in Eastern States Track
description: PRINCETON, N.J., March 5  Carlton Young in the 300yard dash and Rod Wilson in the 60yard high hurdles tied national records for handtiming, and Milt Goode with a 7foot2inch high jump) and Carl Lewis with a 255 long jump posted East Coast records tonight in the Eastern States schoolboy track and field championships at Jadwin Gym.

title: About New York
description: To the credit of everyone at Calvary Hospital, when a TV news reporter recently tried one of those howdoesitfeel type questions on a terminally ill woman, the woman carefully deflected the inquiry. As the lens zoomed in, she refused to yield a melodramatic squib on something so Important as her own life and death.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Morday, March 5,1979

title: Kidnapped Italian Boy Rescued
description: ROME, March 5 (Reuters)  The police raided an apartment in suburban Rome today and rescued an 11yearold boy who had been kidnapped five days ago. Two persons were arrested, the police said.

title: Events
description: GANDIDA. by George Bernard Shaw, the ?? Theater Stage Two. 307 West 26th Street. 7:30.

title: Engine Inventor Gets Jail Term
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., March 5  Edward P. La Force, automobile engine inventor, was sentenced today to serve 30 days in jail for criminal contempt in connection with the sale of unregistered stock in his former company. VenturE Inc. of Richmond.

title: Union Will Let Dealers Deliver Milk Byproducts
description: A possible path to settlement of the 10dayold milk strike opened unexpectedly yesterday with an agreement by the union to allow the removal of milk byproducts trapped in the shut plants in New York City and Long Island. The dealers would make their own arrangements for delivery of the byproducts to the stores.

title: American Standard To Redeem Stock
description: American Standard Inc. said it was calling for redemption of all outstanding shares of its $4.75 cumulative convertible preference stock at $100.14 a share, including accumulated unpaid dividends to April 3, 1979, the date fixed for redemption.

title: EARNINGS Fluor Profits Gain 28% in First Quarter
description: The Fluor Corporation, builders of process plants for many industries, and provider of offshore drilling services for the petroleum industry, reported yesterday that profits in its first fiscal quarter climbed 28 percent, to set a ?? for any of its quarters.

title: Russians Say China Failed in Move To Provoke a U.S.Soviet Collision
description: MOSCOW, March 5  As Peking said that its invasion force began pulling out of Vietnam today, the official Soviet press asserted that China had failed to provoke a military conflict between the Soviet Union and the United States.

title: Labor, Equipment and Sales Snags Threaten Iran's Renewed Oil Flow
description: ABADAN, Iran, March 4  At night, the orange glow from flared gas lights the sky of this oil town, casting a quiet aura over the Abadan oil refinery, the largest such complex in the world and a bastion of Iran's oil industry.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Sonata in A (K 12), Mozart; Lohengrin, Prelude to Act III, Wagner; The. Seasons: Christmas, Tchaikovsky: Cascades Rag, Joplin; Octet in E flat, excerpt, Mendelssohn.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, MARCH 6, 1979

title: Dividends
description: MONDAY, MARCH 5, 1979

title: Bridge:
description: Experts are now finding new applications for an idea developed a few years ago. The original convention was called Lebensol after being wrongly attributed in its formative period to a young New York star named Ken Lebensold. Its original form is designed to counter an opposing overcall when the opening bid was one notrump.

title: Federal Glass Sale Is Allowed
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, March 6 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission has removed the last legal barrier to the sale of the closed Federal Glass Company plant in Columbus to the Lancaster Colony Corporation.

title: Study Finds New York City Paying Unfair Rate to State Power Agency
description: New York City is a victim of discriminatory charges for electricity from the Power Authority of the State of New York, and the city government's use of electricity has been going up even though its work force has gone down, according to a new study made public yesterday.

title: Wage Proposal Made By Teamsters in Talks On Trucking Contract
description: WASHINGTON, March 6  Contract negotiations between the International Brotherhood of Teamsters and the trucking industry began to gather momentum today as the union placed its monetary demands on the table.

title: The Story of a Banker's Fall
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 6  The puzzling story of Al Rice refuses to go away.

title: Royal Dutch Buys Oil From Iranians
description: The Royal Dutch/Shell Group, one of the mainstays of the consortium of companies that had operated in Iran, has purchased a large cargo of oil from the Iranians. A spokesman in New York said 320,000 tons of oil (about 2.2 million barrels) was involved but said he did know the price.

title: Recipes. From an Exotic Tradition
description: 6 to 10 lemons Salt

title: Shah, Refusing Abdication, Says He Only Needed 3 More Years
description: The Shah of Iran said in a television interview broadcast last night that he had no intention of abdicating his throne and that with three more years in power his programs would have been successful

title: The Sensitive Palate: An Introduction
description: BrillatSavarin AS food becomes an increasingly popular topic of conversation and pursuit, many who have not had time, money or, most importantly, the interest and natural inclination to learn the finer points of eating suddenly are feeling left out, and very much as though they are missing somethiing.

title: EARNINGS Unilever Net Gains 8% In Quarter, 11% in Year
description: Unilever, the giant BritishDutch producer of food and industrial products, reported yesterday that income for the quarter ended Dec. 31 rose 8 percent and, for the year, was up 11 percent.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: HIS name is Maurice Bidermann, and until very recently he was not only an anonymous face but an unknown name in New York's glamorous social whirl.

title: East Berlin Says NATO Employee Defects From Headquarters Job
description: EAST BERLIN, March 6 (Reuters)An employee at NATO headquarters outside Brussels has defected to East Germany, the press agency ADN said today.

title: Earth Tremor Felt in Greece
description: ATHENS, March 6 (UPI)  A mediumsized tremor, registering 4 on the Richter scale, was reported by the Athens Seismological Institute today. Its center was placed 160 miles north of Athens, near Lankadas, east of Salonika. No damage or injuries were reported.

title: National Steel to Acquire United Financial Corp.
description: The National Steel Corporation, the nation's thirdlargest steel producer, announced an agreement yesterday to acquire for $240 million all of the common stock of the United Financial Corporation of California, the holding company for the nation's 11thlargest sayings and loan assocation.

title: U.S. Sends Ships To Arabian Sea In Yemen Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, March 6  President Carter has ordered a carrier task force into the Arabian Sea to show concern over Southern Yemen's continuing drive into Yemen, to warn the Soviet Union of the risks involved in backing the incursion and to demonstrate support for Yemen's neighbor and backer, Saudi Arabia.

title: Bazooka Gomez Enterprises Inc.
description: It was pouring rain when the president of Bazooka Gomez Enterprises awoke yesterday but Bill Prezant knew something. Functioning as associate trainer and guide to New York, Bill led the president to the Eighth Avenue subway and into a tunnel without train tracks. Out of the weather there, the president did his roadwork, running from 34th Street to 40th and 40th to 34th over and over again as the miles piled up. Bazooka Gomez Enterprises is a Puerto Rican firm dealing in real estate, investments, sports promotions and show business. Its president is Wilfredo Gomez, called Bazooka because he can launch rockets with either hand. Since entering business as a professional fist fighter by boxing a sixround draw with Jacinto Fuentes in November 1974, Gomez has fought 22 opponents and stopped all of them, inclucung Fuentes. Friday night he defends the World Boxing Council 's version of the superbantamweight championship of the world against Nestor Jiminez in Madison Square Garden.

title: Hoeing TV Show Put Off
description: The ABCTV network, denying that the cause was pressure from an art dealers group, postponed last week a segment of its  20/20 television news magazine prepared by Thomas Hoving, former director of the Metropolitan Museum of art and now a correspoiident for the network.

title: U.S. Virgin Islanders Reject Plan For Expanding SelfGovernment
description: CHRISTIANSTED, V.I., March 6Voters in the United States Virgin Islands today defeated a proposed constitution that would have enabled the territory to adopt local selfgovernment.

title: Song: House Music
description: THE fare for last night 's Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center program at Alice Tully Hall, a part of its vocal chambermusic series, encroached amiably on the turf of the New York Vocal Arts Ensemble. In other words, the program was devoted primarily to solid, bourgeois German music meant mostly to be sung in the home by practiced amateur vocal quartets or combinations thereof.

title: World News Briefs
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Chess:
description: Granted that anyone making an uncompromising commitment to win with black must take some risk, there is a limit to how far out on a limb one may venture. Unless you happen to be Viktor Korchnoi.

title: Eroded Portfolios Tied to Rate Rises
description: Since 1976, rising interest rates have lopped $25 billion off the market value of bonds that individuals own, Kevin Hurley of Chase Econometric Associates said yesterday. In a special study he wrote for the Bala Cynwyd, Pa., forecasting firm, he warned that such losses in wealth typically preceded a slowdown in consumer spending.

title: About Real Estate Downtown Offices: The Owner Turnover
description: As Joel I. Picket sees it, this is the time to buy downtown office property. Available space is shrinking in the absence of new construction since the early 1970's, and the increase in rents in the midtown area for what he considers comparable value ought to be a favorable factor for renting downtown.

title: SavingsandLoan Issues Highlight Stock Market
description: Savingsandloan issues surged higher yesterday on the strength of a takeover bid for the United Financial Corporation of California, while the stock market generally beat a modest retreat after Monday's broadbased advance

title: CARTER ASKS ACTION ON HOSPITALS COSTS
description: WASHINGTON, March 6  President Carter called on Congress today to demonstrate its commitment to the battle against inflation by enacting legislation to limit increases in hospital costs.

title: Billy Carter Enters Naval Center 1 For Treatment of Alcohol Abuse
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., March 6  Billy Carter was admitted today to a special unit of the Long Beach Naval Hospital for treatment of alcohol abuse.

title: Russian Landing Ship Heads South Off Japan
description: TOKYO, March 6 (AP)  One of the largest Soviet tank landing ships was reported off Japan heading south today accompanied by a guidedmissile destroyer.

title: Scales's Suspension Caused by an Agent
description: An official of Louisiana State University said yesterday that a pro agent told DeWayne Scales, L.S.U.'s leading scorer this season, that the sophomore could get a $1 million contract with the Washington Bullets if he would cut down on his shooting and display his ballhandlinit talents.

title: CREDIT MARKETS Fannie Maes Reach 10 Percent
description: As the credit markets gave up the ground they had gained Monday, investment bankers yesterday priced $2 billion of Federal National Mortgage Association debentures to yield as much as 10 percent  their highest rate of return since 1974.

title: S.E.C. Asks Large Fine For Vesco
description: WASHINGTON, March 6  The Securities and Exchange Commission is asking a Federal District Court in New York to fine Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive financier, and an associate, Norman P. LeBlanc, up to $10,000 a day if, as expected, they continue to ignore previous court orders.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Stage: Candida Revived
description: ACTORS playing Shaw have a double problem. They have to compete with prior performances in their roles and, at the same time, the loquacious playwright himself is looking over their shoulders. In his character descriptions and stage directions, Shaw gives specific indications as to how he thinks his people should look and how he thinks roles should be played.

title: GOING OUT Guider
description: TONAL TONICS Wolfgang Rubsam, the GermanAmerican organist from Northwestern University, is this afternoon's performer at 5:30 o'clock in the second of the new Twilight Interlude series for visitors and homebound workers in the Lincoln Center area. For his hour at the fourmanual console in Alice Tully Hall, he has selected works of Bach and his contemporaries.

title: 11 Indicted in Dock Inquiry
description: Two reputed organizedcrime figures and three dockunion leaders were. charged in a Federal indictment yesterday with conducting racketeering activities to corruptly control and influence the waterfront industry in the Port of New York.

title: Koch and Beatty Meet In Resounding Session
description: ALBANY, March 6  A meeting today between Mayor Koch and the leader of the drive to recall him, Senator Vander L. Beatty, was not expected to be cordial. It wasn't.

title: G.M. Proposes Cash Payment
description: DETROIT, March 6 (AP)  The General Motors Corporation asked a Federal court in Chicago yesterday for permission to offer a cash settlement directly to owners of 67,000 socalled Chevymobiles.

title: Tape Said to Implicate Nixon in a Dismissal
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP)  Lawyers for the Pentagon 's most famous whistleblower, A. Ernest Fitzgerald, say a newly released White House tape shows that former President Nixon personally ordered Mr. Fitzgerald 's dismissal.

title: Around the Nation
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 6 (AP)  The police union that directed a 16day strike that forced the cancellation of Mardi Gras festivities and cost New Orleans millions in tourist dollars was found guilty of contempt today and was fined $600,000.

title: Efforts Fail to Raise NBCTV From 3d
description: Despite several reorganizations of staff, sevenday work weeks for top executives growing out of long and frequent strategy sessions and uncommonly large investments in new programming during the last eight months, NBCTV remains about where it was last June, when Fred Silverman became president of the National Broadcasting Company.

title: Carter, at Midterm, Is Still Outsider to Many Congress
description: WASHINGTON, March 5  A group of Senators were sitting around a dinner table recently, and one of them posed a question: Who is President Carter's man in the Senate? After considerable discussion, the lawmakers agreed on an answer: No one.

title: '79 Building Is Expected To Ease 3%
description: Construction contracting in 1979 is expected to total $154 billion, 3 percent below a cyclical peak reached last year, according to a report issued yesterday by the McGrawHill Information Systems Company. Despite the shortfall on the 1978 showing  a record $153 billion  volume this year will still represent strong construction demand. the report noted.

title: Economic Scene
description: AUSTIN, TEX. ATWODAY symposium on businessgovernment relations, held at the Lyndon Baines Johnson Library here last week, was remarkably free of any antigovernment rhetoric on the part of the business executives present. Roger B. Smith, executive vice president of the General Motors Corporation, said United States business had to recognize that it can never return to the laissezfaire capitalism of another time.

title: Stage: Equity Library Revives Harbach 's Mary
description: WINTER may be lolloping along to a sodden end in the rest of the city, but spring has arrived at the Equity Library Theater with a 1920 musical called Mary. It's full of corny jokes. (When was the last time stage lovers reassured each other with Nuff ,said and promises of happy and snappy relationships?) The book, by Otto Harbach, is thin and exceedingly silly. But Mary is a corny, silly and utterdelight.

title: Surveillance Equipment at an 8th Avenue IND Station
description: Technicians testing surveillance equipment in subway station below the Port Authority Bus Terminal at 42d Street yesterday afternoon. Camera is fitted with a device that will allow technicians to see images in the dark.

title: World Gold
description: TUESDAY MARCH 6. 1979

title: Oil Reserve Use Hinted By the Fall
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP) Energy Secretary James R. Schlesinger said today that the loss of oil from Iran might force the United States to dip into its Strategic Petroleum Reserve for the first time to bolster supplies of heating oil for next winter.

title: P.S.C. Unit Asks An Investigation Of a Lilco Plant
description: The staff of the New York State Public Service Commission called yesterday for an investigation to determine to what extent mismanagement by the Long Island Lighting Company might have led to cost overruns of nearly 500 percent at the utility's Shoreham nuclear plant on the North Shore of eastern Long Island, now scheduled for operation at the end of 1980 at an estimated cost of $1.3 billion.

title: ByeBye, Nightly News
description: TORONTO  The nightly television news viewed by more than 50 million Americans on the three commercial networks is headed for oblivion.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Money
description: TUESDAY, MARCH ?? 1979

title: Wine Talk
description: LAST week in this space I discussed a group of Burgundies, all of the 1976 vintage and all priced at $10 or less. Given the fanfare with which the 1976 vintage was greeted, the wines were, two and a half years later, uniformly disappointing.

title: Both Uganda and Tanzania Seek Arab Aid in Winning Their War
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 6 Uganda and Tanzania are both appealing to Arab countries for aid in the war between them, and it is believed here that such aid could be critical in determining the outcome of the conflict.

title: Divorcing Alimony From a Stereotype
description: State laws that make men but not women pay alimony are so blatantly discriminatory that the Supreme Court has struck them down without a murmur of dissent on the merits. The only question was whether the case before it was ideal for deciding the issue. Rather than wait for the perfect case, the majority sensibly entertained a challenge by a former husband who had fallen behind in alimony payments, even though he claimed no allowance from his former wife.

title: Koch and Rohatyn in New Clash, Over Hiring of Lazard by M.A.C.
description: Renewed skirmishing erupted yesterday between Mayor Koch and Felix G. Rohatyn, the former chairman of the Municipal Assistance Corporation. Lazard Freres & Company, Mr. Rohatyn's investment banking concern, was reportedly considering resigning as financial adviser to the corporation because of Mr. Koch's criticism of its contract.

title: Companies Report Earnings
description: For periods as shown. IN) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange. (A) the American Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Outbreak of Salmonella Lays Up a Cruise Ship
description: MIAMI, March 6  The Festival, the world's fifth largest cruise ship, lay idle in Miami's port this week as an outbreak of Salmonella poisoning affected 370 of the ships 1,170 passengers and an unknown number of its 575 crew members an its last cruise.

title: Millions Found Wasted in OutofHome Child Care
description: The Children's Defense Fund, after spending three years studying the problems of children living outside their homes, charged in a report being released today that the Federal Government and the states were wasting millions of dollars by keeping many of the children in institutions and foster homes.

title: 2 Are Chosen to Vie for Ryan Seat
description: SAN MATEO, Calif., Wednesday, March 7 (AP)  Joe Holsinger, an aide to the late Representative Leo J. Ryan, and Bill Royer, a Republican county supervisor, won spots last night in a runoff election to complete the term of the Democratic Congressman who was killed in Guyana. allegedly by members of the People's Temple.

title: The U.N. Today
description: March 7, 1979

title: Earthquake Felt in Hawaii
description: GOLDEN, Colo., March 6 (AP)  A moderate earthquake registering 5.1 on the Richter scale shook the island of Hawaii early this morning, the Earthquake Information Service of the Geological Survey reported. There were no immediate reports of damage or injury.

title: Canada Lists Trade Surplus
description: OTTAWA, March 6 (UPI)  Canada recorded a $386 million trade surplus in January, with exports rising 5.6 percent and imports increasing by only 0.2 percent, Statistics Canada reported today.

title: Jury Is Empaneled in Nuclear Contamination Case
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, March 6  A jury of four men and two women was empaneled here today in the case of Karen G. Silkwood, a 28yearold plutonium worker who had been a persistent critic of safety conditions at the KerrMcGee Corporation's plant in Cimarron, Okla., where she was employed when she died in a mysterious automobile accident more than four years ago.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Best Buys
description: COSTCONSCIOUS consumers willing to take their bargains in the form of dented cans and bashedin boxes have been shopping at an unusual store in Brooklyn called Anything and Everything.

title: Harcourt Drops Suit
description: Harcourt Brace Jovanovich Inc., a diversified publishing company, announced that it had withdrawn a suit it had brought in connection with the purchase of 375,000 of its shares, approximately 8.6 percent of its outstanding stock, by Marvin Josephson Associates Inc. Both sides said they had agreed not to make any further comment with respect to the litigation.

title: Jane Byrne Says Mayor Bilandic Is Silent on Transition in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, March 6  Jane M. Byrne, a week after her upset primary election victory over Mayor Michael A. Bilandic and the Democratic machine, complained this afternoon that she still had not heard a word from the man she beat.

title: The City
description: In a rare legal move, a judge post poned for six months the sentencing of 71yearold Maria Petra Ramsay, who was convicted earlier this month of conspiring to kidnap her millionaire exhusband.

title: New Music Project To Showcase Blacks
description: WASHINGTON, March 6The John F. Kennedy Center and its National Black Commission announced today a new music project designed to showcase young black talent and the works of black composers seldom performed in the nation's concert halls.

title: More Than 800 Reported Killed in New Strife in Chad
description: PARIS, March 6 (AP)  More than 800 Moslems were killed in the subSaharan country of Chad over the weekend by groups of black youths, Government officials reported today in Ndjamena, the capital.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Tuesday, March 6,1979

title: Shah to Be Tried In Absentia
description: TEHERAN, Iran, March 6  In the latest effort by the new Government here to freeze Shah Mohammed Riza Pahievi's bank accounts in Switzerland, a Deputy Prime Minister said today that the Shah would be tried in absentia in the hope that a guilty verdict would persuade the Swiss not to return any money to him.

title: The Region
description: NEWARK  The Newark Teachers Union withdrew its call for a strike to protest layoffs of about 1,100 school employees and agreed to meet with school board officials during an unscheduled school holiday next week to resolve the issues that have disrupted the school system here for the last three months.

title: Peking Sees Myth Exploded
description: HONG KONG, March 6  China said today that its troops were victoriously returning from Vietnam after having exploded the myth of the invincibility, of the Vietnamese Army.

title: Mr. Carter Flies to the Brink
description: More than a peace treaty between Egypt and Israel rides on President Carter's journey to the Middle East. More than Jimmy Carter's standing in the public opinion polls, too. This President turns out to be devoted to the art of diplomatic brinkmanship, a highstake roller in global negotiations. Sometimes, as with Panama, China, the Pentagon budget and soon perhaps SALT, he presses a foreign agreement upon a divided home front. Sometimes, notably with human rights, he injects an American imperative into delicate foreign situations. Sometimes, Camp David style, he shuttles desperately among deadlocked foreign contenders. Always the nation's global standing as well as his Presidency are put at risk, and even calculated risks will yield a dramatic failure or two. But the more Mr. Carter succeeds, the more he may teach Americans that demonstrations of strength and vision in the world can turn on something other than military action.

title: Issue and Debate New American Arms Sales In Tense Persian Gulf Area
description: WASHINGTON, March 6  In the wake of the Iranian upheaval, a new controversy is brewing over plans by the Carter Administration to step up the sale of advanced arms to proWestern countries in the Persian Gulf and Middle East.

title: Rhodesians Battle On In Guerrilla War
60Minute Gourmet
description: THERE may be many chemists who are excellent cooks. Among the few chemists I have met, however, their enthusiasms have been far more directed to test tubes and molecular structures, than to food processors and pots and pans. In turn, I know very few cooks or chefs who could explain in any kind of depth the scientific reason why egg yolks will thicken when beaten with oil or butter, to produce a mayonnaise or a barnaise sauce. But, in a sense, a wellused experimental kitchen is, in its own way, a sort of laboratory.

title: Union to Intensify Fight With Stevens
description: GREENVILLE, S.C., March 6 Textile unionists fighting to sew the union label on the giant J.P. Stevens & Company textile operation announced plans today to intensify their campaign of corporate isolation against Stevens by stepping up pressure on its financial allies and on major Stevens stockholders.

title: Americans May Sit Out Sale by Iran
description: Several major United States oil campanies, apparently with the backing of the State Department, are threatening not to participate in an Iranian sale of crude oil this week because of the high prices the revolutionary Government in Tehran is asking.

title: FaceLifting Study For Macombs Park
description: If Myles Jackson has his way, Macombs Dam Park, the worn athletic field in the Bronx across the street from Yankee Stadium, could have a $6 million face lift by next year. And it would be at no cost to New York City.

title: Music: Melos Schubert
description: LAST year was proclaimed as the Schubert year, commemorating the 150th anniversary of the Viennese composer 's death, but that was only an amiable fiction because for the true melomaniac every year is a Schubert year. One therefore cannot come down too hard on the Melos String Quartet for bringing us a fourconcert cycle of Schubert 's music in 1979, after the celebration 's official end. In fact, the opening program last night at Carnegie Hall suggested that the German quartet 's series may provide more insights into Schubert than several dozen of the illplanned and haphazard performances offered last year by other groups and individuals.

title: 18 Hurt in School Disturbance
description: BOSTON, March 6 (UP1)  Sixteen students and two teachers were injured today in racial disturbances at Hyde Park High School. Fred Foye, a spokesman for the Boston School Department, said that classes were dismissed at 11 A.M. The police were called to the school shortly after 8:30 A.M. to break up fights on the third floor. There were no arrests.

title: Jupiter's Nearest Moon, Jo, Perplexes Astronomers
description: PASADENA, Calif., March 6  A few days ago, lo, innermost of Jupiter's moons, was seen only as a pinpoint of light. From closeup scanning by the Voyager 1 satellite, it has now emerged as one of the most remarkable and perplexing bodies of the solar system.

title: Fear of Worn Shoes
description: The emergency ban announced last week by the Environmental Protection Agency on major uses of the herbicide 2,4,5T, known to be contaminated with traces of the potent dioxin TCDD. represents only one step in confronting the serious problem of dioxin contamination across the industrialized world.

title: Private Lives
description: THIS is after he has talked to students at an upstate college, trying to explain himself. This is before he gets back to the imperial city, where he will find on his doorstep two his favorite people, with bows on their necks, flown from Dayton, Ohio, by his wife especially for his birthday. This is in between, a parenthesis, a lapse of haste, on a train, in a smoking compartment that smells like a pissoir. For some reason it's necessary, both going to and coming from the upstate college, to change trains at CrotonHarmon. For the second time in two days he has guessed wrong in choosing a seat on CrotonHannon, and so is traveling backward. Traveling backward is a form of nostalgia, reminding him of where he's been. He knows, anyway, where he's going. He's going to be 40 years old.

title: TV: Cher and Fantasies
description: CHER seems more than ever like a figure in a Byzantine court ceremonial in her debut on NBC tonight. In Cher . . . and Other Fantasies, which will be seen from 8 to 9 o 'clock, it is not so much a performance she gives as a ritual she performs.

title: Wood, Field and Stream A New Kind of Bait Offers a Hefty Catch
description: Ever since an imaginative stoneage man fashioned a gorge from wood or bone and, using a line made of plant or animal fibers or hair, caught a fish with it, the search for a better way to do the same has been unrelenting.

title: Entertainment Events
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA. Lincoln Center, Verdi's DonCarlo 7 15.

title: Strikers Sign Gerd Mueller, West German Soccer Star
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 6 (AP)  The Fort Lauderdale Strikers today signed Gerd Mueller, who led the West German soccer team to the World Cup championship in 1974.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: ON a crosstown bus. Edward Biller tuned as a woman, with a small boy in tow, argued with the driver. At issue was whether the child was old enough to be required to pay the fare. The woman maintained he was not.

title: Vietnam Says It Is Willing to Talk If Chinese Keep Pledge to Pull Out
description: BANGKOK, March 6  The Vietnamese Government said today that it was ready to negotiate with China if China carried out its plan. to withdraw all its forces.

title: Blacks Gain. Key Role in Philadelphia Mayoral Race
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 6  Hundreds of thousands of newly registered black voters, a backlash to the openly racist vote white strategy of outgoing, Mayor Frank L. Rizzo, are considered likely to have a decisive role in the campaign to succeed him that opened officially here today.

title: MuchTraveled Schultz Ponders Role as a Bully
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., March 6  The most penalized man in the history of the National Hockey League was glum today before attacking the traditional pregame steak.

title: Lobbying Effort for Medical Funds Pays Off as House Trims Cutbacks
description: WASHINGTON. March 6  A major lobbying effort by medical schools and nurses paid off today as the House, in its first budget test of the year, agreed to restore part of the medical training funds that President Carter had insisted be rescinded.

title: Technology
description: AUSTIN, TEX. IMPLANTATION of ions, a technique used for nearly 10 years in making semiconductors, may also hold out promise in the nation's efforts to conserve chromium. This metal is a key element in the fabrication of corrosionresistant steels and other hightemperature alloys.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Industrialist Seeks a Jersey Casino License
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., March 1 Resorts International won the first Atlantic City casino license, and two other giants of the gaming industry, Caesars World and the Bally Manufacturing Corporation, expect to be next unless Fiore Francis (HiHo) D'Addario, a brash newcomer to the casino business, has something to say about it.

title: Umpires Will Miss Exhibition Openers
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 6 Baseball will open its spring training season of 346 exhibition games tomorrow, but the balls and strikes will be called by local umpires at each site because of a contract dispute between the big leagues and their men in blue.

title: Gillies Out, Islanders Lose to Sabres, 32; Any Good News?; Islanders Scoring
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., March 6  The New York Islanders must have known it was going to be a long day when the biggest man on the team  their captain, Clark Gillies  woke up this morning with the chicken pox.

title: Citicorp Appeals Status Of Its LongTerm Debt
description: Citicorp, in an apparent effort to prepare the market for additional issues of longterm debt, sought yesterday to convince bank analysts that only debt with maturities of 15 years or more should be considered part of capital.

title: Kitchen Equipment
description: THE symbol of culinary failure is the fallen souffle. And it is true that there is nothing sadder than the sight of a souffl as it rises slowly only to sink into dense mass before any of it has ever been touched to the lips. But I think too much is made of the rise and fall of souffls.

title: Carey RevenueSharing Plan Gains
description: ALBANY, March 6  Warren M. Anderson, the Senate majority leader, said today that he ?? accept Governor Carey's proposal to slow future growth in revenuesharing asistance to local governments, but nut his plan to limit aid to last year's levels.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS Western Security At Stake
description: BONN  Recklessness threatens Western security from two sources: from outside by the Soviet Union's inconsiderate race toward further superiority in the field of mediumrange missiles, from inside by the imprudent approach to dtente in the West, notably in the United States.

title: Purim: The Merriest Of Jewish Holidays; Sweets For Purim Festivities
description: Purim, commemorated this year next Monday through Wednesday, is considered the merriest festival of the Jewish year. Its carnivallike atmosphere is recreated annually to celebrate the Persian Jews escape fromannihilation at the hands of the treacherous Prime Minister Haman during the reign of King Ahasuerus (485464 B.C.). The name Purim means lots, a reference to the game of chance played by Haman to determine the precise day for executing the Jews.

title: Dance: Bjart Opens With Bolero and Life
description: IN Maurice Bejart's new Gat Parisienne, the hero, representing Mr. Bjart himself, is told by a singing figure of Terpsichore that you are not handsome, you are not rich. His talents He elsewhere, she assures us and him. Yes, but where?

title: Drug's Threat Called Less Serious
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 6 (AP) Synthetic DES, or diethylstilbestrol, may be less of a cancer threat to daughters of women who took the drug in pregnancy than was earlier believed, a Boston pathologist said today.

title: Record Of Nuclear Safety Cited
description: WASHINGTON, March 6  A cornpany that insures the nation's commercial nuclear reactors leapt into the debate over nuclear safety today by asserting that, to date, the nuclear industry has achieved one of the best industrial safety records in the United States.

title: Bogicevic Remains The Cosmos Rebel
description: PORT OF SPAIN. Trinidad, March 6  Vladislav Bogicevic of the Cosmos has a philosophy of life that is not calculated to please his employers.

title: Notes on People
description: If anyone were to call Ray Shaw a maniphiliac, she wouldn 't for a minute be insulted. She admits she is obsessed by hands, and as a sculptor has devoted herself almost exclusively to them. Among the dozens of expressive hands Mrs. Shaw has sculpted are those of the late violinist Mischa Elman, the writer Fannie Hurst, Franklin D. Roosevelt, Jack Dempsey, Helen Hayes, Lauren Bacall and Jimmy Doolittle. One of her favorite subjects was Albert Einstein, and on Sunday she leaves for Israel with a bronze cast of his hands, which will be part of an exhibit starting March 14 at the Einstein centennial celebration of Hebrew University in Jerusalem. The sculpture will be sold after the exhibition.

title: South Africa Strikes Namibian Rebel Bases in Angola
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, March 6 South Africa sent troops and warplanes into Angola today on what it described as limited strikes against bases of the SouthWest Africa People's Organization.

title: Arthur Richardson, 89, ExHead of Chesebrough
description: Arthur B. Richardson, former chairman of ChesebroughPond's inc. of Greenwich, Conn., manufacturer of Vaselinebrand products, died Sunday at the Penobscot Bay Medical Center in Rockport, Me. He was 89 years old and lived in Owl's Head, Me.

title: F.B.I. Is Said to Report Aid to Carter Business Violated Banking Law
description: WASHINGTON, March 6  A preliminary report by the Federal Bureau of Investigation has found technical violations of banking laws in the administration of loans to President Carter's warehouse business, wellplaced Administration sources said today.

title: Letter On U.S. Foreign Policy
description: To the Editor:

title: Robert Farquharson, 79, A NATO Aide in 1950's
description: VICTORIA, British Columbia, March 6 (AP)  Robert Allan Farquharson, the former director of information for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, died yesterday at the age of 79. He had suffered a stroke last summer.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article on the Style page yesterday about spring fashions, one mention of a photographer incorrectly called her Rebecca West. She is Rebecca Blake

title: HANOI TO COOPERATE ON EMIGRATION PLAN
description: BANGKOK, March 6  The Vietnamese Government has agreed to cooperate with the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees to arrange the legal emigration of Vietnamese to countries ready to accept them.

title: CeaseFire Agreement
description: KUWAIT, March 6  Arab League foreign ministers ended an emergency meeting on the border war between the two Yemens today with a call for an immediate ceasefire, the withdrawal of the armed forces of both sides within 10 days and the restoration of normal relations.

title: Careers
description: LIKE engineers, computer science personnel are now in great demand; employment firms have more openings than people to fill them.

title: Minor Changes for New Yorkers Seen in Landmark Alimony Case
description: The telephones started ringing early in many New York law firms yesterday. The divorced and the soontobedivorced were calling; they wanted to know what the United States Supreme Court's landmark ruling on alimony Monday meant for them.

title: Knicks Lose to Blazers
description: Tom Owens grew up in New York, played at LaSalle Academy in Manhattan and at the University of South Carolina and enjoyed stardom in both places. His pro basketball career was hardly as glittering until he landed with the Portland Trail Blazers in 1977 in a trade with the Houston Rockets.

title: An Erratic Triumph By Spectacular Bid
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., March 6Ron Franklin had been saying all week there was no way he could get Spectacular Bid beaten, but the young jockey almost found away today in the $200,000 Florida Derby at Gulfstream Park.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, MARCH 6, 1979

title: Bonwit Teller Head Resigns
description: Bernard Newberg has resigned as president of Bonwit Teller, effective at the end of March. Mr. Newberg said yes terday that he was investigating several opportunities, but that he would not announce his plans until after he took a vacation. He did not comment on whether his resignation was related to the previously announced sale of Bonwit's to the Allied Stores Corporation, expected to be completed in April.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Almost 20 years ago, James S. Kemper Jr., who had been a practicing lawyer with some large law firms as well as with his own, joined the company founded by his father as vice chairman. That company, now known as the Kemper Corporation, was a major property and casualty insurance concern, with interests in other financial services.

title: V.W. Car Rust Warranty
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, March 6 (AP)  Volkswagenwerk A.G. today introduced a sixyear warranty against rust on the bodies of its automobiles sold in Europe. The buyer of a new Volkswagen or Audi model is expected to bring in his vehicle for inspection after two and after four years, the company said.

title: LowSulfurOil Offer Is Spurned by Con Ed Because of High Cost
description: The Consolidated Edison Company of New York has turned down a cargo of lowsulfur fuel oil, saying that the price was too high. The decision came a week after the utility requested, a variance from the state to burn highsulfur fuel as long as the current squeeze on oil supplies continued.

title: PRESIDENT REVIVING A REDUCED AID PLAN ON JOBLESS IN CITIES
description: WASHINGTON, March 6  President Carter pledged strong support today to the revival of a major program of providing fiscal aid to cities with high unemployment rates, which died in Congress last year.

title: Ombudsmen Serve City's Despairing
description: Mary Tinsley was at the end of her rope and Melvin Alston was her last resort.

title: SADAT SAID TO BUOY HOPES FOR ACCORD DURING CARTER TRIP
description: WASHINGTON, March 6  President Anwar elSadat of Egypt has informed President Carter that he wants the American leader's Middle East trip to result in a peace treaty between Egypt and Israel but that he is reserving judgment on the latest American compromise proposals until Mr. Carter arrives in Cairo Thursday.

title: Nets Bow To Spurs, 103 to 99
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., March 6  In a classic case of winning the battle but losing the war, the New Jersey Nets dominated the game almost from the start tonight, but the San Antonio Spurs triumphed, 10399; at the Rutgers Athletic Center.

title: Brzezinski Briefs Sadat on the New U.S. Proposals
description: CAIRO, March 6  Zbigniew Brzezinski, President Carter's national security adviser, flew into Cairo today to brief President Anwar elSadat on Washington's latest Middle East peace strategy in advance of Mr. Carter's arrival here Thursday.

title: Q &
description: Q.Do you have a recipe for crispy. crunchy Southern fried chicken? I've tried everything from bread crumbs to oatmeal, but I can't seem to get a crunchy crust.

title: News of the Theater Four Horovitz Plays Going Into Rehearsal
description: MOST playwrights would be happy to have one play done in a season; the prolific Israel Horovitz is about to have four. 'The Quannapowitt Quartet will go into rehearsal April 1 and open May 1 at the Public Theater. The quartet will be performed in repertory, with two plays tentatively scheduled to go on one evening and the other two the next.

title: $75,000 Fine Set in Diet Suit
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP)  The maker of the P.V.M. diet product agreed to a $75,000 civil fine to settle a false advertising case, the Federal Trade Commission said today.

title: How the Stage Was Set for Carter's Trip: Laughter at Talks Marked Turning Point
description: WASHINGTON, March 6  As President Carter and Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel emerged from the Oval Office at 3:30 P.M. Sunday, they and the cluster of aides around them burst into gales of laughter.

title: Baseball Hall to Vote Today
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 6 (UPI)  Hack Wilson, whose 1930 hitting statistics rank among the greatest in major league history, and Warren Giles, president of the National League for 18 years, are the most likely candidates for election into baseball's Hall of Fame tomorrow by the Veterans Committee of the Baseball Writers Association of America.

title: Walter J. Nickerson, ExRutgers Professor In Microbiology Field
description: Dr. Walter J. Nickerson, a former professor of microbiology at Rutgers University in New Brunswick, N.J., died Monday at the Raritan Valley Hospital in Green Brook, N.J. He was 6,3 years old and lived in the Borough of Middlesex.

title: Street's Woes Not Seen As Institutions Problem
description: Wall Street, feeling the pains of lower profitability and increasing concentration, is looking for support from its institutional customers. But a newly released survey of 150 institutions by the Securities Industry Association indicates that, while customers are indeed aware of some of Wall Street's problems, they do not see most of the problems as their own.

title: ThaiBurmese Opium Fight
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 6 (Reuters)  Thailand and Burma announced today that they had agreed to increase cooperation in suppressing illicit drugs from the opiumgrowing area where the two countries border on Laos. The announcement came at the end of a twoday visit here by President Ne Win of Burma. The bulk of the world's heroin comes from the area's opium.

title: Price Heads Columbia Pictures
description: LOS ANGELES, March 6  The earthquake that began for Columbia Pictures Industries with the David Begelman scandal 14 months ago has ended with the appointment of 48yearold Frank Price as president of Columbia Pictures. That earthquake metaphor belongs to Mr. Price, who, after his appointment yesterday, characterized the musical chairs in Columbia 's executive suites over the last year as a series of aftershocks.

title: Advertising
description: THERE is a day that arrives in New York before spring but has the effects of spring. It makes people act funny and it turns everything green.

title: COMMODITIES Cattle Futures Retreat From Historic Highs
description: Cattle futures, which reached historic highs Monday, retreated yesterday. Closing prices were down the daily limit in most positions on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange.

title: A Dream Is Destroyed for 5 Soviet Jewish Farm Families
description: MOSCOW, March 5  About 150 peasants recently crowded into a social club in the village of Kazanskaya, 400 miles southeast of Moscow, for a general meeting of the Russia Collective Farm. It was the first meeting in a year, although the farm's charter requires one every three months, and there was important business to consider.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: United Airlines said it was canceling 929 flights a week for the rest of March because of a jetfuel shortage that it attributed largely to the curtailment of oil exports from Iran. The cuts by the nation's largest air carrier, the most extensive announced so far by any airline, amount to 3.4 percent of the 12,000 flights a week that United normally operates. [Page A1.]

title: THE LONDON TIMES NOW SKIT 3 MONTHS
description: LONDON, March 6The labor dispute that has closed two of Britain's principal newspapers, The Times and The Sunday Times, passed the threemonth mark last week, and next week a final contingent of 1,300 employees will be lopped from the payroll.

title: Personal Health
description: MRS. STILSON is not deaf, drunk, drugged, senile, crazy or mentally retarded. Nor is her native language different from the doctor's. Rather, Mrs. Stilson has suffered a stroke that has left her with a severe language disorder known as aphasia. She probably does not fully understand the doctor's questions, and she is unable to find the words to formulate an appropriate answer to whatever she thought she heard. Instead, a kind of jibberish, or jargon, emerges from her lips.

title: Dire Predictions on Proposition 13 Have Not Materialized
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif.  In this scenic hillside community of 75,000 people, nestled on the shore of the Pacific Ocean, the lawns outside City Hall do not get manicured quite so often these days as they did before California voters passed Proposition 13 last June. But few residents notice the difference.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Letters
description: To THE LIVINg SECTION.

title: Hawks 94, 76ers 91
description: ATLANTA, March 6 (AP)  Tom McMillen sank a pair of free throws with 1:28 remaining and when Julius Erving missed two shots in the final minute, the Atlanta Hawks held on to edge the Philadelphia 76ers, 9491, tonight.

title: Books of The Times
description: IT is apparently a fact that Adolf Hitler arrived in Liverpool in November 1912 and remained there for five months. Twentythree years old, he was fleeing from conscription into the Austrian Army.

title: Survey Forecasts School Cost Rise For Connecticut
description: HARTFORD, March 6  The gap between Connecticut's richest and poorest towns is wider than state officials believed, and bridging it could be more expensive than anticipated, according to figures released today.

title: TURKISH SLUM STRIFE MENACING STABILITY
description: TUZLUCAYIR, Turkey, March 3 The No. 39 bus passes through five no man's lands on its 10mile. journey through Ankara and into the suburban slums.

title: Sarah Coogan, Member Of Polo Grounds Family
description: Sarah J. Coogan, a member of the family that had owned the land under the Polo Grounds in Manhattan, home for many years of the New York Giants, died Sunday at a nursing home in Cross River, N.Y., at the age of 94. She had lived for many years at the Biltmore Hotel in Manhattan.

title: USSoviet Trade Set Record in 1978
description: MOSCOW, March 6  The United States and the Soviet Union exchanged a record $2.8 billion worth of goods last year, with the Americans chalking up a surplus in that trade of $1.72 billion, according to figures released today by the American Embassy.

title: Begin Meets With Jewish Leaders
description: Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel spent the day in New York resting at the Regency Hotel and meeting with friends and leaders of Jewish groups.

title: Creditors Delay Aid To Turkey
description: WASHINGTON, March 6  Leading creditor nations are at an impasse over financial aid to Turkey because of the Ankara Government's rejection of austerity conditions demanded by the International Monetary Fund, a key international official reported today.

title: Israelis Await the President With Their Former Optimism Shaken
description: JERUSALEM, March 6  When Sadat came here, I believed there would be peace between us and the Arabs, said Nissim Katan of Tel Aviv. Then when Begin went to Egypt, I said, O.K., this is it. After Camp David, it seemed like a treaty would come in a few weeks.

title: Italian Election in May Forecast
description: ROME, March 6 (Reuters)  Italian political sources predicted today that general elections would probably be held May 6 if no solution to the government crisis was found. President Sandro Pertini was expected to ask Giulio Andreotti, the caretaker Prime Minister, to try again to form an administration. But he is given little chance of success.

title: TWO JUPITER MOONS INTENSELY CRATERED
description: PASADENA, Calif., March 6  The Voyager 1 spacecraft today returned the first closeup photographs of Ganymede and Callisto, the two largest satellites of Jupiter, and their dirty waterice surfaces were shown to be riddled with craters.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: Houdaille Industries, a diversified company whose output ranges from auto bumpers to machine tools, said yesterday that it had signed an agreement to be taken over for $348 million in cash.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, MARCH 7, 1979

title: Zaire Foreign Minister Restored
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, March 6 (Reuters)  President Mobutu Sese Seko of Zaire today reinsta!ed as Foreign Minister Nguza KarliBond. who was under death sentence for treason last year. His appointment was part of a Government shakeup reported by the official Zairian press agency.
