description: MONTREAL, March 25 Quebec's secessionistminded government recorded a major gain today when a poll sponsored by the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation indicated that half the province's population was prepared to give the government a mandate to negotiate the terms of sovereignty together with economic ties with the rest of Canada.

title: Jazz: Benny Goodman And Stephane Grappelli
description: BENNY GOODMAN gave a casual, lowkeyed concert at Carnegie Hall on Saturday evening that, although it was pleasant as tar as it went, seemed to make the least of its opportunities.

title: FastestGrowing Companies
description: Move over Fortune 500, here comes Inc. magazine's list of the nation's 100 fastestgrowing small companies.

title: Notes on People
description: Today is another school day at St. Francis Prep in Queens, but it will not be an ordinary one for Maria Cuomo, the 16yearold daughter of Lieut. Gov. Mario M. Cuomo, because she will go to and from classes watched by her family more closely than ever. Miss Cuomo is still shaken and having trouble sleeping since she was mugged last Thursday, for the second time in four months, near her house in the Holliswood section of Queens.

title: Events
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, ?? Sager's Der Fliegende liollander. 8.

title: Violin Recital: Miss Somach
description: BEVERLY SOMACH, who performed Saturday evening at Alice Tully Hall, is a violinist who began her career as a child prodigy but later retired to raise a family. She returned to the concert stage several years ago.

title: UGO LA MALFA DIES
description: ROME. Monday, March 26  De puty Prime Minister Ugo La Malfa, leader of the small but prestigious Republican Party and one of the most respected polictical figures in Italy since the end of World War II, died here this morning. Mr. La Malfa, who was 75 years old, was taken to a hospital Saturday after suffering a brain hemorrhage at his home.

title: Bridge:
description: NORFOLK, Va., March 25  The final of the women's knockout team championship here today matched Chicago against the East Coast. Cheri Bjerkan, Florine Walters, Sue Halperin and Bev Nelson, a foursome that reached the final a year ago, are teamed with two other'players from the, Chicago area, Sandi Leavitt and June Deutsch.

title: Herb Shriner With a Jumper
description: SALT LAKE CITY IN THE morning yesterday, Larry Bird was supposed to appear at a brunch honoring him as the college basketball player of the year. But when the Indiana State coach, Bill Hodges, woke him up at 9 o'clock, he said, Coach, I'm dead  can I stay in bed? The coach agreed.

title: Tombstones Damaged in Queens
description: Twentyfive tombstones, some of them more than 150 years old, were overturned and a few irreparably damaged in the churchyard of the Zion Episcopal Church in the Douglaston section of Queens sometime Friday night. Basil Wild, treasurer of the church at 24301 Northern Boulevard, reported the damage early Saturday morning. The police said there were no witnesses to the incident.

title: No Change Set For Fed Funds
description: The Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee, which now meets 10 times a year to set monetary policy, decided at its Feb. 6 gathering to leave policy essentially unchanged, it was disclosed Friday.

title: Outdoors: Florida Tarpon
description: MARATHON, FLA. FLYfishing for tarpon or bonefish on the vast, shimmering Florida flats is not a contemplative endeavor.

title: Trial Spurs Racial Tensions in Washington Suburb
description: UPPER MARLBORO, Md., March 25  In Prince Georges County, a sprawling community long troubled by tension between black residents and the local police, a 16yearold black youth went on trial last week in the murder of two white police officers.

title: Marriage Announcement 1  No Title
description: Kathy Gold Is Married To George H. Kalikman

title: Koch Checking for Shift In Subway Crime Hours
description: Mayor Koch said yesterday that he had asked the Transit Authority for complete statistics on crimes occurring in the city's subways between 2 and 7:30 A.M.  when reinforced police patrols are not in effect  so that more police could be deployed, if necessary.

title: Letters; Obsolete U.S. Sugar Industry; Wrecking Ball vs. an Urban Civilization; How About a War On Subway Grime?; Toll Clerk Protection; Organic, Natural, Renewable  and Furry; The Heroes Of New York; Food Safety Laws in Need of a Risk/Benefit Balance
description: To the Editor: The President's proposed legislation to correct the ills of the domestic sugar industry is a sham and a disservice to America's inflationriddled consumers. The domestic sugar industry is an outmoded one that has no hope for an economic breakthrough and is no longer needed or desired.

title: Hurting the Crime Fighters
description: Despite its jawbreaker name, L.E.A.A.  the Law Enforcement Assistance Administration  began life a decade ago with a silver spoon in its mouth. It was the closing months of the Johnson Administration and crime ranked a close second to Vietnam in public concern. The President and Congress were frantic for some kind of Federal action to make the streets safe. L.E.A.A. was their answer: an agency that could, in the name of research, for the first time put Federal dollars into local law enforcement.

title: McEnroe Conquers Tanner by 64, 62
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 25  John McEnroe of Douglaston, Queens, needed just 58 minutes today to defeat Roscoe Tanner of Palm Springs, Calif., 64, 62, and win the $175,000 New Orleans tennis festival before a sellout crowd of 6,800 in Municipal Auditorium.

title: Commodities
description: IT went off the chart, and I ran out of paper. That was the comment about the 'surge in copper prices made Friday by Irving J. Louis, a senior vice president and head of the metals department at Bache Halsey Stuart Shields Inc., the large brokerage house.

title: St. Paul Group Plays Copland
description: THE first of the two concerts this past weekend by the St. Paul Chamber Orchestra was an allAaron Copland affair Friday night at Alice Tully Hall, half conducted by the composer.

title: Washington Watch
description: WASHINGTON COMING soon: The most important energy pronouncement from the Carter Administration in two years. On Thursday night  although the date may be put off  the President is scheduled to unveil his proposals to respond to the loss of oil imports from Iran and to remove orice controls on oil.

title: Sporting Gear
description: If you're a horseshoe pitcher who can't find a place to drive a stake or would like to make the sport a yearround activity, you might try PortACourt. It consists of a metal frame base nine feet square, a covering rubberized mat and a leaning metal stake, and is light enough to be taken along on car trips or hung on a wall when not in use. Horseshoes landing on the surface react much as they would on dirt, staying in place when they're thrown flat and bouncing when they hit sideways. There is also a measuring chain, to assure correct distances. The price for one court is $95, for two courts $189, plus a charge of about $10 each for shipping to the New York area. Order from Arnold Tool and Die Works, 3135 West Broadway, Council Bluffs, Iowa 51501, (712) 3239330.

title: AIDE REPORTS MIN IS CUT OFF BY FOES
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 26  As an invading force of Tanzanians and Ugandan exiles cut the main road from Kampala to Entebbe Airport early this morning, a spokesman for President Idi Amin said the Ugandan leader was trapped by a column of tanks in his official residence at Entebbe.

title: Old Dominion Five Women's Champion
description: GREENSBORO, N.C., March 25 Something happened to Old Dominion early in the second half of the Association for Intercollegiate Athletics for Women basketball final today. It started with two steals, one by Nancy Lieberman and the other by Rhonda Rompola, and ended in a 7565 victory over Louisiana Tech for the title. A crowd of 2,877 turned out at the Greensboro Coliseum.

title: SUPPORTING TREATY IS COSTLY FOR U.S.
description: The peace treaty scheduled to be signed today is by far the most expensive ever supported by the United States.

title: There's Another New Chef in the Gracie Mansion Kitchen
description: Lauren Kaye, Mayor Koch's third ?? since he took office, gets her biggest test tonight: A dinner for 120 at Gracie Mansion. The guests are the cast from the Broadway musical, ??, who performed with the Mayor in his rebuttal to a recent roasting by City Hall political reporters.

title: Theater: Zoot Suit, Chicano MusicDrama
description: ZOOT SUIT, like the garment that serves as its symbol, is a great deal of loose material draped over a spindly form.

title: Koch Regrets His Feud That Forced Out Lazard
description: Mayor Koch hasn't said so publicly, but he has told aides that he regrets having started all that ruckus about Felix G. Rohatyn, Lazard Freres and the company's $250,000ayear contract as financial adviser to the Municipal Assistance Corporation.

title: Kennedy Bomb Hurts 4 Workers In Baggage Area
description: A bomb in a suitcase exploded at the Trans World Airlines Terminal at Kennedy International Airport last night, slightly injuring four ramp service employees just minutes before the suitcase was to have been loaded onto a nonstop flight to Los Angeles.

title: French Back Socialists in Local Voting
description: PARIS, March 25  Voters in local elections across France gave avid support today to the Socialist faction of the opposition but did not shake the Government's conviction that it is probably the most stable in Western Europe.

title: Iran Is Said to Plan Religious Panel To Approve Government's Actions
description: TEHERAN, Iran, March 25A constitution for the Islamic republic being secretly drafted here calls for a powerful, separate religious body that could review, ratify or reject the actions of the Government, according to sources close to the process.

title: ABROAD AT HOME Message To Pretoria: I
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Like other universities across the country, Harvard is arguing about the South African connection. Here as elsewhere feelings run high. How American institutions can hest help to end racism in South Africa is not a simple question. But I think the Harvard debate has illuminated the issue in important ways.

title: Pope Voices the Strong Support Of Church for IsraelEgypt Pact
description: ROME, March 25  Pope John Paul II went out of his way today to state the forceful support of the Roman Catholic Church. for the EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty scheduled to be signed in Washington tomorrow.

title: World News Briefs
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Missonis Clothes a Hit as Milan Showings Open
description: MILAN, March 25 The Missonis, who have elevated knitted clothes to a form of art, scored the first big success of the fall readytowear shows here. The Italian fashion openings will be followed by market weeks in London, Paris and, toward the end of April, in New York. The shape of next winter's clothes will be established long before summer sets in.

title: TV SPORTS
description: TONIGHT

title: Dinner and Concert April 8 To Benefit Eglevsky Ballet
description: A benefit to aid the financially troubled Eglevsky Ballet Company will be held April 8 in the Nassau County Veterans Memorial Coliseum in Uniondale, L.I., it was announced by Harry Chapin, the folk singer, and George Dempster, cochairman of Challenge '79.

title: Opera: A Fresh Lucia
description: THE last Lucia di Lammermoor of the season at the City Opera on Saturday afternoon gave Faye Robinson her first opportunity to sing the title role with the company. Like most Lucias over the last couple of decades, Miss Robinson is no chirpy coloratura but a generously endowed lyric soprano who does not shy away from giving both the musical and dramatic aspects their full due.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of ?? ?? for week ??

title: Television
description: Morning

title: GPING OUT Guide
description: CAGED BIRD In his poem Sympathy, Paul Lawrence Dunbar wrote: I know why the caged bird sings. Well he might. The son of slaves, Mr. Dunbar was president of his Dayton, Ohio, high school literary society, but after graduation he worked as an elevator operator and a men's room attendant at the Chicago World's Fair. And he died in 1906 of tuberculosis at age 34. He was, however, a prose writer and a leading poet of the 19th century. His more famous poems included: The Party and When Malindy Sings. And even before they knew the poet, generations of children knew his poems, many of which were sensitively written in black dialect  Love me honey, love me true?/Love me well ez I love you? /An she answe'd, Cose I do  Jump back, honey, jump back. (From, A Negro Love Song.)

title: Street Lighting Is Said To Affect Crime Little
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 (UPI) A Governmentfunded study has concluded that although welllighted streets may lessen the fear of crime, there is no statistically significant evidence that the lighting actually reduces crime.

title: O.E.C.D. Less Optimistic On France's 79 Economy
description: PARIS, March 25  The French Government's controversial campaign to close down inefficient industries and force its businessmen to modernize is unlikely to yield all the beneficial results that had been hoped for this year, according to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: President Carter discussed proposals to revise regulation, characterizing the current regulatory machinery as a bewildering mass of paperwork, bureaucracy and delay. Mr. Carter has made regulatory revision an important tenant of his Administration and said that his proposals would comprise the first comprehensive rewriting of the regulatory procedure in 30 years. [Page Al.]

title: Chamber: Y Orchestra In Concert
description: ACOUSTICS make a big difference as to how any musical event is perceived, and where you sit in a hall has a pronounced effect on the acoustics. Saturday night at the 92d Street Young Men'sYoung Women's Hebrew Association, this critic heard the first half of the Y Chamber Symphony's concert from downstairs, and then moved up to the balcony. He enjoyed the second half a lot more.

title: Canadiens Finally Beat Rangers, 10
description: It took a shutout last night for the Montreal Canadiens to end the domination the Rangers held over them. By a 10 score at Madison Square Garden, the Canadiens halted a string of four straight Ranger victories over two seasons.

title: Concerns About Growing Inflation Dominate Carter's Southwest Tour
description: DALLAS, March 25  Touring the Southwest on the eve of the signing of the historic EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty, President Carter was bombarded with questions about the domestic economy. With consumer prices rising 1.2 percent last month, concern over inflation clouded the President's otherwise sunny reception this weekend in Oklahoma and Texas.

title: Intelligence Prediction Of the Chinese Attack On Vietnam Reported
description: WASHINGTON, March 25  The United States intelligence community made a prescient forecaster of the Chinese attack on Vietnam six weeks before it occurred and, on the whole, did a good job of informing policy makers of the moves of Asian nations in the recent Far Eastern crisis, according to a member of Congress who conducted an investigation into intelligence procedures.

title: New Unit Seeks to Prevent Russians From Spying on U.S. Phone System
description: WASHINGTON. March 25  The Carter Administration has removed the secrecy wraps from a small new Federal office that has the mission of preventing Soviet officials from obtaining financial and technical information by eavesdropping on the nation's telephone system.

title: Belle's Gold Takes Bay Shore
description: Aqueduct's main course was used for the first time this season yesterday as John R. Murrell's Belle's Gold scored an upset victory in the 20th running of the Bay Shore Handicap.

title: Foes of Subsidizing House Races Seek to Kill Bill by Inflating Cost
description: WASHINGTON, March 25  Opponents of campaign subsidies for House candidates are trying to discredit the proposal by making it too expensive for a costconscious Congress to accept, both in appearance and fact.

title: Syrian Leaders And Gromyko Continue Talks
description: DAMASCUS, Syria. March 25 (Reuters)  Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko held a second round of talks with Syrian leaders here today and was expected to offer increased Soviet support for Arab opposition to the EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty that is to be signed tomorrow in Washington.

title: HangUps
description: We have a friend who stutters; and while he notices no increase in rudeness or sarcasm from people in person, he does hear more impatience and sarcasm from telephone operators, secretaries, businessmen, switchboard personnel and other strangers whom he must deal with over the phone. As he stands at a phone booth or holds onto the devilish device at home, the time allotted to him to spit out the words seems to have markedly decreased; perhaps it has even been halved in the past few years. This alarms him because at the same time the importance of the telephone in daily transactions has zoomed. Indeed, many people use answering machines to consolidate their calls and, soon, voiceprinting may became a commonplace method of identification. Imagine, he says, stuttering into a voiceprint machine.

title: 75,000 on Fifth Ave. Salute Greek Culture and History
description: With thundering bands, waving forests of Greek and American flags and a blue and white river of floats and costumed marchers. 75,000 people streamed up Fifth Avenue yesterday in New York's annual salute to Hellenic culture and history, the Greek Independence Day Parade.

title: Miss Navratilova Wins Crown
description: Two years ago, when the backhands began to stray and the concentration drifted, she might have let it slip away. But yesterday Martina Navratilova composed herself under pressure and beat Tracy Austin, 63, 36, 62, for the $100,000 top prize in the women's winter tour tennis championships.

title: UV Shareholders Decide Company's Fate Today
description: About four years ago Victor Posner, a Miami businessman known for his keen judge of sleeping giants, developed a strong interest in a wealthy mining company called UV Industries.

title: Watson 2d On 71288
description: PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla., March 25  Lanny Wadkins won the sixth Tournament Players Championship today by playing a cool round of par 72 and letting the opposition make the mistakes in a stiff wind of 25 to 30 miles an hour and swirling gusts of up to 40 m.p.h.

title: Niedelman Leaves Agency for Tulips
description: Robert S. Niedelman, president and sole owner of Waterman, Getz, Niedelman Advertising, is 48 years old and has responsibilty only for two cats, he says. So next Friday he'll close the doors of his agency for good and go watch the tulips or even take a Pan Am aroundtheworld tour.

title: The City
description: The Parks Department expects that, for the first time in a decade, it will have recreation and maintenance workers in 86 percent of the 750 New York City playgrounds in operation this summer.

title: The Region
description: HACKENSACK, N.J.  The es?? husband of one of three mur?? victims in Fair Lawn, N.J., Brian ?? Molese, underwent further questioning here yesterday as detec?? of the Bergen County Prosecu?? office pressed their search for a motive.

title: Sports Today
description: Michigan State vs. Indiana State, National Collegiate title game, at Salt Lake City (TelevisionChannel 4,9 P.M.)

title: Chess:
description: It is a practical rule that most grandmasters under time pressure avoid passive positions where it is not clear from what direction the attack will come. Under time pressure, what is needed most is clarity and anything that transforms the nebulous into the manageable must be given prime consideration.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 (AP)Makers of a bread that has been marketed for its nutritional qualities must tell consumers in advertising that they are eating wood fiber, a consent agreement with the Government said today.

title: Islanders Tie on Bossy's No. 60
description: PITTSBURGH, March 25  Mike Bossy's 60th goal of the season with 28 seconds to go gave the New York Islanders a 22 tie with the Pittsburgh Penguins tonight before a chastened crowd of 14,864.

title: Opera: Carlson as Budd
description: THE Metropolitan Opera's staging of Benjamin Britten's Billy Budd, first unveiled last fall, reentered the repertory Saturday night. Save for Lenus Carlson as Billy, all was as before, and the production continues to be a visual triumph, thanks to John Dexter's cogent direction and William Dudley's multilevel set representing an ingenious cutaway view of the ship H.M.S. Indomitable.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Monday, March 26, 1979

title: ExHead of Starr Broadcasting Settles
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  Peter H. Starr, former president, chief executive officer and director of the Starr Broadcasting Group, today settled charges filed against him last month by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: About Education
description: APERSONNEL officer at the Bank of ?? ica complains: Errors we once found commonly in uplications from the high school graduates now are cropping up in forms from people with fouryear college degrees.

title: Driving on Gasohol in Midwest
description: CLINTON, Mo., March 26  Motorists in the Middle West are finding that gasoline and alcohol can mix, as long as it's in their fuel tanks.

title: Amin Mystery Grows With a Report He Is Trapped
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 26  The mystery over the whereabouts of President Idi Amin of Uganda deepened today after Radio Uganda reported that he was cut off from the bulk of his armed forces and preparing to face an invading force of Tanzanians and Ugandan exiles practically alone.

title: Ban on Best Retained I
description: LONDON, March 26 (AP)  A London high court judge refused today to overturn a world ban on George Best, who wants to play for the Fort Lauderdale Strikers in the North American Soccer League.

title: 2 Castro Foes Are Sought in Bombing
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation said yesterday it was desperately involved in a hunt for two antiCastro Cuban fugitives for questioning in connection with the Sunday night bomb explosion at the Trans World Airlines terminal at Kennedy International Airport.

title: 30 Years of War Preceded Making a Start on Peace
description: David BenGurion, the first Prime Minister of Israel, once said that the journey of an Arab leader to Jerusalem would mark the beginning of lasting peace.

title: Rights and Wrongs at City Hall
description: The only show of dignity in Mayor Koch's dealings with Blanche Bernstein, his erstwhile Commissioner Human Resources, came after the fact, with Miss Bernstein's forthright resignation. The Mayor had stripped her of official power but told her she could hang on to her title. Then he placed Stanley Brezenoff, the Commissioner of Employment and a subordinate to Miss Bernstein, in charge of the agency with instructions to report directly to the Mayor. It was a crude and cruel bit of bureaucratic gamesmanship.

title: Taxes
description: THE earned income credit, a type of negative income tax for the working poor, has been troublesome ever since Congress enacted this benefit in 1975 in an effort to redistribute income to the needy and remove their incentives to stop working and go on welfare.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Sonata in F for Flute, 2 Violins, and Continuo, A. Scarlatti Sonata a 4 in G for String Orchestra. Tartini; Jesu, Joy of Man's Desiring. Bach.

title: Books of The Times
description: IN a review of Leslie Fiedler's Love And Death in the American Novel. Irving Howe is quite firm: Mr. Fiedler lacks the one gift  I think it a gift of character Which is essential to the critic: the willingness to subordinate his own schemes and preoccupations to the actualities of a particular novel or poem. the love or generosity which persuades a critic to see the work in its own terms and not to bend it to his personal or ideological needs. Another way of saying this is that the critic needs a conscience.

title: Blue Diamond Deal Is Ended
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., March 26 (AP)  The Standard Oil Company (Indiana) has withdrawn its offer to buy the Knoxvillebased Blue Diamond Coal Company, the two concerns said.

title: Seychelles Is Reported to Adopt Constitution for OneParty State
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 26 (Reuters) The Government of the Seychelles, the Indian Ocean archipelago, announced today the adoption of a new Constitution providing for a oneparty socialist state.

title: Obituary 6  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Credits for American Can
description: GREENWICH, Conn., March 26. (UPI)  The American Can Company announced today that it had signed separate loan agreements with eight banks for a total of $200 million in revolving credits. The agreements run through 1982 and will be renegotiated thereafter on a termloan basis. The company did not identify the banks.

title: Advertising
description: REDBOOK magazine, which preempted the female 18to34 agegroup a decade ago with its Young Mamas ad campaign, has expanded its horizons under the direction of its new, young publisher, Thomas M. Kenney, 32, and with the help of George Lois, adman.

title: TV: The Mackenzies Of Paradise Cove Bows
description: TELEVISION to do your homework to, or to pretend to, has increasingly come to dominate the first hour or 90 minutes of primetime television.

title: Brown to Take U.C.L.A. Post
description: Larry Brown, a victim of the pressures of coaching pro basketball, will now take on the pressures of coaching U.C.L.A.

title: Censorship of Textbooks Is Found On Rise in Schools Around Nation
description: Parent and community groups across the country appear to have stepped up efforts to censor reading materials and course content in the public schools.

title: An Rx for Health ...
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J.  Some say that we are in the midst of a health revolution, but it would be more accurate to say that we are merely on healthbuying spree.

title: Evelyn Trull Bates, 97, Montclair Civic Leader
description: Evelyn Trull Bates, a leader in civic and charitable activities in Montclair, N.J., died Sunday at her summer home in Webster, Mass., after a long illness. She was 97 years old and had been a resident of Montclair for more than 70 years.

title: Pizza Parlor Owner Kills Woman He Said Was Trying to Rob Him
description: A 33yearold woman holdup suspect was killed yesterday when the owner of a pizza parlor hit her over the head with a baseball bat after he said that she threatened him with a broken bottle, the police reported. She was identified as Hilda Sanchez of 2005 Grand Concourse the Bronx.

title: Frederick J. Adams
description: Frederick Johnston Adams, an internationally known city planner and longtime head of the department of city and regional planning at the Massachusetts Inscitute of Technology, died Sunday at the Medical College of Ohio at Toledo after a short illness. He was 77 years old and lived in Toledo.

title: Japan's Export Role
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, March 26 (Reuters)  Japan will be the world's biggest exporting nation by the mid1990's, outstripping both the United States and West Germany, the German Economic Institute predicted today. It said Japan already dominated world trade in several fields, accounting for threequarters of motorcycle exports, 70 percent of radios and 40 to 50 percent of ships.

title: Next H.R.A. Commissioner
description: Even Stanley Brezenoff shakes his head and sighs when he contemplates the responsiblities and the $4.3 billion budget of the Human Resources Administration, which spends more than any city agency.

title: Toll in China's Lesson Is Heavy for the Vietnamese
description: HANOI, Vietnam, March 26  The toll of China's lesson to Vietnam, in punishment for Vietnamese intervention in Cambodia, is now being assessed. and it is heavy.

title: Obituary 3  No Title
description: Deaths

title: 7 U.S. Cities to See Show Of Japanese Art, Culture
description: AN ambitious twomonth project designed to introduce Americans to Japanese arts and culture will begin in midApril, bringing to seven cities a total of 450 events, among them art exhibitions, film series, panel discussions and live performances of theater and music.

title: Tiny Roanoke Plays Big Role in Eastern Lacrosse
description: Tiny Roanoke College is ready for spring's lacrosse challenges. The Virginia school has only 1,100 students, and just 600 men, but last year the Maroons toppled the twotime champion, Hobart, from the National Collegiate combined Division II and III throne. This spring Roanoke has won three straight games without a loss.

title: H.U.D. Attacks Bank Study on Cities' Fiscal Stress
description: WASHINGTON. March 26  Saying that the urban fiscal crisis is not over. the Department of Housing and Urban Development has denounced a recent private bank study that found city governments in better financial condition than most had thought.

title: Latest Data Suggest Exercise Helps Curb Heart Attacks
description: ALTHOUGH it has not yet been proved that regular exercise can prevent heart attacks and death from heart disease, the latest research provides more evidence strongly suggesting that physical activity confers a lifesaving benefit.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 Chemists Challenge Evidence In Trial Over Girl Scout Slayings
description: PRYOR, Okla., March 26 (UPI)  Two chemists testifying for the defense today disputed the state's evidence against Gene Leroy Hart, who is accused of murdering three Girl Scouts in 1977. The two witnesses suggested that some of the chemical tests bordered on guesswork.

title: Michigan State Defeats Indiana State for N.C.A.A. Title
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 26 Michigan State grounded The Bird with a touch of Magic and a magnificent zone defense tonight to win its first National Collegiate basketball championship and end Indiana State's chance to achieve an unbeaten season.

title: The Pink Card: Supplier Tags Books That Have Drawn Complaints
description: One book is marked because it has a drawing of a naked little boy; another because it includes the expression go to hell; still another because of its subject matter, monsters.

title: The Region
description: TRENTON (AP)  Students who repeatedly disrupt school should be removed from regular classes and sent to special regional schools, according to a draft report of a special task force on reducing school violence. The recommendation is one of more than 200 under consideration by the Task Force on Reducing Violence and Vandalism, formed last November by State Education Commissioner Fred R. Burke. The report is to be presented to the State Board of Education on May 2.

title: UV Shareholders Vote To Liquidate Company
description: Shareholders of UV Industries voted overwhelmingly in a special meeting here yesterday to sell the company's biggest asset, the Federal Pacific Electric Company, for $345 million and then to liquidate the company.

title: Bell &
description: WASHINGTON, March 26 (AP) Students who enrolled in the Bell & Howell Company's correspondence courses in electronics and accounting but then failed to get jobs stand to receive refund payments totaling about $1.4 million under an agreement announced today by the Federal Trade Commission.

title: Let us turn our hearts to our heroes and pay tribute. . . .
description: Mr. President of the United States of America, Mr. President of the Arab Republic of Egypt, Mr. Vice President, Mr. Speaker of the House of Representatives, Mr. Speaker of the Knesset, members of the Cabinets of the United States, of Egypt and Israel, members of the Congress and the Knesset, your excellencies, chairman of the Board of Governors of the Jewish Agency, chairman of the executive of the Zionist organization, Mrs. Gruber, the mother of the sons, distinguised guests, ladies and gentlemen:

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Armstrong Cork Company, Lancaster, Pa., a manufacturer of interior furnishings, has elected to its board Harry K. Wells, chairman and chief executive officer of McCormick & Company.

title: Sadat and Begin Did Not Start as Men of Peace
description: The two men who sat down yesterday with President Carter to sign the first pact of peace between Jews and Arabs in the Middle East began their careers as ardent believers in revolutionary violence. It is one of the few things that Anwar elSadat and Menachem Begin have in common, for both are nationalists.

title: Obituary 5  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Crime and Punishment: A View From City Bench
description: The defendant stands a few yards from the judge's bench, shifting from one foot to another. A court officer is behind him; a plainclothes policeman is at his side. The three wait silently.

title: 6,000 Auto Workers in Argentina Halt a 10Day Renault Walkout
description: CORDOBA, Argentina, March 26 (AP)  About 6,000 auto workers returned to work today, ending a 10day strike that slowed production at a Renault assembly plant and three parts plants here.

title: Judge Bars Hydrogen Bomb Article After Magazine Rejects Mediation
description: MILWAUKEE, March 26  A Federal District Court judge here, acting only after his suggestion for an attempt at outofcourt settlement was turned down, granted the Govermment'S motion for a preliminary injunction today to keep The Progressive magazine from publishing an article about the hydrogen bomb.

title: Civil Service Employees Reject Pay Offer by British Government
description: LONDON, March 26 (AP)  Civil servant unions here noted that the Labor Government will face a vote of confidence this week and rejected a wage offer today as an act of senility from a dying government.

title: New Tools for Predicting Quakes
description: THE development of new measuring methods and improvements in older ones are enabling scientists in California to look at  and listen for  changes within the earth that warn of impending earthquakes. The stakes are high, for reliable predictions of time and place could save tens of thousands of lives when, as is considered inevitable, a major quake hits one of the larger cities.

title: EDUCATION Rx for Medical Arts: The Social Sciences
description: CHICAGO AN extensive revision of the premedical and medical curriculum is under way at the University of Chicago as part of a major effort to infuse medical education with a lane dose of humanities and social sciences.

title: Corporate Earnings Reported
description: For periods as shown, (N) Indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Raising Money for the Party
description: There was, we regret to note, a dismaying aspect to the ceremonies in Washington yesterday, a failure of taste and judgment that needlessly cheapens Jimmy Carter's achievement.

title: In Egypt, Peace Is Welcomed Quietly, With Hope for a Better Life
description: CAIRO, March 26  Egyptians shrugged off the start of formal peace with Israel today, treating the day much like any other. There were expressions of relief and satisfaction but none of the euphoric exultation they had shown when President Anwar elSadat visited Israel 16 months ago and started the movement toward peace.

title: Texts of EgyptianIsraeli Treaty and Its Annexes
description: CONVINCED of the urgent necessity of the establishment of a just, comprehensive and lasting peace in the Middle East in accordance with Security Council Resolutions 242 and 338;ently of any instrument external to this treaty.

title: EGYPT AND ISRAEL SIGN FORMAL TREATY, ENDING A STATE OF WAR AFTER 30 YEARS
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  After confronting each other for nearly 31 years as hostile neighbors, Egypt and Israel signed a formal treaty at the White House today to establish peace and normal and friendly relations.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: Deaths

title: COMMODITIES Metals Prices Increase; Hog Futures Decline
description: Metals futures prices rose yesterday amid concern about possible oil price increases.

title: Appendix to Annex I Organization of Movements in the Sinai
description: 1. The withdrawal of armed Israeli forces and civilians from the Sinai will be accomplished in two phases as described in Article I of Annex I.

title: Treaty Timetable Geared to Pullout From Sinai
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  The signing of the EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty puts into motion timetable that should, if fulfilled, culminate in about three years with the withdrawal of the last Israeli forces from the Sinai Peninsula.

title: Canada Improves Energy Supply
description: CALGARY, Alberta, March 26 Canada's conventional energy supply improved last year following several years of declines in crude oil reserves and only marginal gains in reserves of natural gas.

title: Carey Effecting State Cut in Tax On Capital Gain
description: ALBANY, March 26  Dismayed by the Legislature's decision not to act immediately to cut the state tax rate on capital gains, Governor Carey is using a technicality in the tax law to effect virtually the same reduction without the Legislature's approval.

title: New York Wary Of Prosecuting Its Illicit,Casinos
description: A criminaljustice official in City Hall, responding yesterday to a report that illegal gambling casinos were flourishing in New York, said that on the eve of legalizing gambling in one form or another, we'd be hard put to crack down on illegal casinos.

title: Syrians Tell U.S. Pilot To Land in Damascus
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, March 26 (AP) A Pan American World Airways plane bound from New York to Saudi Arabia was ordered to land in Damascus today and then was allowed to resume its flight three hours later, airline officials reported.

title: Lions Kill South African's 2 Girls, Then He Is Mauled in Graveyard
description: JOHANNESBURG, March 26 (AP) In two separate incidents, two children of a laborer for the Kruger National Game Park in northeastern South Africa were killed by lions, and then the worker himself was attacked by a lion while digging his daughters graves, newspaper reports said here today.

title: Brown Faces 2 California Political Problems
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 26  Two sticky state political problems have dropped into the lap of Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. even as he moves toward a campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination next year.

title: Officials at U.N. Foresee Grave Political Risks in Role Under Pact
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 26 The prospect that the United Nations will have a role in carrying out the terms of the EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty is causing more anxiety than enthusiasm here.

title: The U.N. Today
description: March 27, 1979

title: Delay Seen In Carter Fuel Plan
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  Administration officials said today that the announcement of President Carter's new energy proposals appeared certain to be deferred until next week, perhaps Monday or Tuesday.

title: Letter: On School Bus Contracts
description: To the Editor:

title: Spartans Used No Cues To Silence Larry Bird
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 26 When the Michigan State University players had the basketball, they could always look for the cue cards.

title: Bourse Strike Now Month Old
description: PARIS, March 26  An almost monthold strike by employees of the Bourse, the Paris stock exchange, is estimated to have deprived French companies of half a billion dollars they might otherwise have raised.

title: PayTV, With 12 Stations Approved, Makes Gains
description: For two decades, attempts to use broadcast stations for the transmission of paytelevision programming had been beaten back by forceful lobbying campaigns in Congress and at the Federal Communications Commission by organizations of motionpicture theater owners and commercial broadcasters.

title: MortgageSale Yield Increases
description: Interest rates on home mortgages moved higher yesterday in the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation's weekly purchase of housing loans, reflecting a springtime upturn in demand and also concern that savings flows may slow because of changes in money market certificates.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: Government bond prices declined slightly yesterday as the credit markets awaited action by the Senate to raise the ceiling on the national debt.

title: Mood of Peace Seems Somber And Uncertain
description: WASHINGTON, March ?? Shortly after 6 A.M. today, President Anwar elSadat arose in the residence of the Egyptian Ambassador and began wandering around the fivebedroom house.

title: PostDispatch Marks Centennial
description: ST. LOUIS, March 26 (AP)  The St. Louis PostDispatch celebrated the 100th anniversary of its founding by Joseph Pulitzer with a centennial issue yesterday.

title: Hudson's Bay Getting A 2d Suitor
description: TORONTO, March 26  The battle for the Hudson's Bay Company escalated sharply today as George Weston Ltd., Canada's largest merchandiser, announced that it was considering making its own offer for the diversified nationwide department store giant.

title: Condemned Man to Get Florida Clemency Hearing
description: MIAMI, March 26  A clemency hearing for John Spenkelink will be held within 50 days, Gov. Bob Graham of Florida announced today after learning that the United States Supreme Court had refused to review the case of the 30yearold condemned killer.

title: Concert: Starker and St. Paul Players
description: JUDGING from the conversations overheard at intermission, much of Sunday night's audience at Avery Fisher Hall was made up of cellists, professional and amateur, intent on adult education. And why not, because the evening's soloist with the St. Paul Chamber Orchestra was Janos Starker, one of the instrument's grand masters. Mr. Starker performed a staple of the cello literature, Haydn's Concerto in D, with the peculiar mixture of hairraising facility and aristocratic restraint that has long been his hallmark.

title: Uranium Price Trial Ruled Out
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  The A ?? ministration's antitrust chief, John H. Shenefield, told the Senate ?? nopoly subcommittee today that the Government had sought no grand jury indictments charging American companies with participation in an international pricefixing cartel of uranium producers because we could not win a felony prosecution.

title: Byrne, Koch, Gibson Urge U.S. to Reenact AntirecessionAid Program
description: NEWARK, March 26  Governor Byrne and members of the United States Conference of Mayors  including Mayor Koch of New York and Mayor Kenneth A Gibson of Newark  today told a Senate subcommittee that the Federal antirecessionaid program should be restored to stem severe unemployment in the cities, especially among young blacks.

title: Paul V. Gartland, 76
description: Paul V. Gartland, senior vice president of Johnson & Higgins, insurance brokers in Manhattan, died yesterday of lung cancer at Norwalk Hospital in Connecticut. He was 56 years old.

title: French Swing to Left Gives It 54.6% in Local Vote
description: PARIS, March 26 Final results from local elections across France yesterday show an impressive swing to the Socialists, with the combined leftist parties winning 54.6 percent of the votes.

title: Science Watch
description: Several leading investigators of unidentified flying objects reported yesterday that last December's sightings of U.F.O.'s over New Zealand provided the strongest example to date of an episode that could not be explained by conventional means. The investizators examined film made during airplane flights and interviewed radar operators and persons who said they had seen the objects.

title: Q&A
description: Q. Is there any ?? proof that highfat diets cause cancer in humans

title: . . . And Sources of Treatment
description: IRVINE, Calif.  Amid Britain's economic problems, a surprising growth industry is emerging: private hospital care.

title: Feuer Now Directing Mama
description: Cy Feuer has replaced Martin Charnin as director of I Remember Mama, the new Richard Rodgers musical, which is having problems in Philadelphia, where it is trying out. The show, starring Liv Ullmann, is scheduled to open on Broadway at the Majestic on May 3. Mr. Charnin will continue his association with Mama as lyricist.

title: Umpires Are Accused Of Breaking Obligations
description: Commisssioner Bowie Kuhn accused the baseball umpires yesterday of breaking a legal and moral obligation to abide by their contract. The umpires, who are seeking pay increases and additional fringe benifits, have not worked at any spring training games this season.

title: Frederick R. Bruns Jr., A Smithsonian Curator
description: WASHINGTON, March 26 (AP) Frederick R. Bruns Jr., supervisor and curator of the Smithsonian Institution's division of postal history, died of cancer on Saturday. He was 66 years old.

title: Violinist: Gidon Kremer Plays in a Different Way
description: IN what may be called the postOistrakh period, we have seen a continuing stream of superior violinists come out of the Soviet Union, but none has made a more powerful impression than Gidon Kremer did in his Carnegie Hall recital last night. The slender young man, who studied under Igor Oistrakh, plays in an entirely different style than his teacher, and in fact in a different way from most of the successful violinists of the recent past. And yet, Mr. Kremer is plainly one of the big ones, both as a fiddler and as a pure musician.

title: Women and Society Questions of Transition and Identity
description: These were some of the theses advanced here last weekend at Women and Society, a threeday interdisciplinary conference on women's studies, held at Saint Michael's College, a Catholic liberal arts institution that became coeducational seven years ago. Conceived by Dr. Carey Kaplan of the English department, the 36 panel discussions attracted almost 200 participants from across the country, and an audience that ranged between 1,500 and 2,000 men and women.

title: White Sox Shell Guidry And Beat Yankees, 115
description: SARASOTA, Fla., March 26 George Steinbrenner probably won't understand, and neither will a lot of baseball fans who sometimes confuse spring training with regularseason combat. But Ron Guidry understands.

title: For Begin's Return Home, Doves Instead of Guns
description: TEL AVIV, March 26  When Menachem Begin brings home the peace treaty with Egypt Thursday night, he will be welcomed by hundreds of white doves instead of the 19gun salute due a .Prime Minister.

title: Bridge:
description: NORFOLK Va., March 26 The second stage of a remarkable double victory concluded the American Contract Bridge League Spring Nationals here last night in the Scope Convention Center.

title: Agreed Minutes
description: Article I  Egypt's resumption of the exercise of full sovereignty over the Sinai provided for in paragraph 2 of Article I shall occur with regard to each area upon Israel's withdrawal from that area.

title: Palestinians, Reacting to the Pact, Go on Strike and Denounce Egypt
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 26  Vowing revenge, staging strikes and protest marches and calling for punitive measures against Egypt, Palestinians and other Arabs reacted angrily today against the signing of the EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty in Washington.

title: Case Against Clammers Dropped on Long Island
description: Federal charges of illegally taking undersized seed clams from the Great South Bay in Suffolk County have been dismissed by a Federal Court in Westbury, L.I., on the ground of insufficient evidence. The charges had been made against Fire Island Fisheries Inc. of Bay Shore, L.I., and one of its owners, Nick Slager:

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Piltdown Fossils Stir New Debate
description: NEW evidence concerning one of the most farreaching April Fool's hoaxes in the history of science  the bogus Piitdown Man  has stirred up a dispute in which some scientists are questioning the integrity of .their own profes??

title: The Road to Churchill Downs
description: HIALEAH, Fla.  When Ron Franklin rode Spectacular Bid back to the winner's circle at Hialeah Park after Saturday's Flamingo Stakes, Buddy Delp, the colt's trainer, asked: How many times did you have to hit him?

title: Usual Chinaglia Lament: Unprepared for Opener
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 26  Giorgio Chinaglia, the star forward of the Cosmos, says he is approaching Saturday's North American Soccer League opener with more apprehension than ever before, even after having scored a record 34 goals in 30 games in 1978.

title: News of the Dance New York to See Danes in Bournonville Rarities
description: IN November in Copenhagen, the Royal Danish Ballet will stage a festival to mark the hundredth anniversary of the death of August Bournonville, the Danish dancer, choreographer and teacher who gave the world a uniquely light, fast and effervescent style of dance. But New Yorkers will not have to wait until then for a sampling of the festivities. The producing team of David Singer and Charlotte Kirk is now completing arrangements to bring 11 dancers from the Royal Danish Ballet here in June. They will appear from June 19 to July 1 at the City Center as part of a fiveweek tour. Fourteen Bournonville dances will be presented, some so rare they are not even in the Danes repertory and have had to be reconstructed by the Bournonville expert Hans Brenaa.

title: Boats Capsize, Killing 4
description: MORRO BAY, Calif., March 26 (AP)Four persons, including a 13yearold boy, were confirmed dead today after their disabled boat and a Coast Guard rescue craft capsized in heavy surf. The boat capsized 400 to 500 feet offshore. Originally, officials said the boats had collided, but the Coast Guard said today that the reports were incorrect.

title: Use of Isolation Cells In a Detention Center For Aliens Is Charged
description: Aliens held for deportation at a Brooklyn detention center operated by the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service are subject to cruel and unusual conditions, according to a suit filed yesterday by the New York Civil Liberties Union.

title: Market Place
description: MANY of those who have speculated on Atlantic City gambling stocks will be pleased to hear that a leading accounting concern thinks there is room for many casinos in that New Jersey shore community.

title: Trudeau, Fighting to Hold Reins, Sets Canadian Voting for May 22
description: OTTAWA, March 26  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau, fighting hard to maintain power after 11 years in office, tonight called general elections for May 22.

title: Supreme Court Roundup Florida Death Sentence Turned Down for Review
description: WASHINGTON, March 2  The Supreme Court refused today to hear the appeal of a Florida man sentenced to die in the electric chair for murder.

title: The City
description: New York City's director of labor relations said yesterday that the union representing 1,500 schoolbus drivers who have been on strike since Feb. 15 would consider a proposal by the city's Board of Education to settle only if all its drivers were guaranteed jobs of comparable pay.

title: Stage: TipToes of 25 By the Gershwins Opens
description: WITH TipToes opening last weekend at the Brooklyn Academy of Music and Whoopee! running on Broadway, New York is becoming a happy outpost for the Goodspeed Opera House, that Connecticut riverboat of a theater devoted to the rediscovery of American musicals. Seeing these two shows in tandem is like taking a time machine back to the 20's, when musicals were melodic and comedic, when first acts ended with finalettos, and second acts ended with an upbeat. It was also a period when bookwriting was as mechanical as a railroad track  a device to get from song to song.

title: The End of Some High Rolling
description: ATLANTIC CITY, March 26 (AP)  It will almost be as if salt water taffy had been banned and Miss America hadn't shown up  there will be no rolling chairs on the Boardwalk this summer.

title: SETBACK FOR SOVIET SEEN IN THE TREATY
description: MOSCOW, March 26  The EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty signed today in Washington marks a setback to Soviet policy in the Middle East, but it also opens up new opportunities, which Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko sought to exploit during a threeday mission to Syria that ended with his return today.

title: Around the Nation
description: DUGWAY PROVING GROUND, Utah, March 26 (AP)  The detonation of 26 rusting land mines filled with a deadly nerve agent was postponed today because of shifting desert winds.

title: Califano Acts to End Carolina College Aid On Segregation Issue
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  Joseph A. Califano Jr., Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, today announced administrative action against North Carolina stateoperated universities and colleges for continuing to run a racially segregated system of higher education.

title: Union of Clerks, Cashiers To Strike Offtrack Betting
description: The union that represents clerks and cashiers at the 167 parlors of the Offtrack Betting Corporation voted last night to stage a strike this morning.

title: Concert: The Janacek
description: CONDUCTORLESS chamber groups appear to be proliferating these days and many seem to do quite well without a maestro standing before them waving his hands. The Janacek Chamber Orchestra is certainly one of the best around, as these 11 string players amply demonstrated at their New York debut concert Sunday afternoon at Hunter College Assembly Hall.

title: Beauty Care for Children: Putting on the Dog
description: From Bloomingdale's in New York to Bullocks in California to Harrods in London, merchants have discovered that the surefire way to sell anything to children is to get Snoopy to endorse it.

title: Specialty Chains: Takeover Bait
description: Specialtystore and discountstore chains are emerging as prime takeover targets in the eyes of departmentstore operators, who previously had looked upon them with superiority, if not disdain.

title: Stocks Retreat Despite Some Big Gains
description: Several specialsituation issues made big price gains yesterday as the general, market retreated moderately in much slower trading.

title: Panel Rejects Charges That Tranquilizer Use Led to Patient Deaths
description: Charges by the Rockland County Medical Examiner that tranquilizers had contributed to the deaths of mental patients at two state institutions were rejected yesterday by a state commission as irresponsible and totally without substantiaion.

title: 2 Earthquakes Hit Area of Coast
description: SANTA MARIA, Calif., March 26 (UPI) Two earthquakes struck a rural area four miles south of Santa Maria in Santa Barbara County today. There were no reports of damage or injuries, the police said. The earthquakes registered 3.0 and 3.6 on the Richter Scale, according to the seismological laboratory at the California Institute of Technology in Pasadena.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TODAY'S SPECIAL Places to eat have always been an important facet of this city. By some counts there are now 10,000 eating places here. And as fashions in clothing and manners have changed, eating styles have varied. In the 18th and 19th centuries you would not see pizza on a bill of fare. Today it's a challenge to find sheep's heads, eels tartare and little birds on toast.

title: Annex III
description: ARTICLE 1 Diplomatic and Consular Relations

title: Sabres Defeat Blues, 42, With ThirdPeriod Goals
description: ST. LOUIS, March 26 (UPI)  Gil Perreault and Rick Dudley scored 35 seconds apart in the third period tonight to give the Buffalo Sabres their fourth straight National Hockey League victory, a 42 triumph over the St. Louis Blues.

title: Gary Hemminger Weds Miss Oldfield, a Teacher
description: Patricia Ann Oldfield, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Wilfred Oldfield of Malton, England, was married there yesterday to Gary D.A. Hemminger, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur J. Hemminger of Massapequa, L.I., and Southbury, Conn. The Rev. James Connelly performed the ceremony in St. Leonard's Roman Catholic Church.

title: EARNINGS Carter Hawley Hale Reports Profit Gains
description: Carter Hawley Hale Stores Inc., the nationwide retailer that operates the Bergdorf Goodman, John Wanamaker and NeimanMarcus stores, yesterday reported profit increases of 19.5 percent for its fourth fiscal quarter and 17.8 percent for the full fiscal year ended Feb. 3.

title: Dividends
description: MONDAY, MARCH 26, 1979

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Pressures mounted for a major increase in oil prices at a meeting of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries in Geneva, but no decision was announced. Iran, Iraq and Libya called for increases ranging from 20 to 35 percent on April 1. But Saudi Arabia, by far the largest oil exporter, said it would try to resist pressures for such a large increase. [Page A1]

title: Entertainment Events
description: GOOD LADS AT HEART by Peter Terson; directed by Michael Croft. Performed by the National Youth Theater of Great Britain. At the Brooklyn Academy of Music. 30 Lafayette A venue, 7.

title: Let there be no more despair or loss of faith.
description: President Carter, dear friends. is is certainly one of the happiest moments in my life. It is a historic turning point of great significance for all peaceloving nations. Those among us who are endowed with vision cannot fail to comprehend the dimension of our sacred mission. The Egyptian people with their heritage and unique awareness of history have realized from the very beginning the meaning and value of this endeavor. In all the steps I took I was not performing a personal mission. I was merely expressing the will of a nation. I am proud of my people and of belonging to them.

title: . . .we three. . .will vigorously wage peace.
description: During the past 30 years, Isreal and Egypt have waged war. But for the past 16 months, these same two great nations have waged peace.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: MYLES WEIR READ

title: Teamsters Act to Block a Possible Strike Injunction
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  The International Brotherhood of Teamsters, saying it did not expect its wage negotiations with the trucking industry to succeed before its contract expired at midnight Saturday, took legal action today to block a TaftHartley injunction it it should go on strike then.

title: Maloney Brothers Finally Reunited by Rangers
description: It took 12 years, including their turbulent teens, but the Maloney brothers from the Ontario farm country were reunited last month as teammates on the New York Rangers.

title: Bhutto's Jailers Remove the Bed And All Comforts From His Cell
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, March 26 (UPI)  Prison officials today removed all comforts, even the bed, from the prison cell of Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, the condemned former Prime Minister.

title: Bomb Explosion Hurts 19 in an Israeli Town
description: TEL AVIV, Israel, Tuesday, March 27 (AP)  A bomb explosion injured 19 persons today in the outdoor market at Lod, 15 miles east of Tel Aviv, a police spokesman announced. Two of the in jured were in serious condition, the police said.

title: Battle Plans for Peace
description: President Carter found the right metaphor for the treaties, letters, annexes and understandings that Egypt and Israel signed at his table yesterday. They are waging peace, he said. And the United States, he might have added, has become in all but name their ally in a risky enterprise.

title: For Women, AllAmerica Status Doesn't Mean $
description: Cindy Brogdon has two asterisks next to her name on the women's allAmerica basketball team, much like an apprentice jockey with a 7pound weight allowance. She is the only player with two asterisks, which means she has been chosen for a third time as an allAmerican.

title: 5 Belgian Parties to Begin Talks
description: BRUSSELS, March 26 (Reuters) Belgium's caretaker Prime Minister, Paul vanden Boeynants, said today that five parties in his outgoing coalition would start talks tomorrow on forming a provisional government. He admitted defeat last Friday in his bid to set up a permanent administration to pass longdelayed constitutional reforms, involving splitting the country into three semiautonomous regions to end the perennial feud between French and Dutch speakers.

title: SouthWest Africans Abducted
description: WINDHOEK, SouthWest Africa, March 16 (AP)  A band of 40 guerrillas today abducted 39 girls and a woman teacher from a secondary school in Uukekete, in the northern part of the country, and marched them into Angola, officials said. The guerrillas were said to be members of an organization fighting to end South Africa's control of SouthWest Africa.

title: Trust Settlement Sought Despite F.T.C. Objection
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  Over the objection of the chairman of the Federal Trade Commission, Michael Pertschuk, the Justice Department today filed a proposed settlement of an antitrust enforcement action against ARA Services Inc. of Philadelphia, described as the largest wholesale distributor of periodicals and paperback books in the United Stats.

title: Deng Avoids Criticizing U.S. Steps on Taiwan Ties
description: HONG KONG, March 26  In a meeting today with Representative Al Ullman, Chairman of the House of Representatives Ways and Means Committee, China's senior Deputy Prime Minister, Deng Xiaoping, did not repeat Chinese criticism of House and Senate legislation on future United States relations with Taiwan.

title: World Gold
description: MONDAY, MARCH 26,1979

title: Israelis Remain Somber Despite Official Revelry
description: TEL AVIV, March 26  A fireworks display and band music beckoned Israelis to the beflagged, floodlit, windswept plaza outside City Hall tonight to celebrate the peace treaty with Egypt.

title: Ivan Black, 75, a Publicity Agent
description: Ivan Black, a press agent for Broadway and Off Broadway theaters and for many nightclubs for more than 40 years, died Sunday at the Hospital for Joint Diseases of a respiratory failure from emphysema. He was 75 years old.

title: Pennsylvania Jailers Back on Job. Massachusetts Strike Continue
description: About half the guards, at a ?? ma prison returned to wook yesterday after a oneday strike to ?? safety conditions. but a ?? continued at ?? highest ?? cunty prison.

title: U.S. Faces Major Mideast Role Of Insuring Peace Commitment
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  The United States, which played the decisive part in bringing about the peace treaty and related arrangements between Egypt and Israel, is assuming a comparable role in trying to insure that the agreements are honored.

title: . . . And Paying Doctors Bills
description: PHILADELPHIA  Why has inflation in the health sector far surpassed general inflation for the last two decades, and what can be done about it? An analogy can help provide the answer.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: West Bank Town Is Cut Off
description: HALHOUL, IsraeliOccupied West Bank, March 26  Many of the television sets in this community of 8,000 Palestinians, 15 miles south of Jerusalem, were probably tuned in tonight to the broadcast from Washington of the peace treatysigning ceremonies between Israel and Egypt.

title: Miss Bernstein, Shorn of Power,  Resigns City Job
description: Blanche Bernstein, the Human Resources Administrator, resigned yesterday rather than accept Mayor Koch's offer to let her stay in her job without power.

title: OPEC PARLEY WEIGHS NEW OIL PRICE RISES AND CUTS IN OUTPUT
description: GENEVA. March 26 Pressure for another large increase in world oil prices built up today at the opening of a meeting of oil ministers of the 13 member nations of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries.

title: White House Staff Rises to the Occasion With Dinner for 1,300
description: WASHINGTON, March 26 With the usual flourish of trumpets and glide of long black cars, the leaders of Israel and Egypt came to the White House tonight for a celebration party for 1,300 of everybody's closest friends.

title: IN THE NATION Worthy Of Contempt
description: In The New York Times roundup of Supreme Court decisions, the story made one paragraph: The Court also declined to hear an appeal by Millard Farmer .. from two convictions for criminal contempt of court.. . . Mr. Farmer had accused the judge of covering up racism in the court room.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, MARCH 27, 1979

title: About New York
description: That's not his last dutchess rising there in steel on Broome Street, looking as if she were still alive. It's Skinny Dynamite, a willowy, hardedged sculpture inspired by a woman whom Bob Bolles, a welderartist, says he once so lustily loved that he decided to memorialize her in the middle of Broome Street.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Two Discoveries May Help Treat Inherited Disease
description: BETHESDA, Md., March 26  Scientists at the National Institutes of Health here and colleagues elsewhere have made two related discoveries that may open the way treating some tragic and incurable hereditary diseases.

title: 97 Remaining Kurdish Prisoners Reportedly Freed by Iran's Army
description: TEHERAN, Iran, March 26 (AP) The 97 remaining prisoners held by the army in the Kurdish capital of Sanandaj were released today, newspapers here reported.

title: Kemp's Projected Race as Favorite Son Is Running Out of Steam
description: A move to make Representative Jack Kemp a New York State favoriteson Republican candidate for President as a means of forestalling raids on the delegation by other Presidential hopefuls is apparently foundering because of the opposition of downstate loam leaders.

title: Farming of Endangered Species Proposed
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica. March 26  The raising of rare orchids. butterflies and other endangered animals by farming them in a protected and carefully supervised environment may help stem the decline of threatened wildlife resources, according to participants in an international conference here on endangered species.

title: Control Over Benefits To Firemen Claiming Disability Is Criticized
description: A fireman twisted his knee while standing on a table in the firehouse kitchen. Another felt lower back pain when he lifted his face mask during an inspection. A third felt pain in his arm while removing a cap from a frozen hydrant.

title: Garelik Denies Juggling Data on Subway Crimes
description: A 15page rebuttal of charges that Sanford D. Garelik, chief of the transit police, had juggled subwaycrime statistics was submitted to Mayor Koch yesterday by Mr. Garelik.

title: Obituary 7  No Title
description: Death

title: A Health Plan: U.S. Still Waits
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  This is, indeed, a fitting occasion for me to announce a major decision of President Carter in the health area, Joseph A. Califano Jr., the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare. told the audience at the New York University Medical Center.

title: Dutch Arsonist Tries to Destroy Building Involved in Brothel Plan
description: ROTTERDAM, the Netherlands, March 26 (AP)  An arsonist tried to burn an unused port building that was to become the headquarters for a large floating brothel planned by city officials, the police said today.

title: Court Bars Fairchild, A.T.&T. Pleas
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  The Supreme Court refused today to intervene in two Federal investigations of alleged corporate wrongdoing.

title: . . . But Study Shows Strenuous Activity Is Not Without Hazards
description: Do the risks of strenuous exercise outweigh its potential benefits? Despite some recent reports of deaths that occurred during or shortly after activities like jogging, it is not known how many people jog without incident, making it impossible to estimate the risk. It is also not known whether the same or an even greater number of persons might have died had they not jogged.

title: In Tel Aviv, Memories of 48
description: BAGHDAD, March 26  Arab anger over the EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty cannot reverse the process for the time being, but it can do much to isolate Egypt, make it impossible for Israel to be accepted in the rest of the Middle East and seriously affect American relations in the region.

title: Investigators in Fair Lawn Murder Suggest Their Search Is Narrowing
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., March 26  Authorities investigating last week's triple homicide in Fair Lawn, N.J., suggested today that they had narrowed their search for the knifewielding assailant or assailants who slashed the throats of two women and a 5yearold boy in their home.

title: Visitors Views of China's Gains Seen as Overstated
description: Malnutrition, overpopulation and poverty may be more serious problems for China than Western visitors have been led to believe in recent years, according to an analysis by Dr. Nicholas N. Eberstadt of Harvard University's Center for Population Studies.

title: World News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, March 26 (UPI)  Attorney General Griffin Bell advised Congress today that he planned to approve the immigration of 60,000 more Soviet and Indochinese refugees during the next six months.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: After stockholders of UV Industries spurned Victor Posner's takeover bid yesterday, he may be bloodied but he is unlikely to be bowed in his determination to add to his corporate holdings. The 60yearold controversial businessman, who is chairman of the Sharon Steel Corporation and also presides over a farflung corporate empire, did not become a multimillionaire by shying away from a fight  not even a losing fight. If anything, adversity seems to stimulate his competitive juices.

title: Notes on People
description: There were more than enough opportunities to compare the New York State Legislature with a musical comedy, but almost everyone managed to resist the temptation yesterday as Broadway went on the road to Albany.

title: New York's Old and New
description: St. Mark'sintheBowery Episcopal Church, at Second Avenue and 10th Street, was receiving needed repairs yesterday after fire extensively damaged the city's 179yearold landmark July 27. Nine of the church's 23 stainedglass windows were destroyed when roof plunged 50 feet to the floor of the main sanctuary. Church, erected in 1799, began the process of rebuilding as new wooden girders were hoisted into place. Below, workman cautiously walking across girder of Hilton Hotel's Vista International New York, the first major hotel built in lower Manhattan since 1836. Executives hope to have the 825room hotel open to guests by the spring of 1980.

title: Gaeckler Resigns as Coach Of Basketball at Hofstra
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., March 26  In a surprise move, Roger Gaeckler resigned today as the Hofstra University basketball coach. The 38yearold Gaeckler gave no reasons for his resignation other than to say that he intended to go into private business.

title: Closed and OpenEnd Funds
description: WILMINGTON, Del.  All sides came for a fight. First, lawyers for a minority stockholder of the Baldwin Securities Corporation initiated a successful attempt to videotape the annual shareholders meeting. Then Lewis D. Gilbert, another activist shareholder in the closedend investment company, very cordially disagreed with Baldwin's executives over the color of the ballots.

title: Surgeon General Visiting Cuba
description: HAVANA, March 26 (Reuters)  Surgeon General Julius Richmond has begun a fiveday visit here at the invitation of the Cuban Public Health Ministry. Dr. Richmond will visit hospitals and clinics here and discuss with Cuban officials the possibility of importing medicine from the United States.

title: Military Analysis Treaty Opens the Door To New Power Balance
description: A new power structure in the Middle East could evolve from the IsraeliEgyptian peace treaty, in which Israel and a rearmed Egypt, both supported by expanded United States military involvement and arms deliveries, would more than balance Syria, Iran and Libya, the principal Soviet clients, and the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: Rabb Out as TV Director Of KaufmanHart Play
description: LOS ANGELES, March 26  I look on television as an art form, CBS looks on it as an industry, Ellis Rabb said in describing why he suddenly withdrew as director of the television version of the George S. KaufmanMoss Hart play You Can't Take It With You.

title: Horner Reports to Braves, Awaits Arbitrator's Ruling
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., March 26 (AP)  Bob Horner, the National League rookie of the year last season, said tonight he would abide by an arbitrator's decision in his contract dispute with the Atlanta Braves, win, lose or draw. His case is scheduled in May.

title: Sutton Pitches TwoHitter
description: VERO BEACH, Fla., March 26 (AP)  Don Sutton pitched a twohitter today and became the first Los Angeles pitcher to go the distance as the Dodgers beat the Minnesota Twins, 20. Sutton retired the first 15 batters before walking Butch Wynegar and then giving up a clean single to Bobby Randall. Roy Smalley had the other hit in the ninth.

title: TOM COSTIGAN DIES
description: Tom Costigan, who had been on leave since August as chief of public affairs for the Justice Department's Drug Enforcement Administration, died Saturday at his home in La Jolla, Calif. He was 63 years old and had moved to La Jolla from Washington last November.

title: Atomic Plant Moratorium Urged
description: TORONTO, March 26 (AP)  The United States National Wildlife Federation called yesterday for a moratorium on the licensing of nuclear power plants in the United States. At a convention herewith the Canadian Wildlife Federation, the American organization adopted a resolution urging President Carter and Congress to stop the authorization and construction of nuclearpowered generators until such time as the health, safety, waste disposal and economic viability have been resolved to the satisfaction of the Congress of the United States.

title: New North Sea Oil Licenses
description: LONDON, March 26 (Reuters) The British Government today opened extensive new areas of the North Sea to oil exploration, awarding 42 offshore licenses to oil and gas companies.

title: Mets Win, Still Wait For a Trade
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 26 The New York Mets ended their fivegame springtraining slide today with a 73 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays. But the Mets were still searching for ways to end the fiveyear slide that had made them a collapsed club.

title: Treaty Impact Still Unknown
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  The elusive, unprecedented peace treaty. that Egypt and Israel signed today has enormous symbolic importance and the potential for fundamentally transforming the map and history of an entire region, but the agreement faces an uncertain future.

title: Obituary 8  No Title
description: Deaths

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: Special to the New York Time

title: Appellate Panel Voids 5Acre Home Zoning In Wealthy L.I. Town
description: UPPER BROOKVILLE, L.I., March 26 Fiveacre residential zoning in this wealthy village on the North Shore of Long Island was declared unconstitutional today by a tourjudge panel of the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn.

title: Columbia Struck by 420 Workers
description: About 420 cafeteria, library, clerical and other employees went on strike against Columbia University yesterday in a dispute over wages, pensions and other items. The walkout caused inconveniences and service disruptions, such as the shutdown of two of four cafeterias on the Morningside Heights campus, and curtailed access to library shelves. Classes were not affected.

title: Highlights From the Treaty
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  Following are highlights of the peace treaty between Egypt and Israel signed today:

title: Computer Analyst Sentenced to 8 Years in Bank Theft
description: LOS ANGELES, March 26  Stanley Mark Rifkin, a 33yearold computer analyst who admitted stealing $10.2 million from a Los Angeles bank by transferring the money with a computer, was sentenced to eight years in prison today.

title: Text of Camp David Framework Accord
description: The search for peace in the Middle East must be guided by the following: ??The agreed basis for a peaceful settlement of the conflict between Israel and its neighbors is United Nations Security Council Resolution 242, in all its parts.

title: Capital Voting Rights Amendment Runs Into Trouble
description: WASHINGTON, March 26  Despite ratification of a proposed District of Columbia voting rights amendment in Massachusetts and Minnesota last week, supporters of the measure concede that they still face tough opposition in their effort to winthe approval of 38 states necessary to ratify the amendment by 1985.

title: KANSAS CITY VOTES FOR A MAYOR TODAY
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., March 26  After a spirited campaign that has focused more on personalities and style than on substantive issues, the city's voters will go to the polls tomorrow to elect either its first black Mayor or its first Republican Mayor since the 1920's.

title: At Milan Showings, a Revival of Gentler Clothes
description: MILAN, Italy, March 26  The stage was trans formed into a giant mockup of a television screen. Gianni Versace's mannequins danced through it in their full ballerina skirts, ruffled petticoats, cinched waistlines and flatheeled shoes, all

title: China Leadership Believed Embroiled in a Dispute Over Economic Policy
description: HONG KONG, March 26  There are increasing signs of a major political debate in Peking, analysts here believe, with several Communist Party leaders reportedly under attack and uncertainty over the direction of economic policy.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: ANTONI BROSA

title: A Historic Moment Puts Color in the New York Sky
description: At sunset yesterday the Empire State Building glowed with the colors of the two nations that signed the peace treaty  blue and white for Israel, red and white for Egypt. But New Yorkers seemed to react with guarded hopes to the signing ceremony in Washington.

title: Dollar Falls in Europe On Fears of OPEC Rise
description: BONN, March 26  The dollar declined on foreignexchange markets today, its recent stability undercut by reports that the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, now meeting in Geneva, might raise prices further.

title: SixMonth Bills Off at Treasury
description: Yields on the Treasury's sixmonth bills declined slightly yesterday in the weekly auction while the threemonth bills were unchanged at 9.498 percent from the preceding week.

title: For Subways, Music to Allay Fears
description: A crowd gathered on the Columbus Circle platform of the IND subway Monday night to listen the rattling of gourds, accompanied by clay whistles, harmonicas and plastic horns, in a subterranean concert by about a dozen musicians from A Performance Workshop.

title: The City
