description: Negotiators for striking milk drivers and dairy plant workers made a new proposal yesterday to metropolitan milk dealers. at the first Joint bargaining session since March 7. Irving wisch chief negotiator for the employ. ers group, said the proposal dealt with only one issue in the impasse. now in its fifth week. The latest discussions were reported to have centered on work restrictions that the dealers say have led to excessive operating costs.

title: Dollar Up in New York
description: The dollar closed higher against the yen in New York yesterday, rising to 207.21 yen at the close from 207.17 the day before.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: The basic price of crude oil was raised 9 percent by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, meeting in Geneva. OPEC also said individual members would be free to add surcharges to the basic price, and at least five members immediately announced additional charges ranging from $1.20 to $4 a barrel: The decision was strongly opposed by Saudi Arabia, which warned that a pricing freeforall might result from the surcharges if the current tight supply situation for oil continued. Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yamani, Saudi Arabia's oil minister, called on industrialized countries to curtail their oil consumption or face further price increases. [Page A1.]

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Loans Are Considered Sound
description: The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, currently a focus of controversy in Congress, is likely to double its capital to $80 billion from $40 billion by the early 1980's to facilitate growth in its loan program of about 12 percent a year, according to Eugene Rotberg, vice president and treasurer of the institution.

title: Sadat Asks Joint Ruling Council And No Divisions for Jerusalem
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (Reuters) President Anwar elSadat of Egypt said today that Jerusalem should be ruled by a combined council of Israelis and Arabs and should never be divided again.

title: Dance: Louis Falco Company Opens
description: JUST when it looked a bit glum for an opening by the Louis Falco Dance Company last night at the City Center 55th Street Dance Theater, Mr. Falco jolted the audience awake with a slightly zany new piece to Italian songs of the people  songs mostly sad but sometimes happy.

title: FreeforAll Or Stability?; Analysts of Oil Industry Differ on World Outlook Seasonal Slump Cited FreeforAll or Stability? Analysts Outlooks Differ Question of Production Rationing Need to Rebuild Inventories
description: For oil economists in the United States, it was not the $1.20abarrel price rise imposed yesterday by the Organization of Petroleum Countries that was disturbing; it was the announcement that all OPEC members were now free to add any premiums which they deem justifiable in the light of their own circumstances, as the official statement from Geneva put it.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Most commodity futures prices drifted lower yesterday as trendsetting silver prices declined on a smallerthanexpected oilprice increase by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries.

title: Guests at the State Dinner Wore Ethnic and Political Ties
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  The 1,300 guests invited to last night's state dinner celebrating the EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty were selected by members of the White House staff to reward political supporters, court the uncommitted, romance the media and strengthen the President's ties to the American Jewish community, White House aides said today.

title: TV Film Links Mob in Toronto To Atlantic City
description: TORONTO, March 27  Millions of dollars in underworld money is being funneled through Toronto into realestate investments in Atlantic City, according to an unusual television documentary broadcast tonight by the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation.

title: Panel Rejects Gov. Grasso Choice for School Board
description: HARTFORD, March 27  A General Assembly legislative committee voted 8 to 3 today to oppose Gov. Ella T. Grasso's nomination to the Connecticut State Board of Education of Eva Hudak, a 62yearold state bail commissioner who dropped out of school at the age of 14 and recently passed a highschool equivalency test.

title: Text of OPEC Conference Statement
description: GENEVA, March 27 (Reuters) Following is the text of the closing statement issued in English today by the conference here of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries:

title: MORTON SUSSMAN, 47, A FASHION DESIGNER
description: Morton Sussman, designer of Mollie Parnis fashions, died Monday at the Mount Sinai Hospital after a long illness. He was 47 years old and lived at 156 East 65th Street in Manhattan.

title: Finding Out Legal Rent
description: A tenant who wants to know the legal rent on his apartment should first ask his landlord to show him the previous tenant's lease.

title: What the Grass Roots Say to Albany
description: ALBANY, March 27They come here by the busload, soldiers in a war of influence, armed with position papers, catchy slogans and their emotiors. They roam the halls of the Capitol seeking legislators who are for them, against them or on the fence.

title: Inflation Erodes Welfare, Too
description: Although Governor Carey has pledged to keep alive New York's tradition of meeting human need, he has been silent on the plight of people living on welfare. Their grants have not increased in more than three years. Simple justice suggests that no one can survive in 1979 on the same number of dollars that barely matched the official poverty level in 1975. The Governor should urge an amendment to his 1980 budget, authorizing an increase in the basic living allotment for all welfare recipients.

title: Guilty Plea in Kassofa Slaying
description: Willis Jackson, 21 years old, of 444 Second Avenue, pleaded guilty to manslaughter in State Supreme Court in Manhattan yesterday in connection with the stabbing death of Harry Kassofa, 68. Mr. Kasoffa was murdered in his apartment in the Sovereign, a luxury apartment building at 425 East 58th Street on Nov. 12, on. Acting Justice Harold J. Rothwax set May 8 for sentencing. Mr. Jackson had testified against Sean Ryan, 20, of 305 East 56th Street, who was convicted of murdering Mr. Kassofa last Monday by a Jury. Acting Justice Betty W. Ellerin set May 18 for sentencing in that case. Assistant District Attorney Thomas A. Demakos said both men had robbed Mr. Kassofa's apartment after Mr. Jackson had stabbed him.

title: Court Backs Bank Credit To Iran
description: A State Supreme Court justice in Manhattan refused yesterday to interfere in any demand for payment to the present Government of Iran of $143 million held by two New York banks.

title: Market Place
description: MANY investors have given up on hightechnology stocks on the theory that current dividends provided by oldline companies are more attractive than longterm growth.

title: Music: Philadelphians
description: THERE were three familiarities and one unfamiliarity on the Philadelphia Orchestra's program last night at Carnegie Hall. This is the normal pattern for American symphony programs, and generally one devotes one's principal attention to the unfamiliarity. Its very novelty makes news, and often the orchestra has spent more time polishing it than it has lavished on the rest of the bill.

title: G.O.P. Councilman Elected Mayor in Kansas City
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., March 27  Richard L. Berkley defeated Bruce R. Watkins tonight as voters in this Democratic stronghold elected their first Republican mayor since the 1920's.

title: Bustop Shelters Makes New Bid To City Agency
description: In another effort to retain its busshelter contract in New York City, Bustop Shelters Inc. yesterday offered to pay the city 20 percent of revenues if it were permitted to maintain title to its 500 shelters until anew franchise is awarded.

title: Planners Get Look at New York Area
description: They came from such places as Dallas and Minneapolis, from Chicago, Detroit and Pittsburgh. from San Francisco and Washington, business leaders and urban planners, and for two days, Monday and yesterday, they were bused to the physical extremes of the metropolitan region. They rode from the ruins of the South Bronx to the highrises of Stamford, from Newark, clawing itself upward, to White Plains, blooming with commercial expansion.

title: Blazers Are Victors Over Knicks, 123112
description: PORTLAND, Ore., March 27 (AP) Mychal Thompson and Maurice Lucas combined for 56 points and 24 rebounds tonight to power the Portland Trail Blazers to a 123112 National Basketball Association victory over the New York Knicks.

title: Companies Report Earnings
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (0) overtheCounter.

title: Gasoline May Rise 2 a Gallon
description: GENEVA, March 27 (AP)  The 9 percent increase in the base price of crude oil decided upon today by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries could raise the retail price of gasoline in the United States about 2 cents a gallon.

title: Brezhnev, Reported Sick Again, Abruptly Cancels Visit of Giscard
description: MOSCOW, March 27  The Soviet Union announced today that President Valery Giscard d'Estaing of France would not visit Moscow on Thursday as scheduled, but three weeks later, apparently because of the poor health of Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader.

title: Cauthen Is Still Awaiting Work Permit for Britain
description: LONDON, March 27 (AP)  Steve Cauthen, the American jockey, who plans to ride in England this year, has not yet been granted a British work permit.

title: Beacon Theater to Hold Festival of Russian Dance
description: Ninety folk dancers and musicians from the Soviet Union will appear at the Beacon Theater in A Festival of Russian Dance, from April 9 through April 15. Folk ensembles from Byelorussia, Uzbek, Lithuania, the Ukraine, Moldavia and Georgia will perform their traditional dances as well as contemporary choreography based on traditional dance.

title: HIGH COURT DECIDES POLICE CAN'T CHECK DRIVERS AT RANDOM
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  The Supreme Court ruled today, 8 to 1, that the police cannot constitutionally stop a motorist at random to check his license and registration unless there is some reason to believe that the motorist is violating a law.

title: Careers
description: THE news is bad for liberal arts majors. The University of Wisconsin recently commented that by the year 2000 English majors might be nearly as rare as entomologists. The nanon: Liberal arts majors have a difficult time finding jobs upon graduation.

title: Israeli Peace Movement, Outflanked by Begin, Regroups
description: JERUSALEM, March 27  In Ms speech at the treatysigning ceremony in Washington yesterday, President Anwar elSadat of Egypt paid homage to the peace movement in Israel and called on its followers to continue their efforts as diplomatic negotiations proceed.

title: McGillicuddy: Change in Style
description: A change in tone and style but no abrupt shifts in basic policy are expected at. the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company after 48yearold John F. McGillicuddy takes over as chairman of the nation's fourthlargest bank next Monday.

title: Q&A
description: Q. When I cook spaghetti or maca roni, nine times out of 10 the strands or pieces stick together and don't come unglued when the spaghetti is tossed with sauce. How can I avoid this? 1 have tried to add oil to my cooking water, but it doesn't help.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Stokely, Coke Talks
description: StokelyVan Camp Inc., a leading food processor, is holding discussions for a possible acquisition of the CocaCola Bottling Company of Louisville, Ky., involving a cash transaction approximating $23 million, top officers of both companies disclosed.

title: Meadowlands: Get the NC.A.A.
description: SALT LAKE CITY. March 27 When the game ended, no polls were necessary to determine the nation's best college basketball team. Michigan State had won, 7564, from Indiana State and, quite simply, this is why the National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball championship is our most compelling college event.

title: MAO'S IDEAS ON WAR ARE LOSING GROUND
description: HONG KONG, March 27  China's army newspaper, the Liberation Army Daily, said today that the recent border war with Vietnam had helped clear away some erroneous ideas, apparently including the primacy Peking has long attached to Mao Zedong's doctrine of guerrilla warfare.

title: Wine Talk
description: THE fourth annual California Vintner's Barrel Tasting dinner was held Monday night at The Four Seasons restaurant, and 225 wine makers, sellers, writers and hangerson, the lot of them culled from 2,000 eager petitioners for the available seats, subjected themselves happily to five hours of eating, tasting and gossip.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, MARCH 28, 1979

title: Jersey Most Wanted List Issued
description: TRENTON, March 27  Going the Federal Bureau of Investigation two better, the Superintendent of the New Jersey state police, Col. Clinton L. Pagano, announced today a list of the 12 most wantedfugitives from New Jersey justice.

title: Der Bomber Is Invading American Soccer
description: Soccer's kind of bomber made his way quickly and quietly through the streets of New York last week. Gerd Midler. one of the most prolific goalscorers in the sport's history, known in his native West Germany as Der Bomber. spent 24 hours in the city. That was long enough to take a look at the sights he wanted to see  the Brooklyn Bridge, the Empire State Building, Central Park and Studio 54, where he passed a few hours.

title: Cooking Instructors Turn Talents to Food for Diabetics
description: Foodloving diabetics who are frustrated by their dietary restrictions may find a ray of cheer in a new series of cooking classes designed especially for their needs. Sponsored by the Hope for Diabetics Foundation Inc., the five weekly classes beginning April 19 will feature recipes specifically adapted to the nosugar, lowfat and lowcarbohydrate restrictions of the diabetic's diet. Unlike most dietary recipes, which all too often have a clinical dullness about them, those presented during this course are all authentic and enticing, as they were developed by four of the city's most highly respected cooking instructors, who will also teach the classes.

title: Louisiana Mortgage Issue Sold
description: The New Orleans Home Mortgage Authority yesterday sold $85 million of highgrade revenue bonds that yielded as much as 7.25 percent as the flow of taxexempt bond financing for singlefamily housing continued to flood the market.

title: 500 Gravestones in Queens Toppled in Latest Outbreak
description: There were row after row of gravestones  and they were knocked over, lying flat, more than 500 of them, under a chill sun yesterday at Mount Hebron Cemetery in Flushing, Queens.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS
description: BONN, March 27  The dollar rose against most major currencies in foreignexchange trading in Tokyo and Europe today, as a price increase by members of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries turned out to be less than expected.

title: Equality for Women Pressed at Rabbis' Convention
description: PHOENIX, March 27  Support for women's equality in both religious and political life was sounded today by activists at the annual convention of the Central Conference of American Rabbis, the liberal rabbinic branch of Judaism.

title: Baryshnikov Will Dance At Taylor Troupe Benefit
description: Mikhail Baryshnikov will appear in a single performance with the Paul Taylor Dance Company at the City Center 55th Street Theater on April 17 in a benefit for the company on the opening night of its twoweek spring season, which will run through April 29.

title: Everett V. Stonequist, 77, Author
description: Everett V. Stonequist, professor emeritus of sociology at Skidmore College and author of a number of works on race relations, died of a heart attack at Glens Falls (N.Y.) Hospital last Thursday. He was 77 years old and lived in Saratoga Springs.

title: 3 Held After Protest in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, March 27 (UPI)  Three ethnic Germans who have been trying to emigrate to West Germany were arrested today when they displayed protest slogans briefly in Red Square, dissident sources said. The sources said that Frieda Pletschko, 39 years old, and her sons, Paul, 16, and Arthur, 14, opened their overcoats at noon, displaying protest slogans painted on their clothes. They were quickly seized by plainclothes men.

title: Exploring The Mystery Of Creativity
description: THE preschool years are often described as a golden age of creativity, a time when every child sparkles with artistry. As those years pass, however, it seems that a kind of corruption takes over, so that ultimately most of us mature into artistically stunted adults. When we try to understand the development of creativity  asking why some people finally emerge as artists, while the vast majority do not the evidence for some corrupting force is persuasive, at least on the surface.

title: 3 ExOfficers of Franklin National Get Jail Terms for Concealing Loss
description: Harold V. Gleason, the former board chairman of the Franklin National Bank, was sentenced to three years in prison yesterday for his role in concealing the bank's loss of millions of dollars before it was declared insolvent in 1974.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: ONE of the false conclusions assumed by thousands of amateur cooks is that the preparation time for any given recipe is in exact ratio to the number of ingredients it contains. It is an unfortunate conclusion and a pity, for you cannot equate the length of time to make a dish with what are known in the newspaper field as column inches. To choose an obvious example, many dishes in Indian cookery may call for as many as a dozen or more dried spices, most of which will come in jars with screw tops. Their use simply involves going to a pantry shelf, collecting the spices and measuring out the amounts required. It is an act that can be performed in minutes.

title: 2 TeenAge Girls Held in Murder
description: Two teenage girls, one of them a juvenile, were charged yesterday in the murder of a 47yearold Bronx man two weeks ago. The police alleged that the girls were part of a group of nine youths who tortured and then killed the man. The seven other members of the group, all males, are still being sought, the police said.

title: U.S. CRITICAL OF MOVE
description: GENEVA, March 27  The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries raised the basic price of crude oil by 9 percent today and said individual members would be allowed to impose whatever surcharges above that level they felt were necessary.

title: Revisions of Public TV, Radio Gain
description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting, threatened with extinction by two legislative proposals, has laid the groundwork for an internal reorganization to avoid Congressional action aimed at reforming the system of noncommercial television and radio.

title: Despite Rental Laws, Landlords Overcharge
description: In February, when Carol and Eugene Holman lived in apartment 9A at 9 East 96th Street, the rent was $750 a month. But on March 15, when a new tenant moved in, it became $1,500.

title: Around the Nation
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 27 (AP) The Federal appeals court in New Orleans has ordered dismissal of a $5 million damage suit filed by the late Clay Shaw against Jim Garrison and 50 wealthy men.

title: Personal Health
description: AMERICANS, including American physicians, tend to think of intestinal parasites as problems of poor people living in underdeveloped, tropical countries. And, indeed, this is where such parasites most corpmonly cause illness and death.

title: John Meston, 64, Script Writer Who Created Gunsmoke for TV
description: TARZANA, Calif., March 27 (UPI)John Meston, the script writer who was credited with being the creator of the television show Gunsrnoke, died of cerebral hemorrhage Saturday. He was 64 years old.

title: Administration Calls Oil Rise Untimely
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  The Carter Administration called the increase in crude oil prices announced in Geneva today by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries untimely and unjustified but appeared to view the move with relative calm.

title: Hauge's Contacts Span the Globe
description: When Gabriel Hauge steps down Monday as chairman of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, it will mark the end of an era for the nation's fourthlargest bank.

title: Garelik Reports 40% Drop in Subway Crime in Week
description: Sanford D. Garelik, chief of the New York city transit police, told Mayor Koch yesterday that the city's drive on subway crime had cut the number of felonies in the transit system by nearly 40 percent in its first week of operation.

title: Soviet Reports Severe Flooding In Southern Area of Byelorussia
description: LONDON, March 27 (Reuters)  Serious flooding has swept the south of the Soviet republic of Byelorussia after several rivers burst their banks, the Moscow radio reported today.

title: Books of The Times
description: A FEW weeks ago, to celebrate the centennial of Albert Einstein's birth, I performed my periodic wrestling match with the theories of relativity, and as usual lost. As usual too, succor was rushed to me by the goodhearted, wellmeaning, and mare intelligent than I. mostly in the form of pages of mathematical formulas and advice to go back to read Einstein himself.

title: Private Lives
description: THIS is the way it usually works with men: We meet in the infantry trench or the locker room or the box seat or the saloon. We talk about politics, money, sports, sex and other abstractions. (My impression is that these days we aren't talking as much about sex as we used to, but I am often wrong.) We seldom talk about our children unless they are triumphant or cute, and if we ever talk about ourselves, we will probably lie; to admit to an existential funk would be unmanly. Inside the abstractions, however, we are warm and safe. Someone  I can't remember who  once said that friendship is like two clocks keeping time. I agree.

title: Beene, Armani, Basile Scoring High Marks in Milan
description: MILAN, March 27 What has been virtually ignored fashion's current round of replays is the flowering of American sportswear in the 1940's. That's when Elizabeth Hawes, Claire McCardell and a host of other designers decided it was woman's inalienable right to look and feel comfortable in her clothes.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: Death

title: Wright Patman's Widow Dies
description: TEXARKANA, Tex., March 27 (AP)Mrs. Pauline Tucker Patman, the widow of former Representative Wright Patman of Texas, died here Sunday after an illness. She was 81 years old.

title: Justice Dept. Seeks Dismissal of Sears JobRights Suit
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  Charging that Sears, Roebuck & Company had filed a political essay, not a lawsuit, the Justice Department has asked the Federal courts to dismiss the retailer's recent complaint against the Government's equalemployment programs.

title: Real Estate
description: HOBOKEN, N.J. Two surprises await the visitor who strolls along Hudson Street in Hoboken for the first time after a long absence. One is that a large, new redbrick building is under construction there. The other is that the building looks like something out of the Italian Renaissance.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, MARCH 27, 1979

title: Economic Scene
description: REPORTERS working in Communist countries learn to pay close attention to jokes as evidence of the populace's current anxieties and discontents. It is the same under capitalism. Consider, for example, the following story making the rounds in business circles these days:

title: Chess:
description: Everyone knows what an important ingredient for success versatility is, yet in practice almost everyone stresses some aspects of play to the detriment of others.

title: Carey Ending OutofState Schooling for the Disabled
description: ALBANY, March 27  In a move to ward providing services within New York State for all of its disabled children, Governor Carey has directed the Department of Social Services to end as of April 1, 1980, its policy of sending hundreds of mentally retarded and handicapped children outside the state for education and treatment.

title: Citicorp Note Rate Down
description: The rate on Citicorp's threemonth notes sold every Tuesday dropped below 10 percent yesterday for the first time since October, the bank reported. The average rate fell to 9.984 percent, down from 10.147 percent a week ago and well below the 11.102 percent peak rate the bankholding company accepted last Dec. 26. In the sale, $596.5 million of bids were made at rates ranging from 9.969 percent to 9.990 percent.

title: Turkomans Battle Iranian Forces in New Outbreak of Tribal Separatism
description: The fighting near the Soviet border was the second outburst of ethnic and tribal separatism within a week threatening the unity of Iran's provisional Government. Kurdish tribesmen besieged an army barracks in the city of Sanandaj last week in three days of bloody fighting before a ceasefire agreement was worked out.

title: A CrossCountry Skier's Uphill Struggle
description: LAST year, my husband was up in a place called Harpefoss, in the Peer Gynt country, about 160 miles north of Oslo, and he was introduced to something called crosscountry skiing. He actually had the skis on his feet on two occasions, and because he didn't immediately kill himself, he became madly enamored of the sport.

title: Concessions in West Bank and Gaza Pledged  Begin and Sadat Hailed on Capitol Hill
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  President Carter informed Egypt today that Israel had agreed to take steps to improve political conditions for Palestinians in the occupied West Hank of the Jordan and the Gaza Strip. The goal would be to persuade them to participate in negotiations on Palestinian autonomy.

title: Maryland Gadfly Lawyer Faces Challenge From Establishment
description: BALTIMORE, March 25  When Francis B. Burch, the former Attorney General of Maryland, decided to seek the Democratic nomination for Governor last year, he petitioned the circuit court here to change his name for the ballot.

title: U.S. Defeated In Land Case
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  The Supreme Court today ruled, 8 to 0, that the Federal Government did not have an implied right to build a road across land it granted to the Union Pacific Railroad in 1862.

title: AntiCastro Cubans in Jersey Say Officials Ignore Terrorists Threats
description: As Federal investigations continued into bomb explosions Sunday night at Kennedy International Airport and at two sites in North Jersey, spokesmen for antiCastro Cubans in New Jersey contended yesterday that their warnings of terrorist threats had long gone ignored.

title: Russians Lending a Da Vinci to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  Leonardo da Vinci's Madonna With Flower, one of the greatest paintings in The Hermitage collection in Leningrad, will be shown for the first time in the United States at the National Gallery of Art here and later in New York, it was announced today.

title: American Brands Dividend
description: Directors of American Brands Inc., the diversified tobacco producer, yesterday increased the quarterly dividend on the common stock from $1 to $1.12 a share, payable June 1 to holders of record May 10. It represents the fifth increase since.1976, Robert/C. ??

title: Yanks Unperturbed By 514 Spring Mark
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 27  You can get to the point where you're too far back, Reggie Jackson was saying today, remembering the New York Yankees renown in the art of brinkmanship. But nobody's going to get 14 games in front of anybody this year.

title: Carey and Legislators Work Out SchoolAid Rise Plan
description: ALBANY, March 27  Governor Carey and legislative leaders tentatively agreed tonight to increase state aid for education by $185 million next year and revenuesharing to local governments by $80 million, tied to a formula that would slow the growth of revenuesharing aid in the future.

title: Tanzania Reports Threat by Libyans to Declare War
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 27  President Julius Nyerere of Tanzania said today that Libya has threatened to declare war on Tanzania if Tanzanian troops were not withdrawn from Uganda within 24 hours. He said he had rejected the ultimatum.

title: Technology King Cotton's Renaissance?
description: FOR a quarter of a century King Cotton's share of the total market for fabrics has been shrinking to 30 percent from SO percent. During much of this time researchers have been looking for chemical treatment that would give allcotton fabrics the same desirable durablepress characteristics that have made the cottonpolyester blends so popular. Although allcotton fabrics are far more comfortable to wear, the blends have held sway the apparel marketplace.

title: Indigestible Miseries Of Family Mealtime
description: JUST like my friends. I used to be a good cook. Once I made boeuf a la mode en gelee. actually preparing jellied stock from a calls foot I bought on East 10th Street. I used to know places like that. It was a very tiny Italian meat market and the butcher sold only organ meats and calves feet.

title: Canadiens Beat Flames As Lafleur, Shutt Excel
description: ATLANTA, March 27 (AP)  Steve Shutt had two goals and Guy Lafleur had a goal and three assists tonight as the Montreal Canadiens scored on their first four shots and handed the Atlanta Flames a 64 defeat in National Hockey League action.

title: Klein Criticizes Leader Over Job
description: The Suffolk County Executive, John V. N. Klein, declared yesterday that a close political ally was dead wrong when he was hired  apparently for his political influence  by two companies doing business with the county.

title: American Can Going Into South Korea
description: A 40 percent ?? in a major South Korean can manufacturer has been acquired by the American Can Company. Frank J. Connor, senior vice presidentinternational for American Can, said the cost included cash and other considerations worth more than $7 million for the shares in Hanil Can Company of ??

title: Money Market Funds Expand
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (UPI)Net assets of mutual funds rose 1 3 percent last month to a record $60.6 billion, mainly because of a surge in the assets of money market funds.

title: News of the Theater My Old Friends Heads for Broadway
description: PEOPLE seemed to listen sympathetically, but not seriously, when Philip Rose predicted months ago that My Old Friends, the musical about a spirited group of socalled senior citizens, would go to Broadway this season. Mr. Rose first directed this show as a workshop Off Off Broadway, at La Mama, last November and again in January, when it moved Off Broadway to the Orpheum, on Second Avenue.

title: I.L.G.W.U. Contract Talks Open
description: Local 2325 of the International Ladies Garment Workers Union asked for a substantial wage increase and larger employer contributions to pension and welfare funds at the opening of negotiations yesterday with employers in the blouse, skirt and sportswear field. Jay Mazur, manager of the local, which represents24,000 workers in 900 concerns in New York City, said the union was also seeking two additional holidays. a fourth vacation week and was asking the employersto assume full responsibility for disability benefits. The current cont racts expire May 31.

title: Senate Instructs Key Panels To Offer Balanced Budgets
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  After four days of sometimes intense debate on deficit financing, the Senate responded to the growing demand for a tighter rein on spending by instructing Congressional budget committees today to report balanced budgets for the fiscal years 1981 and 1982.

title: Letters; Why New York Subways Breed Crime; Oh Jimmy, What Hast Thou Wrought? Citizens Without Arms Dr. Mengele's New Victims; ID Positive Weapons for Peace The Perils of a BudgetBalancing Amendment In Iran, a Balance of Hopeful Signs
description: To the Editor:

title: Mutilated Victim Identified
description: ROCHESTER, March 27 (AP)  The bound body of a 19yearold Rochester woman found yesterday in suburban Gates was mutilated in an attempt by the killer to hinder identification, authorities said today. But they said the victim, Marie Dwyer Schneeberger, was identified by a small tattoo on her left shoulder.

title: Mrs. English, a Byrne Aide, 1 of 4 Reportedly in Line for U.S. Court
description: TRENTON, March 27 Jerry English, a legislative counsel to Governor Byrne and a Commissioner of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, was reported today to be in line for one of four vacant Federal District Court seats in New Jersey.

title: In Yemen, Chance of Peace Seems Slim
description: SANA. Yemen, March 27The leaders of Yemen and Southern Yemen are to meet tomorrow to discuss unification, a month after the outbreak of a short, sharp border war that threatened for a time to turn this comer of the Arabian Peninusla into the latest focal point of, conflict between East and West.

title: Black Panther Leader Is To Be Tried Again In Prostitute's Slaying
description: OAKLAND, Calif., March 27 Huey P. Newton, the Black Panther leader whose recent murder trial ended with a jury divided 10 to 2 for acquittal, was notified today that he would be tried again, beginning May 7.

title: Western Europe Wary In Supporting the Treaty
description: PARIS. March 27  Although public I statements have been carefully reticent, America's European allies are quietly endorsing President Carter's success in bringing about an IsraeliEgyptian peace treaty, and more openly emphasizing that this step must be followed by moves toward a broader settlement.

title: Best Buys
description: GENERIC, or unbranded, grocery items have been on the market nearly two years now, and by most accounts are expected to remain a popular alternative to brandname products throughout much of the country. Recently, Progressive Grocer magazine surveyed 595 shoppers in one East Coast store. Of those interviewed over a threeweek period, 52 percent said they bought the generally lowerpriced generics at one time or another, and many of them liked the generic products enough to buy them routinely.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: THE logistics of traversing crowded midtown sidewalks during lunchtime are multiplied a hundredfold by the advent of rain, writes Marie Whiteside. Suddenly, umbrellas bristle from every hand, threatening serious injury to the unalert passerby. Recently, I witnessed the following encounter on one such rainy afternoon.

title: Voting Blocked in Houston and Dallas Over Rights
description: HOUSTON, March 27  As an unusual consequence of efforts to enforce the Federal Voting Rights Act, municipal voting in Houston and Dallas, the nation's fifth and seventh largest cities, has been suspended until further notice.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: At the close of World War II, Wendell Willkie had found in Asia and Africa an inexhaustible reservoir of good will for the United States. With good reason: America was our historical model. Few Americans read Torn Paine's Common Sense as early or as avidly as did my grandfather's generation, father's and mine. As a schoolboy in British India, my first political act had been to substitute the phrase American rebellion for the War of American Independence in the history reading class.

title: Bethlehem Lifts Steel Prices 3.5%
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation, the nation's secondlargest steelmaker, announced yesterday its third price increase of the year. Bethlehem said it would raise the price of heavy steels, which are used to build plants and equipment, by 3.5 percent, effective May 13.

title: Credit Cards Pose Snag In Sale by Bankers Trust
description: TORONTO, March 27 (Reuters)Negotiations over the Bank of Montreal's intention to buy 89 branches of the Bankers Trust Company in New York have run into problems over whether or not credit card operations will be part of the deal, the Montreal bank said today.

title: 2 Americans Report Intimidation By Greek Cypriots on Airline Plan
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, March 27  Two Americans have complained to the United States Embassy here about threats and intimidation by the Greek Cypriot authorities because of their role in setting up an airline in the Turkish sector of Cyprus.

title: Promoters to Refund Fees to Contestants In State Beauty Fete
description: Citing deceptive and misleading advertising and promotion for the Miss New York State contest, leading to the Miss Universe pageant, the New York State Attorney General's office yesterday announced an agreement to reimburse losers who were materially misled.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LOS ANGELES, March 27 (AP) Stan Morrison was named head basketball coach at the University of Southern California today, succeeding Bob Boyd. who announced his resignation last January.

title: Notes on People
description: For many people, the Salvation Army means clothing drives and outdoor caroling at Christmastime. But behind the popular image is a large organization that marshals $300 million a year in this country alone in a mixture of oldtime religion and social work. We recognized from the very beginning of our work that you can't preach to a man on an empty stomach, said Commissioner Ernest Holz, the army's new national commander.

title: Horse's Mistaken Identity Is Subject of Damage Suit
description: The New York Racing and Wagering Board, the New York Racing Association and The Jockey Club have been named codefendants in a $150,000 damage suit filed in Supreme Court, New York County, on behalf of a Queens construction man, Joseph Parisi.

title: 3 Lawyers and Auditor Hired for Carter Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (AP)  Paul J. Curran, the special counsel heading an investigation into President Carter's family peanut business, announced today the appointment of three lawyers and an accountant to help him conduct the inquiry.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TALK TALK TALK What's new in medicine? Dr. Rosalyn S. Yalow, who shared the 1978 Nobel Prize in medicine, will discuss new developments in the science of treating disease. She opens a Wednesday morning New Ideas series at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A., at Lexington Avenue. Lectures on the next two Wednesdays complete the series: Computers, an Industrial Revolution, by Dr. Herman Goldstein, and First Amendment, by Floyd Abrams.

title: Treasury Official Defends World Bank
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  A highranking Treasury official defended the record of the World Bank and its sister international lending agencies today against Congressional criticisms that they are deficient in public accountability, excessively generous with their officers and not demonstrably successful in reaching the poorest of the poor in the third world.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: For the second time in a week, the Treasury put off a multibilliondollar borrowing yesterday because Congress had failed to raise the temporary ceiling on the national debt. A $3.34 billion sale of 52week bills scheduled for this afternoon was postponed, and the Government's debt managers indicated no new sale date.

title: Trudeau Says Reelection Aim Is Unity of Canada
description: OTTAWA, March 27  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau, who came to power 11 years ago primarily to keep Englishspeaking and Frenchspeaking Canadians together in one country, said today that he was seeking a new term to pursue the same goal.

title: New Yorkers,etc.
description: IN the beginning, there are them and us. There are those who talk to themselves and those who don't. And, of course, those who talk to themselves are mad. Ask any outoftowner. One the first things that strikes the newcomer to New York is that the streets and caverns beneath the skyscrapers are filled with people talking to themselves. To the undiscriminating eye, they are invariably shabby folk  taloned crones with their shopping bags, weathered Lears with stormtossed hair, ranting amid their shunners. They are always old.

title: Kitchen Equipment
description: IN cooking, everybody fails now and thenand no piece of kitchen equipment, no matter how ingenious, can prevent that. A device that comes close to being foolproof, though, is the double boiler, a pot that uses the caressing heat of steam to cook some of the riskiest dishes.

title: Ivan McLeod, ExRegional Chief Of the N.L.R.B. in New York City
description: Ivan C. McLeod, regional director in New York City of the National Labor Relations Board from 1957 to 1972, died last Wednesday in New Rochelle Hospital after a heart attack. He lived in New Rochelle, N.Y., and was 77 years old.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Grandfathers of Peace Are a Hit on Capitol Hill
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  President Anwar elSadat and Prime Minister MenaChim Begin, the grandfathers of peace, as they were described in one of the morning's less flowery phrases, went to Capitol Hill today to be annointed with praise and besieged by autographseeking politicians and to present their cases to the men who must approve the billions in aid they seek.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON. March 27  The Middle East Ceremony of Peace at the White House  whether or not it com forts the suffering and afflicted people of that tragic part of the globe  must be remembered as one of the most extraordinary occasions in the long his try of this most idealistic of world capitals.

title: World News Briefs
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, March 27 (Reuters)  Afghanistan's Foreign Minister, Hafizullah Amin, often considered a strong contender to take over power, was named Prime Minister of the proCommunist regime today.

title: Mets Get Hebner, Power Hitter, From Phils for Espinosa, Pitcher
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. March 27  The New York Mets finally ended their search for a powerhitting third baseman today when they traded Nino Espinosa to the Philadelphia Phillies for Richie Hebner.

title: Brzezinski's Deputy, a Source of Growing Influence
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  Like most Government officials who ?? in the bureaucratic shadow of their Cabinetlevel bosses, David L. Aaron, President Carter's Deputy Assistant for National Security, has received little of the attention accorded to his immediate superior, Zhigniew ??

title: Truckers Act to Keep Controls
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  The trucking industry, opening its offensive against the Kennedy deregulation bill, assembled five major shipping groups here today to opposeit.

title: The U.N. Today
description: March 28, 1979

title: Two Accounts Return to Arlow
description: Nothing is more heartwarming than the return of the prodigal account  unless its the return of two such accounts.

title: ExAide Sues Grumman
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  A former consultant to the Grumman Corporation charged today that the aerospace company had defamed him by stating that he might have made improper payments to a Japanese official in connection with the sale of military aircraft to Japan.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE President of OPEC: Conciliator's Role
description: To people in oilimporting nations, the word moderate probably sounds like a gross misnomer to apply to any official of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, particularly after OPEC's decision yesterday to raise crude oil prices ablmt 9 percent. Moderate may sound especially inappropriate if applied to Mani Said alOtaiba, the president of OPEC.

title: Italian Bank Inquiry
description: ROME, March 27 (Reuters) A vice director of the Bank of Italy spent his fourth day in jail today on charges of abuse of office and concealing irregularities. The charges stem from an investigation into allegedly improper lowsubsidy loans made to a ?? Italian chemical group.

title: Bridge:
description: The result of the Open Pair Championship that concluded the Spring Nationals of the American Contract Bridge League in Norfolk, Va., Sunday night was notable in two respects. The winners, Jeff Meckstroth of Columbus, Ohio, and Eric Rodwell of West Lafayette, Ind., were the youngest pair ever to win a major national title. And their margin of victory, almost twoandahalf boards, was one of the largest in the52year history of the event.

title: Cartel Reaffirms Its Economic Power
description: GENEVA. March 27  The decision of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries to raise world oil prices next week by more than it had originally planned marks the reaffirmation of the cartel's economic power after several years of relative quiescence.

title: Indiana Town Isn't Judging ExP.O.W.
description: GREENSBURG, Ind., March 27  The return of the last P.O.W., the local boy who was among the first to leave for Vietnam and the last to come home, has stirred no anger in this tidy little Corn Belt town.

title: Big Ten Dominance Looms in Basketball
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 27  The Big Ten Conference was the biggest thing in college basketball this morning as the nation's 247 other major basketball colleges woke up to realize that the Midwestern league, still better known for its football, could dominate intercollegiate basketball for many mornings to come.

title: Council Leaders Assail Program
description: Calling the federally financed Community Development Program unfocused, misdirected and in need of comprehensive review and overhaul, the top leaders of the City Council yesterday criticized its handling by city officials.

title: 2 PARIS BLASTS TIED TO TREATY PROTEST
description: PARIS, March 27  Bomb blasts wrecked the restaurant of a Jewish student center on the Left Bank and a Jewishowned perfume shop here today, and the police advised Jewish organizations and Israeli offices to take precautions against attacks following the signing of the EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty.

title: Food Bonds Yield 9.47%
description: General Mills and Dillon Read & Company yesterday priced the food company's $125 million of upper mediumgrade bonds scheduled for sale today to yield 9.47 percent, and securities dealers reported the issue all spoken for.

title: 38Day Deluge Imperils Heritage of a Brazilian City
description: OURO PRETO, Brazil, March 26 The rains came in biblical proportions. For ass straight days in February and early this month the 18thcentury hilltop town of Ouro Prto never saw even a ray of sunlight.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Most OTB Spots In City Are Shut By Clerks' Strike
description: The 1,300 c.lerks who work at the betting windows at the Offtrack Betting Cor poration's 167 offices in New York City staged a wildcat strike yesterday that sharply limited wagering and led to the shutdown of all but three of the offices.

title: U.S. Judge's Call: Umpires Are Safe
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 27 (AP)  With the start of the major league baseball season just a week away, a Federal judge today refused to order the game's umpires back to work, saying he lacked the authority.

title: Dow Index Surges 16.54 Points
description: The stock market posted a broad advance yesterday in accelerated trading, with the Dow Jones industrial average scoring its biggest daily gain in about five months.

title: American Diet: Better Than We Think?
description: WASHINGTON Despite all the criticism of the American diet. Dr. D. Mark Hegsted. director of the Government's new Human Nutrition Center. thinks we are rating better than most of us have been led to believe.

title: Man Sentenced in Bronx Theft
description: A Bronx man was sentenced yesterday to 13 years in jail on charges of robbing a uniform store. Using what turned out to be a toy shotgun, the police said, the man, Herbert Wells, three times robbed the store, the Uniform Rack, and it was a uniform that proved his downfall. Mr. Wells was captured by an unarmed marine sergeant who works across the street from the store, which is at 226 East Fordham Road. Mr. Wells, 33 years old, of 1846 Anthony Avenue, the Bronx, must serve at least band a half years in jail before he will be eligible for parole.

title: Rough Justice in Mississippi
description: In Mississippi, where the population is 37 percent black, the State Legislature and the Federal courts have taken turns denying black citizens their rightful share of political power. After the Voting Rights Act of 1965 doomed the tricks that had long kept blacks from voting, the Federal judges did their best to prevent the vote from becoming effective.

title: Options Growth Moratorium
description: In a response made public yesterday to the Securities and Exchange Commission's Study on Options, the New York Stock Exchange said it would continue to observe the voluntary moratorium on expansion in the options industry. The exchange questioned, however whether, the added cost of more thorough surveillance systems was warranted since it still had no share of the business itself.

title: Rangers Squander 4Goal Lead, Tie at 44
description: This is the way the Rangers and the Philadelphia Flyers play their games: First they tilt the rink one way so that one team can run up a lead; then they tilt it the other way and see if the other team can catch up.

title: Obituary 3  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Omar Bradley, on Ike
description: Dwight D. Eisenhower died 10 years ago today. When he left the Presidency after two terms, Congress restored his rank as General of the Army.

title: Union Awarded Right to Represent New York's Professional Employees
description: ALBANY, March 27  The state's highest court today awarded the Public Employees Federation the right to bargain for New York State's professional, technical and scientific employees. The decision, a unanimous one by the Court of Appeals, ended a bitter yearlong dispute between the federation and the Civil Service Employees Association, the state's largest public employees union.

title: Court Throws Out Quota for Hiring Coast Firemen
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  The Supreme Court, holding that a race discrimination suit against the Los Angeles County Fire Department had become moot, threw out a courtimposed hiring quota today without deciding whether the lower Federal courts had the power to impose the quota in the first place.

title: Playground Fantasies on a Chilly Day
description: To many adults this child cavorting in playground yesterday on Fifth Avenue and 85th Street was just passing a chilly day away in New York. But to 7yearold Jamie Millard, the chains could have been the rigging of a schooner headed for a mysterious Caribbean isle, or the tire a bucking bronco he would tame and then ride through deserts and mountains.

title: Judge Denies Teamsters Move for Strike Injunction
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  Saying that a national trucking strike was not necessarily inevitable, a Federal district judge today rebuffed an effort by the International Brotherhood of Teamsters to head off a possible TaftHartley injunction ordering truck drivers back to work.

title: Japanese Premier Will Visit U.S.
description: TOKYO, March 27 (UPI)  Prime Minister Masayoshi Ohira will make an eightday visit to the United States beginning April 30 and meet with President Carter, the Government announced today.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Central and South West Corporation, a Dallasbased electric utility holding company, announced management changes at two subsidiaries: At the Central Power and Light Company, Durwood Chalker was named chairmail and chief executive officer to succeed R. W. Hardy, who is retiring but will remain a director, and R. L. Range was named executive vice president and chief financial officer. At the West Texas Utilities Company, Glen D. Churchill was named president and chief executive officer.

title: Old Land Mines in Utah Destroyed
description: DUGWAY PROVING GROUND, Utah, March 27  Twentysix land mines filled with a lethal nerve agent, forgotten and unattended on the desert here for 16 years, were destroyed by Army explosives this morning. Later today it appeared to officials here that there had been no contamination and that the chemical agent, known as VX, had burned.

title: Stage: Good Lads, About 18 Youths
description: THERE is naturalness, vivacity and an absolute rightness of tone and observation in the portrait of life in a British reform school being presented by the National Youth Theater.

title: World Gold
description: TUESDAY, MARCH 27, 1979

title: Obituary 6  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Of Angola
description: WASHINGTON  Our Angolan policy is a fine example of unselfish aid to a faraway nation. Unfortunately, the beneficiary of that policy is not Angola but the Soviet Union. Our firm refusal to recognize the Angolan Government tightens ties between the Soviet Union and Angola. Nonrecognition undercuts our efforts for peace in Southern Africa; it retards the positive potential of American technology and investment in Angola.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: ORANGE, Calif., March 27 (AP)Continental Illinois Properties, a California real estate investment trust, announced today that its board had received a $120 million purchase proposal from a Netherlands Antilles company.

title: The Region
description: ALBANY  Governor Carey asked the state powerplant siting board to stop its hearings on Long Island Lighting Company's request to build two nuclear power plants at Jamesport, L.I., and make up its mind on the project or to provide legal funds for the groups that are opposing the plants. The hearings have been going on since 1974, and the board recently voted to extend them for another year. They have already cost more than $1 million, according to a spokesman for the Governor.

title: Califano Gives More Details on Carter Health Plan
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  Joseph A. Califano Jr., Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, today disclosed further details of President Carter's national health insurance plan, a proposal that appears to be quite similar to one made by President Nixon eight years ago.

title: LABORITES IN BRITAIN FACE BIG TEST TODAY
description: LONDON, March 27  The Labor Party and its Conservative opposition were both working tonight to drum up support for a crucial test of strength in Parliament tomorrow that will decide the fate of Prime Minister James Callaghan's Government.

title: Head of CBS News to Move to NBC
description: Richard S. Salant, who will step down as president of CBS News on April 30 under that network's mandatory retirement policy, will join the National Broadcasting Company the following day as vice chairman, according to high executives at the two networks. Mr. Salant has spent a total of 27 years at CBS, the last 17 as head of CBS News.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Business Day on Feb. 24 incorrectly attributed a comparison be tvveen Scorsky Scotch and another brand to a spokesman for Jay Ambrose. Mr. Ambrose is chairman of a company that owns a national brand of Scotch whisky named Scoresby, The comparison was made by a liquor store manager unaffiliated with Mr. Ambrose.

title: Obituary 5  No Title
description: Deaths

title: A Special Occasion: Some Rich Recipes
description: (Salmon mousse with lobster sauce)

title: Tip Leads Yale Police to Jewels
description: NEW HAVEN, March 27  An anonymous telephone call Sunday night led Yale University police to thousands of dollars worth of stolen jewelery belonging to Laila Amin, a Yale senior from Iran whose room was robbed March 5 by a masked intruder claiming to be a representative of Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini. Yale and New Haven police, who were still searching for the intruder, were not certain whether the thief was a prankster or if he indeed represented the Iranian leader. A spokesman for the Yale police said appropriate measures had been taken to protect the approximately 20 Iranian students at Yale.

title: Bronchitis Hospitalizes Meany
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (AP) George Meany, president of the America Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, was hospitalized today for treatment of a recurring bronchial condition, a federation spokesman said. The 84yearold leader is expected to stay at George Washington University Hospital for about two or three days.

title: The Scarsdale Diet Doctor Gives a Dinner Party
description: PURCHASE, N.Y. DR. HERMAN TARNOWER has a lean and leathery and definitely unhungry look. As I said in my book, he remarked at dinner recently while helping himself to a sizable portion of richasCroesus salmon mousse with lobster sauce, 'good food is one of life's great arts and great pleasures and should not be bypassed even by dieters.

title: Where to Eat Late at Night in Washington
description: WASHISGTON Its midnight and all's quiet in the hotel room save for a vague rumbling in your stomach. You roll over, think about calling room service, decide against it and tell your stomach to forget it. This is the nation's capital.

title: Israeli Military Begins Its Sinai Withdrawal In 45Mile Coast Strip
description: TEL AVIV, March 27  The Israeli armed forces began evacuating supplies today from a 45mile strip on Sinai's Mediterranean coast, the first sector of the peninsula to be restored to Egypt under the peace treaty signed in Washington yesterday.

title: Some at Parley in Iraq Urge Tougher Stand
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, March 27  Ministers of the Arab League countries opened a threeday meeting on the EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty today and reportedly reached agreement on some measures against Egypt for signing it.

title: Fiscal Argument Snags A Holiday for Dr. King
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (UPI) Efforts to make the birthday of Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. a national holiday became entangled today in an argument over whether the nation could afford it.

title: BEATRICE STOLZMAN
description: Beatrice Stolzman, who had been active in community affairs in Queens for many years, died yesterday in a nursing home in Rego Park at the age of 84.

title: TV: It's Richard II's Turn on Channel 13 Tonight
description: AS the first play in the history cycle that includes the two parts of Henry IV plus Henry V, Richard II is awkward in structure and sumptuous in its poetry. Tonight at 8 on Channel 13, it is given a competent production and an exquisite reading  in the British Broadcasting Corporation series that eventually will encompass all 37 of Shakespeare's plays.

title: Keeping Tab on Defense Contracts
description: Some industrial firms are working hard to kill the Renegotiation Board, an independent Federal agency created by Congress to recover excessive profits from defense contractors. Unlike most regulatory agencies, its powers must be reaffirmed periodically. Now the board's critics are asking Congress to deny it the power to review the activities of contractors since September 1976 and the funds to operate beyond the end of this month.

title: Braves Defeat Mets
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., March 27  Manager Joe Torre of the New York Mets reportedly is counting on Neil Allen, Jeff Reardon and/or Mike Scott to take up the pitching slack of Nino Espinosa, who was traded earlier today.

title: Jury Investigating Lance Indicts a Georgia Banker
description: ATLANTA, March 27 (AP)  The Federal grand jury investigating Bert Lance made its first public move in 14 months today, indicting a banker in connection with a loan to an associate of Mr. Lance.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: An address book is one of those things one can't live without, but it isn't often a thing of beauty. We've had our dogeared one for years but hadn't wanted to go to the trouble of replacing it until we spotted a handsome Italian one at a shop called Piero de Monzi at 824 Madison Avenue (69th Street). The book is covered with an elegant brown fabric stamped in gold, but the end papers and graphics inside, designed by Franco Maria Ricci, are the joy of it. The letters for each heading are formed by animal drawings and the calligraphy throughout is a delight. It's $35.

title: Hanoi Soldiers Get New Line In China Camp
description: BOSE, China  She is only 20 years old. Unfortunately for her, she was also a soldier in the Vietnamese Army, and along with some other women captured by the Chinese. she has ended up at the prisonerofwar camp here.

title: Heileman Completes Carling Takeover
description: LA CROSSE, Wis., March 27 (AP) The G. Heileman Brewing Company has completed its acquisition of Carling National Breweries, the Heileman president, Russell G. Cleary, said today.

title: Singapore Special: Fish Head Curry
description: SINGAPORE AMONG the more suspect explanations for the late Bill Balley's reluctance to go home as in Bill Bailey, won't you please come hoooooome?  is a relatively new and obscure theory here that he may have been addicted to M.J. Gomez's fish head curry.

title: HealthCode Violations Laid to 38 Food Places
description: The New York City Department of Health yesterday released the names of 38 food establishments that it said had violated the Health Code. The department also named seven restaurants that had corrected earlier violations and three that had been closed for failing to do so. It also cited three restaurants that had reopened after correcting earlier violations.

title: Trout Opener Woos Only Hardy Anglers
description: At the risk of sounding unAmerican, or, at best, a lugubrious spoilsport, I would like to suggest that one of the best ways to deal with the April 1 opening of the trout season in New York State would be to remain at home and dream of the soft winds of May.

title: Events
description: A MEETING BY THE RIVER, a play by Christopher ?? and Don Bachardy; directed by Albert Marre; starring Keith ??, Simon Ward, ?? McKenna, Sam Jaffe. At the Palace Theater, Broadway at 47th Street, 6:45.

title: City Council Approves ThreeYear Extension Of Rental Regulations
description: Measures to extend rent control and rent stabilization for three more years were approved yesterday by the City Council by a vote of 360, with Council member Leon A. Katz, Democrat of Brooklyn, abstaining.

title: Boswell, Hunts' Nemesis
description: It may indeed be a jungle out there in the world of corporate finance, and sometimes even the big game hunters come back empty handed. Consider the case of the Hunt International Resources Corporation and the Sunshine Mining Company, which share the same floor in Dallas's 56story First International Building and which thought they shared G. Michael Boswell.

title: Good Start for a Convention Center
description: Something called fasttrack construction is the method by which the state's Urban Development Corporation hopes to erect New York City's convention center  which has been on anything but a fast track until now. The method enables a builder to put up the basic structure while detail drawings are still being made. It is essential if the convention center is to be held within the projected cost of $375 million.

title: Jersey's Congressmen Rebut Study by Army On Closing of Fort Dix
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  In a lastditch attempt to head off the threatened closing of Fort Dix, the New Jersey Congressional delegation charged today that the Army had based its recommendation to close the facility on erroneous, incomplete and outdated information.

title: Issue and Debate Unnecessary Surgery, or Unnecessary Opinions?; Background
description: In an effort to hold down medical costs and reduce unnecessary surgery. a growing number of insurers are adopting a new healthcare concept by urging subscribers to consult another doctor before having an operation.

title: San Diego Attracts Electronics Plants
description: SAN DIEGO, March 27  A sunny climate, a large pool of unemployed workers and an eagerness to energize the city's economy are the main ele ments of a campaign to lure more electronics companies to San Diego.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Tuesday, March 27, 1979

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Jean Stafford, 63, Writer, Dead
description: Jean Stafford, the Pulitzer Prizewinning shortstory writer and novelist, died Monday evening at the Burke Rehabilitation Center in White Plains, after a long illness. She was 63 years old.

title: Sohio Assailed by Brown
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (AP) Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California today fended off charges of engaging in Presidential politics and denied that he sought to block construction of a CaliforniaTexas pipeline that would carry Alaskan oil to the nation's interior.

title: Mets Open the Door for Women
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla, March 27  Whatever other problems the Mets may have this season, lawsuits by female reporters barred from the locker room won't be one of them. In confirming their opendoor policy today, the Mets announced they would grant female reporters full access to their clubhouse dressing areas at Shea Stadium.

title: Lena Home at Westbury
description: IN the last few years, there has been a mushroom gruwth of clubs in New York, loosely identified as cabarets, where singers on several levels of development can be heard. They range from rooms where relative newcomers can learn by working in front of an audience on onenight stands to places that bring in such established performers as Barbara Cook. whu is at Reno Sweeney, or those who have made reputations out of town such as Karen Mason, who, after building a following in Chicago, Detroit and Loy Angeles, is now making her New York debut at the Ballroom.

title: Curb on HBomb Article
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  The ruling yesterday by a Federal district judge in Milwaukee forbidding The Progressive magazine to publish an article on the hydrogen bomb has raised significant First Amendment questions but the case's future in the courts is clouded. The vagaries of the judicial system being what they are, it will probably be a year or more before the Supreme Court ,rules on the merits of the case, if it ever does, and there are very few clues as to how the present Court might be disposed to view the issues.

title: N. Carolina Is Pressed to Revise Plans to Desegregate 5 Colleges
description: RALEIGH, N.C. March 27  By dedining to accept the state's proposal for , desegregating its institutions of higher education, Federal officials have forced North Carolina to reexamine the future of its five black universities.

title: Waldheim Visits West Germany
description: BONN, March 27 (Reuters)  Secretary General Kurt Waldheim of the United Nations arrived here today for a fourday official visit to West Germany. He plans to visit West Berlin Friday despite Soviet and East German objections.

title: Advertising
description: IT may sound like a highly unlikely confrontation, but Cobble Cuddlers and Mushrooms, two brands of shoes that stress comfort, are fighting an increasingly bloody war.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor

title: Dividends
description: WEDNESDAY, MARCH 28. 1979

title: MCM Plans Merger With Peninsular Life
description: Directors of two insurance holding companies have agreed to merge their efforts, according to an announcement by one of them, the MCM Corporation of Raleigh, N.C.

title: Giants Get Strength Coach And Sign 3 Free Agents
description: EAST RUTUERFORD, N.J., March 28 (UPI)  The Giants hired an assistant coach for strength, flexibility and conditioning today and signed three free agents.

title: 31 Small Bus Companies to Carry Handicapped Pupils With Police
description: Thirtyone small bus companies have agreed to transport 7,000 handicapped New York City children to school as long as a police officer is assigned to every bus. A wildcat strike by schoolbus drivers is now in its sixth week.

title: Who Should Get the Oil Money?
description: OPEC's decision to raise oil prices by only 9 percent has been widely interpreted as a victory for America's friend, Saudi Arabia. With such friends, who needs enemies?

title: New Directions for Glass Artist
description: NEXT time you put your eye to a telescopic lens, pay attention to what you 're looking through, rather than what you 're looking at. Harvey Littleton, the recognized founder of the studio glass movement, did just that, and the results of his inquisitiveness can be viewed in his latest work  optic waves.

title: 2 IN MASSACHUSETTS CLEARED IN SCANDAL
description: BOSTON, March 28  Two Massachusetts political operators were acquitted today of extortion charges stemming from an alleged plot to raise $500,000 for Ise in influencing President Nixon's choice of a Republican running mate in 1972.

title: Money
description: WEDNESDAY, MARCH 28, 1979

title: A Listing of New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Obituary 8  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO 3543900 UNTIL 5 30 P M FOR WEEKDAY EDITIONS UNTIL 2 30 P M ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9 00 A M TO 4 30 P M MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY, NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900: WESTCHESTER CO AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO (5161 7470600; SUFFOLK CO (515) 5691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3447767

title: Thompson Plans An Overseas Deal
description: The J. Walter Thompson Company, already the secondlargest ad agency internationally, said yesterday that it was holding conversations that could lead to the acquisition of part of EuroAdvertising, a Genevabased agency holding company.

title: Tanzania Asks Rich Countries To Aid Wildlife
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, March 28 Solomon Saibull, the Tanzanian Minister of Natural Resources, has urged at a wildlife seminar being held here that the wealthier, developed nations provide financial aid to protect the vast but dwindling wildlife resources of undeveloped countries.

title: Duryea Shows Documents He Says Prove Innocence in L.I. Sewer Case
description: BLUE POINT, L.I., March 28  Perry B. Duryea, former Speaker of the New York State Assembly, distributed copies of documents today that he said proved that he had not used his public office to assure passage of a bill that benefited two major contractors in Suffolk County's Southwest Sewer District who later became his partners in a land venture in the Bahamas.

title: The Region
description: HARTFORD  Judge Walter M. Pickett Jr. of the Connecticut Superior Court has been privately censured by the state's judicial review council for a comment he made while presiding over a hearing involving a case of attempted rape. He was reported to have said: You can't blame somebody for trying.

title: Your Vines Want Clinging Room
description: The south side of the house. if It has sun, offers everything your climbing vines could want  protection from wind, a surface to cling to and good light. The more sun the better, not only for the allessential light, but because it will heat up the wall, keeping the plant toasty.

title: One Killed and 5 Hurt In Chemical Explosion At a Factory in Jersey
description: LINDEN, N.J., March 2.3  One worker was killed and three others were injured, two senously, when an explosion before dawn ripped through a G.A.F. Corporation building here containing two large, pressurized chemical mixing kettles.

title: Old Dominion Star Named Top Female College Player
description: NORFOLK, Va., March 28 (UPI) I believe this has been the end of a perfect season, Old Dominion's Nancy Lieberman said today after being informed she had been selected to receive the Wade Trophy as the nation's top female college basketball player.

title: Trees Will Aid African Children
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, March 28 (Reuters)  The International Union of Child Protection, representing children's aid groups in 70 countnes, launched a campaign today to sponsor the planting of trees in the subSaharan region of Africa. The organization said the campaign was intended to safeguard the future of about 13 million children who live in the region.

title: Pop: Karen Mason Sings; Dance Festival To Open on June 16 Bosco and Welsh Joining Whose Life Is It Anyway? TOP POP RECORDS
description: KAREN MASON, a singer who has been getting ready in Chicago for the last two years, made her New York debut Tuesday evening at the Ballroom as if she were an old musicaltheater pro who was taking a fling in nightclubs.

title: ESSAY Return Fire
description: WASHINGTON, March 28  In our last thrilling episode, it was revealed here that Benson Ford Jr 29yearold nephew of Henry Ford 2d, had retained lawyer Roy Cohn to represent some of his interests Mr Cohn already represents a stockholders committee suing Mr. Ford, so the coalition becomes significant to anyone interested in the fortunes of the world's most famous businessman

title: Video Recorders Changing Daily Habits
description: WHEN Carol Ann Mathews, a Miami housewife, gets mildly depressed these days, she slips a tape recording of an old Shirley Temple movie into her video cassette recorder to lift her spirits.

title: GOINGI OUT Guide
description: RUDDYGORE Ruddigore, or the Witch's Curse was the first Gil ben and Sullivan production by D'Oyly Carte that made full use of the flexibility of electric lighting. Previous productions used gas lights. In 1887, the spectacular aspect of the production occurred in the second act, when the entire gallery of portraits came to life.

title: Bullets Surge Early and Beat Nets, 127108
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., March 28 The New Jersey Nets had their progress toward their first playoff berth in the National Basketball Association stalled tonight by the formidable Washington Bullets, who took command early and went on to a 127108 victory.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: ContiCarriers and Terminals Inc., Des Plaines, Ill., the transportation subsidiary of the Continental Grain Company, has named Elmer Jacobs president and general manager

title: Kahn's Inflation Box Score: Hits and Errors
description: Despite the doubledigit price increases of recent months, Alfred E Kahn, chairman of the Council on Wage and Price Stability, says he thinks the Government is having some success in fighting inflation.

title: 24 Million Eligible for Iran Vote
description: TEHERAN, Iran, March 28 (Reuters)  About 24 million people  every Iranian over the age of 16  will be eligible to vote in Friday's referendum on establishing an Islamic republic, Interior Minister Seyyed Ahmad SadrHaj was quoted as saying in the newspaper Kayhan.

title: Lower Lead Contamination Tied to Child Brain Damage
description: Lead contamination too mild to produce overt symptoms of illness may nevertheless do enough damage to a child's brain to interfere with mental function and classroom performance, scientists have concluded from a study that involved more than 2,000 children.

title: Kenya BusTruck Crash Kills 11
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 28 (AP)  A minibustaxi and a truck collided in the central Kenyan town of Mambo yesterday, lulling II persons, the police reported.

title: Russell Hopkinson, Latex Pioneer
description: Russell Hopkinson, a former vice president of the Olin Mathieson Chemical Corporation and a a pioneer in the development of synthetic rubber, died Tuesday at the age of 79 after a long illness. He lived in New York City and East Hampton, L.I.

title: Kansas City Vote Split Along Racial Lines
description: KANSAS CITY. Mo , March 28  Riding the crest of the largest voter turnout here in 37 years. Richard L Berkley won election, yesterday to become the first Republican Mayor in this Democratic stronghold since the 1920's. He turned back a bid by Bruce R Watkins to become the city's first black Mayor.

title: After the Treaty
description: JERUSALEM  The morning after, some people can't take yes for an answer

title: NIGERIA JOINS MOVE FOR A $4 SURCHARGE ABOVE 9% OIL RISE
description: Nigeria, one of the world's major oil producers, joined Algeria and Libya yesterday in a move to impose substantial surcharges on crude, above and beyond the 9 percent increase announced by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries on Tuesday.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS
description: The dollar was mixed against major European currencies yesterday as exchange dealers tried to assess the impact of the latest oil price rise. Gold nnces rose nearly $1 an ounce.

title: Dynamics Buying 20% of Unitrode
description: The Dynamics Corporation of America said it planned to buy at least 20 percent of the common shares of the Unitrode Corporation, despite a lawsuit by Unitrode to block such purchases Unitrode contends that the Dynamics purchases of its stock violate the Government's secunties law.

title: Fort Dix to Close
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 .  After weeks of official silence, the Department of Defense said today that it would deactivate Fort Dix in New Jersey, eliminate 3,200 civilian and military jobs there and transfer more than 6,000 recruits to bases in other parts of the country.

title: Obituary 5  No Title
description: Brat

title: Cairo's Future And U.S. Aid
description: WASHINGTON, March 28  Three years ago the United States ended its 20year arms embargo against Egypt and sold it six C130 Hercules military transports. From that modest step, with its political and psychological implications, the United States has now gone on to cement its milltary ties to the Government of President Anwar elSadat and open a farreaching defense relationship. In the next three years, Egypt will probably receive a formidable array of Jet fighters, destroyers, tanks, submarines, armored; personnel carriers and antiaircraft weapons. ,

title: Earl Weaver Didn't Cut His Throat
description: MIAMI  When the St. Louis Browns moved to Baltimore in 1954, they had stormed through the American League for a total of one pennant in all their existence, and no other team in the major leagues could make that statement.

title: Obituary 9  No Title
description: Beaths

title: Man Shot Leaving Subway
description: A 44yearold Manhattan man was shot once in the head early yesterday by a stranger who reportedly approached htm as he emerged from a Lower East Side subway station, according to the police.

title: Some Gas Pumps Add Up
description: HARTFORD, March 28 The OPEC price increases and the Carter Administration's prediction of a price of $1 a gallon for gasoline in the near future are not necessarily bad news for the VeederRoot Company here. VeederRoot just happens to make a computer that lets gasoline pumps register prices from $1 to $1.999 a gallon, and it says it is the only American company that does.

title: Carter Gains in Poll After Treaty, But His Rating on Economy Falls
description: Public approval of President Carter improved because of his success in negotiating a peace treaty between Israel and Egypt, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News Poll, but his gain appeared fragile and menaced by overwhelming disapproval of his handling of the economy.

title: A 7YearOld Groom Gets Cold Feet
