description: ONE day this March, when everybody else I knew was sorting through canceled checks and feeling frail about their capacity to follow through on their commitments, my 7yearold son bounded lightly into the front seat of the car after school and whispered into my ear Guess what) I just got married.

title: Flowering Vines Provide a Vertical Accent
description: VINES are one of the most underutilized plantings. Many gardens and terraces have their obligatory wall of ivy covering some otherwise obtrusive spot of masonry, but I'm speaking of flowering vines. Clematis with saucersized purple blossoms, the foamy pink flowers of the silver lace vine, even a trellis of simple morning gloves climbing skyward can easily provide a vertical accent to break up an open sweep of garden.

title: Hospital Closing Seen After Move By Republicans
description: Senate Republican leaders have rejected Governor Carey's $9 million rescue plan for Jewish Hospital and Medical Center of Brooklyn. A Federal bankruptcy judge predicted yesterday that the beleaguered hospital would be forced to close next week.

title: Dance: An Evening Of Originals
description: IN 1972, Jean Erdman, the choreographer and former Martha Graham dancer, and her author husband, Joseph Campbell, established a theaterarts training and producing organization called the Open Eye. Miss Erdman presented a program of her own dances and those of members of her company on Tuesday at the Theater of the Open Eye. It was a thoughtprovoking and craftsmanlike evening of dance.

title: Council Unit Discovers It Nodded on New Bill
description: Shortly after 11 A.M. yesterday, the City Council Committee on Public Safety unanimously passed a bill outlawing the consumption of alcohol on the city streets.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Vice President Mondale was at his left, Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel was at his right, and the man in the middle of yesterday's elegant luncheon table at Manhattan's Plaza Hotel was Augustine R Marusi, chairman of Borden Inc

title: Callaghan Had Survived 3 Challenges in Parliament
description: LONDON, March 28  Three times ?? the last two years, Margaret Thatcher's Conservatives challenged Prime Minister James Callaghan's minority Government with noconfidence votes, and three times he survived But tonight, because one of his supporters was out ill, he became the first Prime Minister since Ramsay MacDonald 55 years ago to be broueht down by such a vote

title: Brown's Plan to Sell Celtics Is Applauded
description: John Y. Brown hasn't won any popularity contests in Boston.

title: Sports Today
description: BOWLING

title: Iran Promising Special Attention to Ethnic Demands
description: TEHERAN, Iran, March 28  The Government, attempting to halt a second outbreak of tribal fighting, offered assurances today that the new constitution would pay special attention to the Turkomans and other ethnic groups.

title: Obituary 7  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Perdue Sues Architects
description: Perdue Farms Inc., the chicken marketer, filed suit yesterday seeking $40 million in damages from an architectural concern that it contends leaked trade secrets about Perdue's planned new fastfood business.

title: Coast Trial Hearing Charges of Tavern Racket Plot
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 28  The question is whether a group of Tacoma, Wash , men conspired to use violence, including murder, to gain control of the tavern business in Pierce County, Wash

title: Books of TheTimes
description: ACCORDING to J.R.R. Tolkien, who was having some fun with Beowulf': Lo! We have heard in old days of the wisdom of the cunningminded Inklings; how those wise ones sat together in their deliberations, skillfully reciting learning and songcraft, earnestly meditating. That was true joy!

title: Senate Supports a Bill For Sending Observers To Rhodesia Election
description: WASHINGTON, March 28  By a vote of 66 to 27, the Senate adopted a resolution today that would send a team of private citizens to observe elections in Rhodesia next month and to report on whether they were free and conducted fairly.

title: Opera: Il Crociato Revived in Concert; Milan's La Scala Opera To Tour U.S. in September
description: THE urge to revive forgotten operas washed up Meyerbeer's Il Crociato in Egitto last night in Carnegie Hall. As far as anybody seems to know, this opera, composed in Italy in 1824. had never before been performed in the United States. It was the work that launched Meyerbeer; after that he went to Paris and made history with his phenomenally successful operas, starting with Robert le Diable.

title: 2 Sentenced in G.S.A. Scandal
description: BALTIMORE. March 28 (AP)  Two former employees of the General Services Administration were sentenced to jail today in connection with the scandal at the Government procurement agency Doretha R Blackwell. 42 years old. the former assistant manager of a G S.A store here was sentenced to 60 days in jail for accepting gifts from a store manager and a Government supplier. In another Federal district courtroom, Al Allen, 37, a former sales assistant at the G S A store in Rockville, was sentenced to 90 days for conspiring to defraud the Government.

title: ABROAD AT HOME Message To Pretoria: II
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.,  The debate about universities and the Amencan corporate presence in South Africa, going on now around the country, ought to focus on a practical question. What action is most likely to move the South African Government. to affect its racist policies?

title: McGuire Warns All in Command By Punishing 3
description: Police Commissioner Robert J. McGuire yesterday transferred the commanding officer out of a Manhattan pre1 cinct where 17 officers had been found neglecting their duties. He also demoted a deputy inspector in Brooklyn for receiving a reduced price for repair of his automobile window.

title: Notes on People
description: To whom it may concern: If you didn't get me by Wednesday I would have killed 100 by Saturday. That note, written last Nov. 6, is signed David Berkowitz, also known as Son of Sam and it commanded $250 at auction on March 1. Another short Berkowitz letter was sold the same day for $375, and Charles Hamilton, the Manhattan auctioneer who specializes in famous autographs, expects more such sales will follow.

title: Letters
description: TO THE HOME SECTION:

title: EARNINGS
description: Federated Department Stores Inc which includes Abraham & Straus and Bloomingdale's in the New York area, had record sales and small profit gains in the fiscal year and final quarter ended Feb. 3, the company reported yesterday.

title: Penguins Gain Berth, Routing Rangers, 71
description: PITTSBURGH, March 28  The lethargy that suddenly engulfed the Rangers in the middle of last night's game continued to hover over their play tonight against the Pittsburgh Penguins. Almost without a fight, they succumbed by a score of 71.

title: Senate Passes Duty Waiver
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP) The Senate completed action today on a bill that the Carter Administration considers essential to conclusion of a major international trade agreement.

title: Stage: A Meeting by the River Oriental Philosophy
description: WHEN Western philosophers began to climb out of the Middle Ages and head in the direction of the 20th century, one question that worried them no little was the nature, mechanics and location of whatever it was that connected the soul to the body.

title: Three Men and Boy Will Be Tried For Holdup of Youth on IRT Train
description: Three young men and a 15yearold boy who is being treated as an adult under the New York State juvenile cnme law were charged yesterday with robbing a teenager of $20 and throwing him to subway tracks in the Bronx.

title: Bustop Wins Point in Court But Must Pay the City More
description: A State Supreme Court justice ruled yesterday that Bustop Shelters Inc. could remain in the busshelter business in New York City for the time being, but that it must pay the city 20.5 percent of revenues  four times its present fee  for the privilege.

title: South Africa Condemned at U. N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N Y., March 28 The Security Council condemned South Africa today for premeditated, persistent and sustained armed invasions of Angola and threatened to impose punitive sanctions. The United States, Britain and France abstained in the voting on the resolution, which was approved 12 to 0

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Koch Gives the Police Expanded Jurisdiction In Arson Investigation
description: Ending a jurisdictional dispute between the Police Department and the city's fire marshals, Mayor Koch decided yesterday to give the police expanded jurisdiction over arson investigations, particularly in the Bronx and northern Brooklyn, where the problem is most pervasive.

title: The Circus Moves In on Elephants' Feet
description: The eyes of the elephant are beady, brown and bloodshot, not unlike those of humans who wash down peanuts all night long. The skin is rusted armor plate, prickly with black, wiry bristles, and sitting astride one is similar to riding a horsehair couch on a country road. The trunk is a weapon for relentless foraging among small children for candy, peanuts, apples and popcorn.

title: Mobil Clinches Oil Pact
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation and the International Paper Company announced jointly yesterday that they had signed a binding agreement for Mobil to acquire the General Crude Oil Company, a subsidiary of International Paper, for approximately WO million. The purchase price is $3.5 million more than Mobil offered last week.

title: HELPFUL HARDWARE
description: IF you are a nonstop coffee or tea drinker, you might be interested in having an instant hot water tap installed in your kitchen for a constant supply of 190degree water at the turn of a knob.

title: Citibank Will Sell Gold Certificates
description: Citibank said yesterday that it would become the first major bank to sell gold certificates to investors, beginning next Monday. Each certificate will be a receipt for the purchase of a quantity of gold bullion. The minimum investment will be $1,000, but after the initial purchase, investors will be able to add amounts as small as $100.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Emmett Kelly, the Mournful Clown, Dead
description: Emmett Kelly, the bedraggled clown with a gift for evoking laughter by his mournful mien, died yesterday of a heart attack in Sarasota, Fla., on the day of the opening in New York of the Ringling Bros and Barnum & Bailey Circus. in which he had starred more than 20 years before He was 80 years old

title: Home Beat
description: WHEN she was 19 years old, Londoner Linda Barron was picking up pins for the English fashion designer Zandra Rhodes. But after studying at St. Martin's School of Art in London and designing a line of clothes for Browns, the Moulton Street boutique, she joined Rosita and Ottavio Missoni in Milan as their assistant.

title: Flatbush May Lose a Stigma
description: Trading Federal money for civic pride, residents of the Flatbush section of Brooklyn won their fight yesterday to have New York City reconsider its designation of their community as a poverty area.

title: Iran Is Asking U.S. to Buy Back Its Jets
description: WASHINGTON, March 28  The United States said today that it had held informal discussions with Iran on buying back advanced American fighter planes and missiles sold to the former Government of Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi.

title: Bankers Trust Sale Called Off
description: The Bank of Montreal and the Bankers Trust Company have abandoned plans for the Canadian institution to take over 89 branches of the New York bank, it was announced yesterday.

title: Japan Poison Victims to Be Paid
description: KUMAMOTO, Japan, March 28 (Reuters)  Twelve victims of Minamata disease, caused by mercury poisoning, were awarded $725,000 in compensation today, ?? be paid by a chemical company held responsible for releasing industrial waste containing mercury into the sea. A total of 1,523 persons in this town in southern Japan have been officially recognized as victims of the disease, which damaged the nervous system of people who ate fish caught in Minamata Bay.

title: Bridge:
description: Finding the right defensive play in difficult situation is a good deal easier with all hands exposed than it is in the heat of battle. Both East players missed the right sequence of plays on the diagramed deal, from the Vanderbilt Cup semifinal last week in Norfolk, Va.

title: 5% Increase in World Air Fares Expected
description: International airline fares are expected to climb 5 percent or more as result of sharply nsing costs of jet fuel, industry sources said yesterday.

title: Calendar of Events: Crafts Exhibition
description: The fourth annual spring invitational exhibition sponsored by the Craftsman's Gallery opens Saturday and will remain on view through April 28.

title: China's Rights Activists Warned Of Arrests if Protests Continue
description: HONG KONG, March 28 (UPI) China is warning that it will not deal gently with human rights activists and will arrest them if they continue to demonstrate in support of democratic reforms.

title: Music: Emerson String Quartet Performs Bartok
description: WASN'T it only yesterday that the Bartok quartets were considered the outer limits even for uppercrust string players? String quartets put these six formidable works on their programs only after many years of study and sweat. The mere desire to play them put a stamp of seriousness and intellectuality on any ensemble that aspired to master their intricacies of rhythm and sonority.

title: Japan Sees Increase Impeding Economy
description: TOKYO, March 28  The Government said today that the oil price increase of 9 percent adopted by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries would hurt Japan's economic growth.

title: Albany Leaders Agree on Pruning $1 1 7 Million From Carey's Budget
description: ALBANY, March 28  Legislative leaders agreed today to cuts of $117 million in Governor Carey's proposed budget  largely in judiciary, mentalhygiene and debtservice costs  as they struggled to complete a money package for the new fiscal year that begins Sunday.

title: U.S. Trade Deficit Cut Sharply
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)  A big drop in oil imports helped reduce the nation 's trade deficit to just under $1.3 billion last month, less than half the $3.1 billion deficit in January and the lowest in 21 months, the Commerce Department said today.

title: House Approves Bill to Preserve Ties With Taiwan
description: WASHINGTON, March 28  The House approved today, 339 to 50, legislation designed to preserve economic and cultural ties between the United States and Taiwan despite protests by Peking diplomats that the measure contravenes pledges made by President Carter.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: A move to impose substantial surcharges on top of the oil price increase of 9 percent announced by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries began spreading through the cartel. Nigeria joined Algeria and Libya in posting surcharges near $4 a barrel addition to the increase of $1.20 a barrel announced at the OPEC meeting in Geneva, according to industry sources. The new surcharges increase the chances that another round of unofficial price rises will spread through OPEC, setting off another series of energy price increases at the consumer level. [Page Al.]

title: Q&A
description: Q. Just past the water meter in my house the copper pipe has a long vertical air chamber near the main valve. However, when either the upstairs or the downstairs toilet is flushed there is a banging noise in the water pipes, like water hammer. The banging stops when the tank is filled. I hear the same banging when the washing machine fills. Do you have any idea how this noise can be stopped?  W.K., Silver Spring, Md.

title: TV: CBS's Chisholms Hit 6Hour Oregon Trail
description: THE CHISHOLMS, a sixhour minisenes that begins on CBSTV this evening at 8 o'clock, is a classic example of an increasingly popular television construction.

title: Italy Bank Chief Questioned on Loans
description: ROME, March 28  The governor of the Bank of Italy, Paolo Baffi, was called before a judge today for questioning about charges arising from subsidized loans made to a financially troubled chemicAl group.

title: Many Austrians Seem to Bristle at TV Holocaust
description: VIENNA, March 28  The response to the American television series Holocaust in Hitler's native Austria appears to have been less sympathetic than it was in West Germany. Hostile and ambiguous reactions abound here.

title: Advertising
description: MERCEDESBENZ OF NORTH AMERICA, Montvale, N.J., yesterday dismissed Ogilvy & Mather, it agency of for 14 years, because, it said, the agency was talking United States business with the Ford Motor Company. That is something that Ogilvy has not acknowledged.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Interestrate futures rose moderately yesterday on speculation that a narrowing of the United State tradedeficit last month could lead to lower interest rates.

title: Issue and Debate Rhodesia's Future and U.S.: Carter Is Pressed on Policy
description: WASHINGTON, March 28  The Carter Administration is struggling with powerful forces in Congress over whether to lift sanctions against Rhodesia and what attitude to take toward the government that will be formed there after elections next month.

title: Events Today
description: BEDROOM FARCE by Alen Ayckbourn. directed by, Mr Arckbourn and Peter Hell National Theater Compny of Great Britain production At the Brooks ?? Theater. West 47th Street, 6'30

title: Gasoline in New York and Jersey May Rise by 5 to 7 Cents a Gallon
description: Gasoline retailers yesterday forecast price increases of 5 to 7 cents a gallon in New York State and New Jersey in the month ahead as a result of both price increases by oilexporting countries and Federal regulations.

title: U.S. Picks Special Panel on Lance
description: WASHINGTON, March 28  The Justice Department has put together a prosecution team of four lawyers to complete the investigation of Bert Lance's banking practices and to present the case to a Federal grand jury in Atlanta for possible criminal indictments, wellplaced sources in the department said.

title: Carter Honors Asian Americans
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (Reuters) President Carter today proclaimed the seven days beginning May 4 AsianPacific American Heritage Week in honer of contributions by Asian immigrants to the improvement of life in the United States.

title: Afghan Fighting Is Said to Grow
description: WASHINGTON, March 28  Fighting in Afghanistan between Moslem rebels and the forces of the proSoviet Government, while sporadic, continues to increase gradually, United States officials said today.

title: Washington Governor Signs Law Allowing Marijuana for Patients
description: OLYMPIA, Wash , March 28 (AP) Washington has become the fifth state to permit the use of marijuana for medicinal purposes

title: New Judges Sworn In at City Hall
description: Sworn in for 10year terms yesterday by Mayor Koch were, clockwise from lower left, Mara T. Thorpe, Donald Grajales, Kevin C. Fogarty, William Erlbaum, Murray Mogel, Pearl B. Corrado and Leroy B. Kellam. Judges Thorpe, Fogarty and Corrado took posts on the Family Court; the others the Criminal Court. During the ceremony, the mayor pointed out that the new judges had been selected by the nonpartisan Committee on the Judiciary and did not come up through the politicalclubhouse route

title: Arts Festival to Recall 182050 Paris
description: The Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts will stage a 12day festival that will bring to Washington the Comedie Franaise, the Orchestre de Paris and the Stuttgart Ballet, all performing works stemming from the golden penod of the arts in Paris between 1820 and 1850.

title: C.I.T. to Sell All of Bank
description: The C.I.T. Financial Corporation, in a move to escape regulation by the Federal Reserve Board, agreed yesterday to completely divest itself of its ownership in the National Bank of North America by selling all shares in the New York bank to the National Westminster Bank of London.

title: Garland Gives 2 Hits. In 5 Innings
description: TUCSON, Aria., March 28 (UPI) Wayne Garland, attempting to come back from shoulder surgery performed last May, pitched five scoreless innings and gave up two hits as the Cleveland Indians defeated the San Francisco Giants, S.2, in a spring exhibition game:

title: Market Place
description: THE eightyearold suit of minority shareholders of Schenley Industries was settled yesterday when Judge Richard Owen ruled in their favor in Federal District Court in Manhattan. Some observers say the rewards were trifling after so long a struggle.

title: St. Regis Spending Set at $410 Million
description: Calling it the largest expansion plan in the company 's history, George J. Kneeland, chairman of the St. Regis Paper Company, said the board had approved a $410 million program.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: LOUISE FISHER MORRIS

title: SENATE VOTE BACKS HIGHER INCOME RULE
description: WASHINGTON. March 28  The ?? ate refused today to back away ?? ?? controversial decision that lifted the ?? on the amount of outside income ?? bers could earn.

title: World News Briefs
description: MANILA, March 28 (UPI)  Moslem rebels today released the Rev. Lloyd G. Van Vactor, the American missionary who was kidnapped 20 days ago. When he was reunited with his sons. Mr. Van Vactor learned that his wife had died while he was in captivity.

title: Cowens Delivers a Rebuke
description: MILWAUKEE, March 28 (UPI)  Dave Cowens, the playercoach of the Celtics, said today that John Y. Brown, coowner of the team, should have stayed out of dealings with Boston players this year.

title: February Steel Imports Off 40%
description: WASHINGTON, March 28  Imports of steel dropped 40 percent in February from yearearlier levels, according to Government figures made public today. The steel industry cited efforts begun last year by the Carter Administration to aid the domestic industry, pimanly the triggerpnce system aimed at curbing the cheapest imports.

title: INVASION OF YEMEN IS TERMED A FAILURE
description: SANA, Yemen, March 28  Somebody badly miscalculated in the Aden regime's invasion of Yemen last month. in the consensus of informed opinion here: perhaps the leaders of Southern Yemen, perhaps the Soviet Union, perhaps both. In any event, these sources say, the invasion yielded less than its planners had hoped

title: Obituary 3  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Williams to Sell Offshore Leases
description: TULSA, Okla., March 28 (AP)  A letter of intent has been signed by the Williams Exploration Company and the PetroLewis Corporation of Denver for the sale of Williams interests in various Federal offshore oil and gas leases in the Gulf of Mexico.

title: How Senators Voted On Limiting Income
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP) Pawing is the rollcall by which the Senate rejected a resolution today by Senator Gary Hart, Democrat of Colorado, that sought to reimpose a limit of $8,625 on the outside earned income of senators:

title: Panel Splits on Bottle Deposit Bill
description: WASHINGTON, March 28  The Administration split today over whether to recommend that President Carter propose legislation requiring a mandatory deposit on all soda, beer and other beverage containers.

title: SOVIET SNIPS ARRIVE AT CAM RANH BAY
description: WASHINGTON. March 28  Carter Administration officials expressed concern today over the arrival of three Soviet warships at the Vietnamese base at Cam Ranh Bay

title: Fed to Pursue Credit Restraint
description: WASHINGTON, March 28  G. William Miller, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that the central bank , intended to maintain the present degree of monetary restraint but that it stood ready to consider further tightening if business continued to accumulate inventories at a time when the economy was slowing.

title: Federal Experts Suggest Filters Caused Accident
description: MIDDLETOWN, Pa., March 28  Federal nuclear experts said tonight that the cause of the accident that released radiation at the $700 million nuclear power plant here this morning was a series of filters that did not operate properly.

title: Life With Father: A Child's Weekend Room
description: ARNOLD KAPLAN consulted with Elan on every piece of furniture. David Watson wanted to be sure there was a separate room for Sarah. Jack Nessel renovated his diminutive duplex with Jennifer in mind. C. Ray Smith worked out an ingenious storage solution for Nino's pdraphernalia.

title: Warning on Hair Implant
description: THE Food and Drug Administration yesterday warned the public of serious complications from a controversial synthetichair implant technique that stitches chemical wig fibers into the scalp. At least 30 concerns, some of them with franchised branches, are performing such operations around the country, according to the F.D.A.

title: Stock Trading Soars to '79 High
description: The stock market declined moderately yesterday in the heaviest trading of the year with some of the blue chip and glamour issues incurring the biggest losses.

title: Colorful Model Rooms
description: AFTER a long season of obscure offshades and noncolor, Lord & Taylor's furnishings department is welcoming spring with a pure color bash, and nowhere is the bright palette more visible than in the model rooms that opened this week.

title: Talking Business
description: CHICAGO The Inland Steel Company, the nation 's sixthlargest steel producer, prospers in a troubled industry Last year, Inland 's giant Indiana Harbor Works, operating at 101.8 percent of capacity, turned out 8.6 million tons of steel to capture a record 6.5 percent of domestic steel production. Inland earned $158.3 million on $3 25 billion in sales, for a healthy 13 2 percent return on equity

title: Obituary 6  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Buffalo Police Will Try Bicycles
description: BUFFALO, March 28  Four men in blue will patrol their beats on 10speed bicycles this summer in an experiment to make the police more visible, more mobile and more of an example to other cyclists.

title: World Gold
description: WEDNESDAY, MARCH 28, 1979

title: District of Columbia Amendment Approved by Connecticut House
description: HARTFORD, March 28The Connecticut House of Representatives voted tonight to approve the proposed voting rights amendment for the Distnct of Columbia.

title: Radiation Is Released in Accident At Nuclear Plant in Pennsylvania
description: MIDDLETOWN, Pa., Thursday, March 29  An accident at a threemonthold nuclear power plant released abovenormal levels of radiation into the central Pennsylvania countryside early yesterday.

title: Tanzanian and Ugandan Invaders Close In on Kampala From Two Sides
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 28  Uganda's military situation worsened today as an invading force of Tanzanians and Ugandan exiles closed in on the capital of Kampala from two directions. Shooting was reported inside the capital

title: PartWolf in Park Puts A.S.P.C.A. to the Test
description: An 80pound animal that is part timber wolf and part German shepherd, was recaptured in Central Park yesterday morning after escaping the previous evening from the shelter of the Amencan Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals on East 92d Street.

title: Hebner Trade Rattles Mets Pitching Plans; But Torre Insists He Has Arms Espinosa Was No. 3 Hurler Trade Rattles Met Mound Plans What to Do With Randle? Voluntary Workout for Dodgers
description: VERO BEACH, Fla., March 28 Richie Hebner, the 57th man in I8 years to tackle third base for the New York Mets in a long and often undistinguished line, was back in their main camp today fielding ground balls for his new employer.

title: Brezhnev Said to Have Bad Case of Influenza
description: MOSCOW, March 28 (AP)  Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, has a bad case of influenza, French diplomats said today.

title: Sound
description: OUR recent discussion of opera nn cassettes drew an unusual amount of comment, much of it critical of the uneven quality of sound among different labels. One reader lodged a valid complaint about the packaging of operatic releases Considerable space is wasted by bulky cardboard boxing  many times the cubic volume of the cassettes themselves. Moreover, he points out, packaging formats of different labels vary in height and depth, creating storage problems. RCA, for example, makes its cassette boxes for operatic releases so tall they won't fit on most bookshelves. This negates a major advantage of cassettes  their compactness.

title: Rookie's Dream Ends Amid Yankee Cuts
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla, March 28  Fantasy. Rookie pitcher performs flawlessly in spring training, forcing Yankees to make spot for him on starstudded staff of millionaire pitchers.

title: Foreigners Invade U.S. Truck Market
description: DETROIT, March 28  European auto makers are preparing to invade the American mediumduty truck market, previously the sole preserve of domestic manufacturers.

title: The City
description: Bettingwindow clerks at city OTB offices continued their wildcat strike yesterday, cutting gross revenues by more than 90 percent.

title: Ban on Best Is Lifted
description: A worldwide suspension against George Best, the Irish soccer player, has been lifted and he is free to play for the Fort Lauderdale Strikers, the United States Soccer Federation announced yesterday.

title: Insider Reports for Exchanges
description: The New York and the Amencan stock exchanges issued yesterday their latest reports of changes in the shareholdings of officers, directors and large stockholders in companies whose shares are listed on the exchange.

title: How the Interviews In Poll Were Done
description: The latest New York Times/CBS News Poll is based on telephone interviews conducted Monday and Tuesday with 1,221 adult men and women around the United States.

title: Man Shot Leaving Subway
description: A 44yearold Manhattan man was shot once in the head early yesterday by a stranger who reportedly approached him as he emerged from a Lower East Side subway station, according to the police.

title: A Long Life of Versatile Artistry
description: LONDON EILEEN GRAY 'S somewhat shadowy life spanned nearly a century, from 1879 to 1976. Her creative lifetime  first as a lacquerer and designer of flamboyant furniture and dramatic screens; then as a creator of cubistic carpets and streamlined furnishings; finally as an architect of pioneering vision  is a panorama of design history from Art Nouveau to the modern movement.

title: Municipals Get Mixed Reaction
description: Investment bankers bid aggressively yesterday for taxexempt bonds on the theory that the market had success. fully handled a large volume of new issues in March and had held its ground in the face of news of soaring inflation.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Shah Reported Planning to Move But Is Advised Not to Visit U.S.
description: WASHINGTON. March 26  Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi, the former ruler of Iran, will reportedly leave Morocco soon for another place of refuge, possibly the Bahamas.

title: Bomb Explosion at Big A Is Linked to Labor Dispute
description: A small pipe bomb exploded yesterday in a parking lot at Aqueduct Race Track and damaged one car but did not cause any injuries, authorities said.

title: The Senate's $16,375 Raise
description: Two weeks ago, when the Senate furtively lifted its new limit on the amount senators could earn for speeches and other outside activities, we thought it was shameless  especially because the action was taken by voice vote, leaving no record of who voted how. Yesterday the Senate corrected at least the procedural defect by conducting an open debate and record vote. The outcome was a 5444 vote against the earnings limit. Well, maybe that's progress of a sort, going from shameless to shameful. At least now voters know whom to blame.

title: Books: The American In in Vietnam
description: OCCASIONALLY, the remark is made that the Vietnam War is a turnoff for readers, that it's all been said and written before, and another book doesn't matter. Then along comes Michael Herr's Dispatches(now an Avon Books paperback), blowing up hearts and minds with a grunt'seye view that saw lunacy laced with hash masquerading as war. And now comes still another work, more detached but almost as devastating, that tells us the why of the war in the voices of those at a high level who were involved.

title: LABOR GOVERNMENT IS OUSTED IN BRITAIN BY VOTE1N COMMONS
description: LONDON, March 28  Prime Minister James Callaghan's Labor Party Government was turned out of office by a margin of just one vote in Parliament tonight, on a motion of no confidence.

title: Belzberg of Canada Buys 5.1% of Bache Group Inc.
description: Samuel Belzberg, a multimillionaire Canadidn businessman and former usedcar salesman, disclosed yesterday that he had purchased a 5.1 percent interest in the parent company of Bache Halsey Stuart Shields Inc., one of the nation 's biggest brokerage houses.

title: Fresno Battling to Beat the Heat and Put Itself on the Tourists' Map
description: FRESNO, Calif.  William Saroyan did his first writing here; Tom Seaver did his first pitching here. There are an opera association, a philharmonic orchestra and four dance companies The largest dog show west of the Mississippi is held here annually, and there's more ethnic diversity, local persons say, than in any city west of New York.

title: ARABS, DEEPLY SPLIT, BAR STRONGER STEPS AGAINST U.S., EGYPT
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, March 28  Arab countries opposing the EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty refused to adopt major punitive sanctions against Egypt and the United States at a meeting here today, and Syria, Libya and the Palestine Liberation Organization walked out in protest.

title: Agency Studying Nazis Is Upgraded
description: WASHINGTON, March 2S  The Justice Department, in an effort to solve the many problems that have beset the Government's investigation of alleged Nazi war criminals living in the United States, agreed today to transfer control of the unit assigned to the case to its Criminal Division

title: Uniform Rates on Car Insurance Sought by Two Key Legislators
description: ALBANY, March 28  In an effort to equalize New York State automobileinsurance rates, the chairmen of the Assembly and Senate Insurance Committees said today that they would introduce legislation dropping marital status as a factor in determining carinsurance rates and excluding age and sex as considerations in computing fire and theft coverage.

title: Begin Urges Investment In Both Israel and Egypt
description: Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel, relaxed, discursive and smiling on the last day of his triumphal treatysigning visit to the United States, asked an audience of businessmen today to invest in both Israel and Egypt.

title: About Nayaug
description: GLASTONBURY, Conn , March 26 The spirit of New England eccentricity flared up reassuringly here last week when E. P. Mangan, a local histonan who likes to be and fabricate history, announced he was running for President. He promises no taxes, no progress, and seems to be running on the general theme Why not the worst?

title: British TV Is Filming Brideshead in 5 Parts
description: A fivepart adaptation of Evelyn Waugh's Brideshead Revisited is being produced by Granada Television of Bnuan in association with WNETTV. Channel 13.

title: Sonics Late Rally Tops Knicks, 111105
description: SEATTLE, March 28 (UPI)  Dennis Johnson scored 25 points and sparked a fourthquarter comeback tonight that carried the Seattle SuperSonics to their seventh consecutive victory, a 111105 decision over the New York KnicksMILWAUKEE, March 28 (AP) The Milwaukee Bucks blew a 1point thirdquarter lead, then rallied behind Junior Bndgeman for a 135117 victory over the Boston Celtics.

title: Critic's Notebook: Sweeney's Dark Side
description: ATTEND the tale of Sweeney Todd. Like many other things in the Stephen Sondheim musical, the title song sticks in the mind long afterward. It isn't by any Means the best song in a fascinating scoreAlan Rich recently pointed out its resemblance to Dies Irae but it won't go away. Perhaps it is because, as the show's leitmotif, it snakes its way in and out of the memory as it did through the scenes of this dark work.

title: Radio
description: ?? A.M., WNCN. Preziosa, Weber; Gnossienne No ?? Satie (orch by Poulenc), Pomp and Circumstance March No 4. Elgar

title: Treaty? Alliance?
description: CAIRO  The EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty is projected as the first step toward an overall Middle East settlement Paradoxically, one basic ingredient, Jerusalem, was jettisoned at Camp David Now with the signature of the treaty, the Palestinian issue in all its aspects has also been dumped.

title: TV: Poisonous Wastes
description: ASEARCHING examination of the dangers of the uncontrolled dumping of poisonous chemical wastes is provided by ABC News Closeup. The Killing Ground.

title: $2.5 Million Loan to Use In Orioles Sale Approved
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., March 28 (UPI)  A $2.5 million loan to the city of Baltimore for use in connection with the sale of the Baltimore Orioles was approved today by the House of Delegates and sent to the state Senate for concurrence.

title: High Court Hears Arguments in a Challenge to Affirmative Action Plans
description: WASHINGTON. March 28  The Supreme Court heard arguments today in the case of Brian F. Weber, the white steelworker whose successful challenge to a factory training program designed to put more blacks in skilled jobs has placed the future of affirmative action programs in serious doubt.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: The credit market rallied sharply yesterday afternoon as the Treasury postponed its sale of longterm bonds scheduled for this afternoon because Congress again failed to raise the ceiling on the national debt. A sale of shortterm Treasury bills also was postponed.

title: Handler Heads Bamberger's
description: R.H Macy & Company announced yesterday that Mark S. Handler, 46 years old, has been elected to the long vacant post of chairman and chief executive officer of its Bamberger's division.

title: Home Improvement
description: A NEW, wireless combination burglar and fire alarm system is being offered by Norelco. It is quickly and easily installed; actually, there really isn't any installing to do, other than mounting the small transmitting and sensing devices on each window and door and one or more smoke detector alarm units on the ceiling or upper part of the wall.

title: Salant Move Raises Issue of Loyalty
description: IN the case of Richard S. ?? an energetic man of 65 years, the desire to continue working beyond the CBS mandatory retirement age transcends whatever paternalistic loyalties he may feel toward a news organization he had headed, and whose policies he shaped, for more than 15 years. Mr. Salant has done what no previous CBS executive faced with retirement ever did: He has elected to join the competition.

title: The U.N. Today
description: March 29, 1979

title: Censors at Work
description: Though he begged to be spared his ?? . Federal District Judge Robert Warren of Milwaukee has become the first jurist ever to grant an injunction to silence an American publication for reasons of national security. He acknowledges a drastic and substantial invasion of the constitutional rights of The Progressive magazine and finds it painful to act the censor. But not painful enough His decision, in our view, was not only unconstitutional but also unnecessary, arbitrary and illinformed.

title: Europe on Oil Rise: Growth Will Be Cut
description: BONN, March 28  European governments reacted with dismay today to the decision of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries to raise oil prices at least 9 percent. But while acknowledging obvious economic sideeffects of the increase, they rejected any common platform to conserve energy.

title: Judge Out In Sindona Bank Suit
description: After more than two and a half years of complex hearings on the collapse of the Franklin National Bank in 1974, Federal District Judge Thomas C. Platt Jr. has disqualified himself from the proceedings after making Michele Sindona, the Italian financier, the butt of a joke he told in open court.

title: Soviet Maneuvers Reported
description: TOKYO, March 28 (Reuters)  The Soviet Union has been conducting largescale military exercises near the Chinese border since early this month, two Japanese newspapers said yesterday

title: Around the Nation
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Bowling's Rodeo Comes to L.I.
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., March 28 Some drove by van or by camper from the last stop, Milwaukee. The poorer ones stacked a dozen balls into the trunk and back seat and made the long drive by car. The lucky ones flew in.

title: Fendi Furs Dazzle Milan
description: MILAN, Italy, March 28  It was a tour de force  the range of colors, shapes and textures at the Fends show. And it all happened in furs.

title: Sadat Objects to U.S. Assurances To Israelis on Treaty Violations
description: WASHINGTON, March 28  President Anwar elSadat of Egypt today opposed American assurances to Israel of United States action in the event Cairo violated the peace treaty signed Monday, and he revealed that his Government had formally objected to the AmericanIsraeli understanding saying that it could be construed as an eventual alliance against Egypt.

title: Flynt Found Guilty of Obscenity
description: ATLANTA, March 28 (AP)  Larry Flynt, the owner of Hustler magazine, was convicted today on 11 misdemeanor counts of violating state obscenity laws and was ordered to pay $27,500 in fines

title: Texts of 2 Memorandums of Agreement, Letter From Khalil and U.S. Comment
description: WASHINGTON, March 28  Following arc the texts of two memorandums of agreement between the United States and Israel providing assurances to Israel in case of Egyptian violation of the peace treaty: a letter from the Egyptian Prime Minister, Mustafa Khalil, to Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance commenting on one of the memorandums, and a statement by the State Department on Mr. Khalil's letter.

title: An Industrial Issue Goes Into Default
description: A $33 million issue of Livonia, Mich., industrial revenue bonds that were sold in 1967 went into default yesterday, the Bradford Trust Company of New York, trustee of the securities, announced.

title: Altair to Fly From Newark
description: Altair Airlines, a fastgrowing career, will open its first service in and out of Newark International Airport on Sunday. Flying the Frenchbuilt Nord 262 turboprop planes that seat 27 passengers, Altair will operate from Newark to Dulles International Airport outside Washington, to the BaltimoreWashington International Airport, and to Philadelphia, Richmond, Charlotte, N C., and Raleigh, N.C.

title: Saudis to Cut Production If Iran Fills World Needs
description: VIENNA, March 28 (AP)  Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yamani, the oil minister of Saudi Arabia, amplifying his state ments yesterday on Saudi plans for output, said today that, if Iran increased output enough to satisfy world demand, his nation would reduce production.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: TORONTO, March 28 (Reuters) George Weston Ltd., Canada's largest merchandiser, made a formal offer today to acquire 51 percent of the Hudson's Bay Company of Toronto for about $471 million in cash, securities or a combination of both.

title: Kuhn: Umpires Will Be Available
description: DALLAS, March 28 (UPI) Baseball Commissioner Bowie Kuhn said today the major league season would open as scheduled next week even if the umpires have not returned to work.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, MARCH 29, 1979

title: Backgammon:
description: The New Jersey Backgammon Association is one of the more active organizations in the greater metropolitan area and is a member of the Metropolitan Backgammon Association. Now Just over three years old, the Jersey group is running strongly under the direction of Dan and Rena Caverly. They have developed a regular program of weekly tournaments in northern and central New Jersey.

title: Dobrynin Visits The World Bank
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 Matoly F. Dobrynin, the Soviet Ambassador to he United States, made his first official visit to the World Bank today, and said he hoped for closer future cooperation between member nations of the World Bank and the Sovietbloc Council for Mutual Economic Assistance.

title: RUSSIAN IS A SUICIDE AT THE U.S. EMBASSY
description: MOSCOW, March 28  An unidentified 27yearold Soviet man with a bomb strapped to his body entered the United States Embassy today, demanded permission to emigrate, and then blew himself up after the Americans had called in the police to force him out.

title: Disks: Neglected Crumb, With Tan DeGaetani
description: GEORGE CRUMB'S music has been well represented on records ever since his Echoes of Time and the River won a Pulitzer Prize just over a decade ago, but this disk rounds up several works that have gone neglected. Mr. Crumb's artistic personality has two strikingly different aspects: the purely instrumental, technically ingenious profile that he shows in such pieces as the Four Nocturnes and the more overtly dramatic and theatrical side that he reveals in Lux Aeterna. The latter piece calls for the players to wear black masks and robes and to perform on a dark stage lighted only by one candle (effects rather difficult to suggest in a recorded performance, of course).

title: Pop: Michael Franks Sings and Plays
description: MICHAEL FRANKS, a songwriter, singer and tastefully rudimentary guitarist who was at the Bottom Line Tuesday night, is very cool. Like some of the more introverted jazz vocalists of ??, he simply stands and sings, hands in his pockets, his face seriously and purposefully set. Occasionally he will make a concession to the present era by disinterestedly shaking a percussion instrument or casually picking up his guitar, and he does sport stylishly long hair. Otherwise, he exudes an aura that has California, 1959, written all over it.

title: Hers
description: MY husband's grandmother, on his father's side, lived all her life in a small town called :Windrow, Okla. Her husband ran a general store there, and after he died she stayed on in the same house where her son, my fatherin law, was born. She died last summer, at the age of 86.

title: Stage: Hispanic Musical of East
description: RAMIRO (RAY) RAMIREZ'S Sancocho, which opened last night at the Public Theater, is an East Coast Hispanic musical, as contrasted to Broadway's Zoot Suit, a West Coast Hispanic play with music. In other words, this is a Puerto Rican, or rather, a Nuyorican, show, with a pulsating urban tempo.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: GLENN R. BROWNBACK

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Wednesday, March 28,1979

title: 2 Rent Aides Ousted on Residency Rule
description: A week before the Rent Guidelines Board was scheduled to meet to decide maximum rent increases in rentstabilized apartments, Mayor Koch announced yesterday that he had replaced two of its members because they did not meet a residency requirement that has been in effect for at least 37 years.

title: Plant's Accident Points Up Issue Of Proper Radiation Safety Level
description: The cloud of radioactive debris that has escaped from the Three Mile Island nuclear plant near Harrisburg, Pa., is by no means the first such occurrence in the United States, but it raises anew the question of what level of radiation exposure is safe or acceptable.

title: Allegheny Airlines Seeks New Name
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (AP)  Allegheny Airlines, saying it no longer is a regional carrier, an nounced today that it would ask shareholders to change the company name to USAir.

title: The Plutonium Syndrome
description: NYACK, N.Y.  As I read yesterday of the accident at a nuclearpower plant that sent radiation into the central Pennsylvania countryside, I recalled a factory tour on the outskirts of Denver in 1978. The complex of more than 90 buildings there was established in secrecy by the Atomic Energy Commission in 1952.

title: Music: Raymond Leppard Conducts Philharmonic
description: THE unfamiliar sounds that wafted through Fisher Hall last night really did come from the New York Philharmonic. Even with the great Baroque revival of the 1950's there was very little preHaydn music on symphony programs around the world., and it remained for specialized groups to step in and fill the gap. But last night the Philharmonic got itself Raymond Leppard, a guest conductor who has specialized in early music, and his talents were observed. Hence Monteverdi, Cavalli and Bach on the program.

title: Russians Play Host to Riverdale Neighbors
description: Forty Riverdale residents spent nearly three hours on foreign territory Wednesday evening and found the population friendlier than previous restrictions on contact had suggested.

title: Williams Denies Role In Any Deals to Pick 4 New Federal Judges
description: TRENTON, March 29  Senator Harrison A. Williams, Democrat of New Jersey, said today that he had made no deals with anyone regarding the filling of four vacant Federal judgeships.

title: Economic Scene
description: THE new burst of oil price increases now spreading from country to country represents a shock to the United States and the world economy comparable to the first shock that followed the outbreak of the ArabIsraeli war of 1973. This second shock, building on the Iranian revolution, is still unfolding. But earlier expectations that the world oil price would reach $18 to $20 a barrel by the end of this year, representing roughiy a 50 percent increase and totaling $60 billion to $70 billion a year, have not been altered by events. If anything, movement in that direction has now been accelerated.

title: Videla Says Inflation Is New Foe
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 29  President Jorge Rafael Videla said in a nationally televised speech tonight that Argentina must fight inflation now with the same commitment that guided the armed forces in their campaign against leftwine subversion.

title: Curling Unit Taps Eklund
description: BERN, Switzerland, March 29 (UPI)  Sven Eklund, father of the Swedish movie actress, Britt Eklund, was voted president of the International Curling Federation today. Eklund succeeds the late Colin Campbell of Canada.

title: Jesse Jackson Brings Educational Program to New York
Obituary 7  No Title
description: Deaths

title: WEEKEND MOVIE CLOCK
description: Below 42d Street

title: House Panel Approves Land Bill On Alaska in Face of Opposition
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (AP)  A House Merchant Marine subcommittee today approved an Alaska lands hill that was applauded by oil, mining and timber companies and opposed by conservationists.

title: The City
description: A cleanup of the Bronx River, including construction of parks and a 20mile pathway for pedestrians and bicycle riders, will cost more than $20 million and take at least 10 years to complete, according to a report released yesterday.

title: Events and Openings
description: BUCK ROGERS, directed by Daniel Haller; starring Gil Gerard and Pamela Hensley, at the Riyoli, RKO Bath Street No. I and other theaters.

title: COMMODITIES
description: A slimming last month of the United States trade deficit led to selling in precious metals futures yesterdday and helped depress the price of other commodities as well. The trade deficit figures were released Wednesday.

title: NASA Satellite Finds Numerous New Bodies Glowing With XRays
description: In the first four months of its operation, the Einstein satellite, officially called High Energy Astronomy Observatory 2, or HEAO2, has doubled the number of objects in the sky known to be aglow with Xrays, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration reported yesterday.

title: A Misguided Debate About Profits
description: As soon as the Government reported an explosion of 1978 corporate profits last week, George Meany attacked the Administration's wage guidelines as unfair to labor. He called for a rein on profits first. The President's chief inflation fighter, Alfred Kahn, agreed that a 26 percent rise in fourthquarter profits was catastrophic for the antiinflation program. And Hamilton Jordan of the White House opined that profits were unnecessarily high and required remedial action by the President.

title: Utility Infielder Had Expected to Be Traded
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 29  Richie Hebner played his first game today for the New York Mets, who immediately announced that Lenny Randle had ()laved his last one for them.

title: Bridge:
description: Terence Reese, the world's most prolific bridge author, continues to maintain a high standard. The latest effort by the Londoner, who has produced about 40 books on the game in the last 30 years, is entitled The Most Puzzling Situations in Bridge Play. It is published here by Sterling in hardcover at $5.95, a reasonable price for a book of British origin in these hard times.

title: Obituary 5  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Nuclear Insurers Confident
description: The insurers of nuclear power plants yesterday characterized the accident at the Three Mile Island plant in Pennsylvania as an inevitable mishap in an industry they regard as an excellent risk.

title: What Teamster Reformers Want
description: WASHINGTON  Despite public awareness of teamster corruption, most Americans still don't understand the problems teamster drivers face on the job and in the union.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Arabesque No. 1. Debussy; Sylvia, ?? from Act II. Delibes; Sonata for violin and Guitar No. 2, Paganini, Scipio, Overture. Handel.

title: Iran Winds Up Campaign to Get Out Voto. Today for an Islamic Republic
description: TEHERAN. Iran, March 19  The authorities mounted their final drive today to get out the vote for the referendum tomorrow and Saturday on the establishment of an Islamic republic. At the same time there were reports of more trouble from nonPersian ethnic groups in border areas.

title: A Rare Tasting of LafiteRothschild Wines
description: Tasting a selection of the wines of Chateau LafiteRothschild these days is something like road testing the Maserati Bora and the Porsche 928: an amusing indulgence with almost no bearing on reality.

title: Bonn Sets Increased Bank Rates
description: BONN, March 29  The West German central bank raised the country's discount rate today for the first time since 1973 as part of a move to contain rising inflation and high moneysupply growth, particularly in the face of climbing world oil prices.

title: C.A.B. Unit Clears Merger
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board's Bureau of Consumer Protection said today that it had dropped its opposition to the proposed merger of Southern Airways and North Central Airlines. A board attorney, Mary E. Downs, said the decision had been made after reviewing the record submitted by a C.A.B. law judge, Joseph J. Saunders, who recommended last month that the board approve the merger. The board expects to hear oral arguments in the case next month and hopes to have a final decision within several weeks.

title: Obituary 6  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Form for Small Stock Issuers
description: WASHINGTON, March 29  In an effort to help lure small business back into the capital markets, the Securities and Exchange Commission adopted today a simplified registration form for small stock issuers.

title: Milan:
description: MILAN, March 29  Three superlative collections made the trip worthwhile, according to store executives from the United States who attended the fall readytowear shows here this week: Fendi's imaginative furs, in sky blue, and sunset orange, are the tops in their field; Armani's tailored suits are probably the best in the world, and the Missonis knitted fashions have no peer, everybody agrees.

title: King of Malaysia at 62
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, March 28 (AP)  The King of Malaysia, Sultan Yahya Petra, died of a heart attack today at the national palace, the Malaysian Prime Minister announced. The Sultan, an elected monarch, was 62 years old.

title: Fort Dix to Be Honorably Discharged
description: Fort Dix, March 29  Forty years ago this month, nine elderly Army mules were judged to have outlived their usefulness and were condemned to death by the brass at this old Army base.

title: The Region
description: HEMPSTEAD, I..I  Plans for a second major development at Mitchell Field  an $8 million packagesorting plant for United Parcel Service that would employ about 1,000 people were announced.

title: Don King Testifies Against Boxing Bill
description: WASHINGTON, March 29  If boxing is on the wane, then its decline can be attributed to divisiveness among promoters, national and foreign boxing officials, television networks, its athletes and its fans, a Congressional committee was told today.

title: Uganda AT A GLANCE
description: Situated on the Equator between Zaire and Kenya in east Africa Uganda covers 91,134 square milk,. which is slightly smaller than the...combined area of New York and . Pennsylvania. Much of the land ?? on a grassy plateau up to 5,000 foot high, with a mountain range in the west and volcanoes in the southwest.

title: Art: Tribute to Klee, Microcosmic Giant
description: THE reputation of Paul Klee has suffered for years from what might be called the little work, little man syndrome. People simply can't believe that someone who worked very hard, but also worked very small can be in the big league as an artist.

title: Funny Finalists Stand Up for Laughs
description: Welcome. said Jimmy Brogan, the master of ceremonies, welcome to the Comic Strip. Where are you from? New Jersey? Oh, did they close down all the Korvettes tonight?

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: ALVIN S. BAMBERGER JR.

title: New G.M. Car to Get $100 Million Debut
description: DETROIT, March 29 The General Motors Corporation will begin next week a $100 million monthlong promotion of a new compact automobile that is to be the cornerstone of the company's product plans for the next decade. The introduction is the most expensive and extensive in the history of the industry.

title: Quarterbacks of Jets Are Kept in the Dark
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., March 29  Confusion emerged today from the New York Jets camp. where the club's three quarterbacks discovered that each was No. 1.

title: Virginia National Studies Bid
description: The management of Virginia National Bankshares Inc. said yesterday that it would probably take about two months to decide whether to accept an offer to by a European banking group to buy a 13 percent interest in the Norfolkbased bank holding company at price almost 40 percent above market value.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Pat Bradley L.P.G.A.'s Rich Loser
description: COSTA MESA, Calif., March 29 In her sixth year on the Ladies Professional Golf Association tour. Pat Bradley has already had what many pro golfers would consider a good season.

title: Petrofina Tax Status
description: For the third year in a row, Clarkson, Gordon & Company, a Canadian accounting firm, has issued a qualified auditor 's statement as part of the 1978 annual report of Petrofina Canada Ltd. As in the past, tax liabilities are involved. The accounting firm said that about $22.6 million was in dispute with Canadian tax officials.

title: For Children
description: SING A NEW SONG, sponsored by the Board of Jewish Education of Greater New York. Sunday at 1:30 P.M., with performances by metropolitan area choral groups, at the Beach Channel High School, 10001 Beach Channel Drive, Rockaway Park. Free. Information: 2458200.

title: Brezenoff, at H.R.A., Inheriting Huge and Troubled City Agency
description: Stanley Brezenoff, a tall, slender, goodnatured man, was overheard in a City Hall corridor the other day, asking an acquaintence whether he didn't look tired. Someone who overheard the conversation muttered, If he isn't now, he will be soon. The next morning a news report made it fairly clear that Mr. Brezenoff would replace Dr. Blanche Bernstein as head of the city's Human Rescurcos Administration.

title: A Tribute to Jacques Brel at Beacon
description: When the Belgian songwriter Jacques Brel died last October, Eric Blau  who, with Mort Shuman, made the English translations of Brel's songs that were the basis of the longrunning hit show of `the late 1960's Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris,  felt that the artist's passing should not go by without commemorating his achievements.

title: Joseph Leone, 61, Was the Head Of Glass Manufacturing Concern
description: Joseph Leone, glass company executive. died Tuesday of a heart attack at the Elmer (N.J.) Community Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived in Bridgeton, N.J.

title: For New York's Musicians, Life May Often Play a Dirge
description: If they're very lucky, they have permanent orchestra jobs. But there are not very many of those around. The notsolucky scramble  teaching, selling music or maybe shoes, copying parts, playing at weddings or in restaurants. They are freelance musicians if they are lucky

title: Howard Sterne Is Dead
description: Howard Sterne, who became a pilot in the early days of aviation, died Tuesday in the Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital. He was 84 years old and lived in the Mews Retirement Home in Greenwich.

title: Samuel Roth, Engineer
description: Samuel Roth, a civil engineer and former president of the RothBuermann Company, died Monday in a nursing home in Hollywood, Fla. He was 82 years old and lived in Hallandale, Fla.

title: News Summary
description: FRIDAY, MARCH 30, 1979

title: Notes on People
description: Representative Peter A. Peyser, who recently instituted a monthly Monkey Wrench Award, to a Federal agency that throws monkey wrenches into the workings of government, has had a monkey wrench thrown into his scheme.

title: Atomic Plant Is Still Emitting Radioactivity
description: MIDDLETOWN, Pa., Friday, March 30  Radioactivity continued to leak from the crippled Three Mile Island atomic plant near here yesterday, and early today large amounts of water containing small amounts of radioactivity were released into the Susquehanna River to relieve pressure on the plant's holding tanks.

title: Islanders Trounced By Black Hawks, 61
description: CHICAGO, March 29  There was a bedsheet banner hanging from the upper balcony in Chicago Stadium tonight that read: Bring Back Bobby Hull.

title: World News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, March 29  The United States and Canada signed four agreements today that they hope will end the fishing war off the Atlantic Coast and resolve two of many fishing and other marine issues between the two Governments off their West Coasts.

title: Business and the Law
description: KEY BISCAYNE, FLA. IT has become almost an article of faith among lawyers who work for big businesses that something must be done about rising legal costs before lawyers are priced out of the market.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: The teamsters union and the trucking industry moved closer to a contract agreement as the Government indicated for the first time that it was prepared to be flexible in applying its wage guidelines to a settlement. [Page A1.)

title: LEGISLATURE VOTES CONVENTION CENTER FOR NEW YORK CITY
description: ALBANY, March 29  The State Legislature approved a plan today to construct a $375 million convention and exhibition center in New York City.

title: Bhutto Meets With a New Defeat In Bid to Overturn Death Sentence
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, March 29 Former Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto suffered another defeat today in his bid to overturn his death sentence, and his attorney said, The legal battle is over.

title: India Says Rise for Oil Will Hurt
description: NEW DELHI, March 29  Indian leaders have ordered immediate measures to prevent the country's economy from collapsing because of the increase in the price of oil by exporting countries.

title: Critics Choices: What's Best in Town This Weekend
description: A choice is not precisely the same thing as a recommendation. The point, a kind of buyer's caution that should be attached to any critic's review, should be obvious, but it is not Often, even generally, the distinction is academic, but in the case of Wings and Sweeney Todd perhaps it should be repeated. I found both of these works extraordinary, but I am aware that neither one is universally palatable.

title: Molly Picon, Still Going Strong at 81, Recreates Her Greatest Stage Moments
description: Molly Picon is going those tellall autobiographies one better. Sunday night, she's raising the curtain on her allsinging, alldancing, allacting life story  a saga stretching back across threequarters of a century, to the days when she was Baby Margaret, aged 5, performing in a Philadelphia vaudeville house for 50 cents a night.

title: WASHINGTON What Did Carter Promise?
description: WASHINGTON, March 29  It seemed a little odd just before the wedding ceremony for Prime Minister Begin of Israel to ask the United States to come to his aid in case of divorce; then, naturally, President Sadat of Egypt did not regard it as an expression of confidence in his good faith.

title: U.S. Aides Face a New Life in Taiwan
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 28  The building is a squat temporary center for the military with a forest of aerials reaching high into the sky. A halfdozen limp palm trees stretch into the damp air, while stray dogs sniff for scraps at the back.

title: IN THE NATION To Save Amtrak
description: What's the best way to preserve Amtrak, the semigovernrrental rail passenger system?

title: Albany Panel Urges the Assessing Of All Property at Full Valuation
description: ALBANY, March 29  A commission appointed by Governor Carey and legislative leaders has recommended that the state move toward equal, fullvalue assessment for all property, an action that could shift hundreds of millions of dollars in tax costs to homeowners from the owners of commercial and industrial property

title: 2,000 Flee 2 Boston Hotel Fires
description: BOSTON, March 29 (AP)  Fires, set at two downtown hotels early today. injured 64 persons, 13 of them seriously and four critically, and sent 2,000 others into the streets. Late today an 18yearold former dishwasher and busboy was arrested and charged with arson.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: A New View of RomeKoch Feud
description: Before Mayor Koch dismissed him as chairman of the Offtrack Betting Corporation for publicly opposing the legalization of casino gambling, Bernard Rome had expressed his opposition privately and in milder words than he subsequently spoke in public.

title: Dance: Imaginative Falco Program at City Center
description: THERE was more of Louis Falco himself in the Louis Falco Dance Company on Wednesday night than at the opening the preceding day at the City Center 55th Street Theater, and the difference was felt immediately.

title: Stage: Ayckbourn's Bedroom Farce
description: AS a title for the play by Alan Ayckbourne that opened yesterday at the Brooks Atkinson Theater. Bedroom Farce is both accurate and misleading. It is a farce, and of the first and most delightful order; and there are three large beds in it.

title: Nuclear Accident Is Laid to Failure Of Several Safety Systems at Plant
description: WASHINGTON, March 29  Federal officials said today that the failure of several safety systems combined at a nuclear power plant near Harrisburg, Pa., to cause what is regarded as the most serious accident in the United States drive to harness atomic power for civilian purposes.

title: Companies Report Earnings
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the Americar Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: 57 Old Masters to Tour
description: A major collection of 57 Old Master paintings that has not been exhibited in the United States  including canvases by El Greco, Goya, Rembrandt, Rubens and Titian  will begin a twoyear American tour next November with a show at the National Gallery of Art in Washington.

title: Iran's 3 Governments
description: PARIS, March 29The result of the referendum in Iran tomorrow is not in doubt: The majority is expected to vote for replacement of the monarchy by an as yet undefined Islamic republic. But it is doubtful if the referendum will end the political deadlock and allow some degree of cooperation between the three contending social forces that have their own separate de facto provisional governments.

title: Pentagon Plans Wide Closings of Bases
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (AP)  The Defense Department, continuing a costcutting drive that has spanned the administrations of three Presidents, proposed widespread military base closings and consolidations today with the aim of saving $474 million a year.

title: Fewer Securities Held By Fed for Foreigners
description: The sharp drop in the Federal Reserve Bank of New York's holdings of United States Government securities for foreign accounts, which continued in the latest reporting week, probably reflects a decline in oil exports by Iran and a strengthening of the dollar, according to foreignexchange analysts.

title: Pop: Legends of Jazz
description: DESPITE its title, 1,000 Years of Jazz, the New Orleans Revue that opened Wednesday evening at the Entermedia Theater, does not try to trace jazz back to 979. Rather, the thousand years represents the purported total ages of the members of the cast  a sixman jazz group, the Legends of Jazz, that includes an 80yearold trumpeter, Andrew Blakeney, and a 76yearold trombonist, Louis Nelson; the Hoofers, five dancers who, without revealing their ages, give evidence of plenty of experience, and, as contrast, a young singer, Denise Delapenha.

title: Publishing: A Director Takes Author's Role
description: FOR Robert Lewis, 1979 marks a double milestone: his 70th birthday and his 50th year in the theater. Mr. Lewis started as an actor with the Civic Repertory Theater in 1929, and in the ensuing decades acted in such plays and movies as Golden Boy and The Ziegfeld Follies. Later on, he directed a great number of plays, including Brigadoon, My Heart's in the Highlands and Teahouse of the August Moon. But Mr. Lewis is not allowing his two anniversaries to slow him down. If anything, his schedule is more crowded than ever.

title: E.E.C. Warned On Japan Trade
description: BRUSSELS, March 29 (Reuters)  A confidential Common Market report leaked to the press today described Japan as a nation of work maniacs and forecast that action to limit its exports to the European Economic Community might be needed by fall.

title: Port Unit Seeks A 50Cent Fare On PATH Line
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey said yesterday that it intended to raise fares on its transHudson rail commuter line in a twostep move that would increase the 30cent fare to 50 cents by the middle of next year.

title: Senate Finishes Action On Ties With Taiwan
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (AP) The Senate completed Congressional action today on legislation establishing informal relations with Taiwan and serving notice on Peking that the security of the island was of grave concern to the United States.

title: Rich Yank Staff Has No Room for Mirabella
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 29  One week before the start of the season, Paul Mirabella has not learned whether he will start that season in New York as a lefthanded relief replacement for Sparky Lyle or in Columbus, Ohio, as a puzzled, disappointed minor leaguer.

title: U.S. Wheat Order Canceled by China
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (AP)  China has canceled an order for wheat from the United States, according to the Agriculture Department, but a department official said today that this did not signal any drop in future exports of United States farm goods to China.

title: United Buys FrenchU.S. Jet Engines
description: United Airlines announced yesterday a $400 million order for a new FrenchAmerican turbofan engine that will replace current engines on 30 of its DC8 planes and thereby mean large savings in consumption of fuel.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Israelis, While Welcoming Peace, Fear the Price Will Be Severe Inflation and Lower Standard of Living
description: JERUSALEM, March 29  A few days ago, Yeruham Meshel. Israel's labor leader, warned that the peace treaty with Egypt could dangerously widen income disparities in Israel.

title: Alexander's Guilty Plea On Imports
description: Alexander's Inc., the department store chain, pleaded guilty in court in Manhattan yesterday to a Federal charge of customs fraud involving the importing of thousands of television sets from Japan.

title: Steel Union, Making Concession, Backs Plant's Reopening in Ohio
description: WASHINGTON, March 29  The United Steelworkers of America, whose leaders have at times been skeptical of an attempt by a religious group to reopen a steel plant in Campbell, Ohio, today threw its support behind the effort, which would include cutting seniority rights and personnel levels to make the plant competitive.

title: Nuclear Foes See Grave Risk in Pennsylvania Mishap, but Utility Aides Are Unalarmed
description: MIDDLETOW'N, Pa., March 29 This is the best possible place for you to be  it is radioactively impregnable. Robert G. Reid told his students this morning in the corridors at Middletown High School.

title: Broadway
description: MICKEY ROONEY will make his debut on Broadway. He and Ann Miller (she has been on Broadway before) will be in Sugar Babies, which is in rehearsal and is being produced by Terry Allen Kramer and Harry Rigby. Sugar Babies will open at the Curran Theater in San Francisco in May, go on to the Pantages in Los Angeles in June, and then skip through a few more cities until it opens in New York in the fall. Mr. Rigby variously describes it as either the ultimate burlesque show or the big burlesque show in the sky, and when he is feeling particularly flowery, he likens it to an American commedia dell arte. He means it is supposed to be a nice, clean family show, although presumably Miss Miller will hit Mr. Rooney on stage a few times with a bladder.

title: Piano: Eden and Tamir
description: THE idea behind the musical marathon is at best questionable. Why do people who presumably love Bach, say, elect to sit for mindnumbing hours while his music is dished up to them in seemingly endless helpings, like so much sausage churned out of a machine? The impulse to do this is probably similar to that of record buyers who feel driven to own the complete works of their favorites, handsomely boxed, if possible. Sometimes, this may be simple, uncritical hero worship, but probably as often it is the folly of the obsessive collector, whose satisfactions may not primarily be musical.

title: Justice Dept. to Modify Proposed Code of Ethics
description: WASHINGTON, March 29  The Justice Department has agreed to modify a proposed new Government code of ethics that has brought on a wave of threats of resignations by some top Federal officials.

title: Market Place
description: IT is widely believed that a major reason the stock market has been in the doldrums for the last five years is that investors are convinced that the United States has lost control of its fate in becoming increasingly dependent upon Middle Eastern oil.

title: Visit With a Living Landmark
description: VERO BEACH, Fla.  Andy Messersmith is a living landmark standing 6 feet 1, weighing 200 pounds, wearing No. 47 in Dodger blue on his white playsuit. He is not the only baseball player who can read nor the only one with principles nor the only one with the courage of his convictions, but the other one is selling Volkswagens in Billings, Mont.

title: The U.N. Today
description: March 30. 1979

title: Argentine Army Eases Iron Rule
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 29  The prisons where the Argentine military holds thousands of people seized by the security forces are being painted in preparation for a visit by the InterAmerican Human Rights Commission.

title: Thomas McCance Dead
description: Thomas McCance, a general partner in the private banking concern of Brown Brothers Harriman & Company, died in his sleep Wednesday at his home in Mountain Lake, Lake Wales, Fla. He was 76 years old and had also lived in Mount Kisco, N.Y., and Fishers Island, L.I.

title: Auctions
description: THE appetite of collectors for spectacular jewels seems insatiable these days. judging by, among other things, the proliferation of auctions of jewelry and the escalation of gem prices throughout the world. Next week what promises to be a lively spring for jewelry auctions opens with two sales on Wednesday. The first, at 10 A.M. in the William Doyle Galleries, 175 East 87th Street, presents $1 million worth of jewelry. Among the top offerings are a 5carat diamond ring (it may sell for up to $125,000), a pair of emerald and diamond earclips (up to $100,000) and an 80carat sapphire ring (up to $60,000). The second auction is a twoday event, Wednesday at 2 P.M. and Thursday at 10:15 A.M. and 2 P.M., at Sotheby Parke Bernet, Madison Avenue, at 76th Street. Among the many splendid gems and settings is a stunning ruby and diamond necklace, an early Art Deco design by Cartier that incorporates 68 rubies, 14 emeraldcut diamonds and 300 smaller diamonds. It is estimated that it will sell for up to $800,000. Notable, too. is a pair of pinwheelshape diamond earclips consigned by the estate of Joan Payson Whitney; it may bring as much as $350,000. There are two diamond rings of importance, one dominated by a 12carat oval rock (it may go for up to $275,000), the other by an emeraldcut, 7carat diamond (the estimate is up to $225,000). For those who care more about the design than the carats, there are at least two pieces worth investigating: a platinum and diamond brooch in the shape of a Maltese cross by David Webb, consigned by Ethel Redner Scull (expected to sell for as much as $25,000), and a suite of gold, diamond and blackonyx jewelry (bracelet, ring and earclips) signed

title: Art People
description: SOMEONE not easy to pin down is R.B. Kitaj, whose exhibition of 50 pastels and drawings opens tomorrow at the Marlborough Gallery. Kitaj was born and is still an American, though he bears a Russian name. He lives in London, but keeps a large house in a side street in a town on the Mediterranean coast of Spain. When in this country he is likely to be either at a ball game or in one of the antiquarian bookstores for which he has particularly good nose. Europeans stand in line to get a painting, a drawing or a print from his hand, but he discourages retrospectives, turns down every proposition for a book, and prefers not to be photographed.

title: Pull Over, Officer
